Subject: [sfraves] Weekend Review... 7 Deadly Sins Was Sooooooo Dope! Hello 2Day!!

Yeah... I know it lke mondo 2 soon 2 post my weekend update already being thatit was only Friday night, but I know 4 a fact that I"m not goin' out anymore this weekend so I can do my homework for school... oh yeah... I re-entered University Of Phoenix 'cause they started a new well... la la la... I"m back in again...

Anywaze, OK.. I know it's like hella early that I got home from the party, but a non Groover, only likes Melodic Trance, total wall flower unless he's on drugs @ a party friend luckily went with me to the party!  So yeah... I kinda like mondo lucked out last minute in actually getting a ride there 'cause seriously... this party was very Momumental (is that the right word I looking 4?) & somewhat historic for our scene in so many ways & I soooo could not miss it!

BUt yeah.. got there early to pay the b4 10:00 PM fee... it was Groovy... no one was really spinning yet although Arson was totally scratchin it up in the Jungle room!!

OK... I won't mention all the DJs I saw spin earlier, but the ones who totally got me Groovin'!  During the 1st part of the party, in the Breakbeats room there was this Dude do a tag set... I guess this DJ's name is Kris Kent & man... he was playing some Awesome tracks!!  I mean... it was Dope 'cause every record he played was one of my favorite songs!   He spun alot of Future Break tracks but man... it was so yummy that I was so hard to stay still!

Ooooooh My Goodness.. Hello 2Day... 1 of my favorite Jungle DJs from Sac spun @ the party... E.M.P.!!!  Hell fuckin' yeah man!!  I mean... this DJ was the DJ @ the snow shindig earlier this year in the mountains who spun the most amazing Jungle set I ever heard this year!!  Since then, we hung out once in Berk by chance!  Anywaze... his set was Damn Sick!!  I Loved it!!  I mean... it was kinda like divided in 2 parts kinda... from what I could tell.  He spun the 1st 1/2 like w/ alota Raga Jungle & OK... I'm still tryin' 2 learn what Tek Step actually sounds like... but I think he played alota that to during this part!  Then the 2nd 1/2 had alota just hard hitting, mean sounding Jungle that oooh man... I Love it!  Oh Yeah.. his costume was like this I dunno... an S&M Pirate??

Oracle's set was Amazing! He started out spinning Jungle! I'm sure I heard a few classic tracks, totally smooth hard beats, then he went into some harder Jungle tunes... then his set went into Techno... well wait... I mighta heard a breakcore tune somewhere in between that though... then from Techno he went into this totally hard hitting Funky House... played some Psy Trance in there then back to House!! WoW.. I Loved this set!!  I mean... all the music Oracle weaved together was totally smooth and jus' well ya know... it one of those Journey sets where like he started here, but like went on this Awesome Adventure & totally ended up there!!  Dope!

What sucked was EMP & Oracle started spinning @ the same time & I jus' totally had to keep switching rooms!!  BUt it was totally worth it!!  

Dymphna spun a Dope set.  It was Hard Ass Jungle all the way through & welll... her set was pretty early in the night, but it set the tone for the room!  It was Dope 'cause she closed w/ the Jungle Remake of Sean Paul's 1st single... "Shake That Thing" is the name of it, right?

Oh yeah...  ..COM & Mainframe from LA totally spun this wicked Hard Ass Raga Jungle set for what I was there for... I mean.... the crowd was pretty built up in there @ that point & hella people were dancing!  MC Red October was pretty CooL 2!  I mean... he totally switched up his styles of MCing & it was all smooth!

So yeah... those were the DJs who totally filled me up man!!  I Loved it!

The crowd was pretty eclectic & diverse, but it was totally good energy & Mondo Groovy vibes from everyone while I was there man!  It wasn't like this Huge Mini Massive dealie or totally empty, but it was just the right size!  I met alot of Awesome people earlier, got to know some people better who I've hung out w/ a few times, an ofcourse, there was Mondo Family there tonight that Totally fills my Heart when we get 2gether like this!

OK... but here's what Totally trip me out & made me actually Happier about the party!  There were 2 people there who I haven't seen in years!  The 1st person I bumped in2 was this Dude Tremel... We went to college together like back in the day.  @ 1st, I thought he was someone I thought was from my high school years, but this picture I took of us in video class 1 time like suddenly came to mind like seeing his face totally popped that photo in my head!  So yeah... the next time we bumped in2 each other, I totally appologized for bein' a dumb fuck & not remembering him right away & we actually caught up on a few things about each other as of lately!

Then while I was kickin' it in the smoking area... this girl walks up to me!  She said she knew who I was & said that I would know who she was when she told me her name was Katherine!!  Good Shit, Katherine was 1 of my co-workers when I worked @ Reel.com cooporate & we became hella good friends!  We stayed in touch 4 a while after I stopped working there then eventually lost touch but got back in touch through, Hello 2Day, FRIENDSTER!  LoL  BUt yeah.. this was the 1st time in 3 years we saw each other & man... So Dope!

OK... Decorations... WOW... Each Room totally fit the Deadly Sin it was named after!  Tomb stones, cob webs, Awesome visuals, Bad Ass lighting in the main room, and everything was well... it was like a mixture of Cartoons & Asain design & well, Halloween!

OK... sorry this was like way 2 long... but man... this party was Awesome!!  I mean... with the Groovy things that happened tonight & Music that was So Dope, it makes me like mondo proud of what we got!

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

--

Subject: [sfraves] Oh yeah... the costumes

So yeah, like nearly everyone @ 7 Deadly Sins were guzzied up in something!  I noticed there were like alota "couple themed" costumes!  Just 2 name a few: a guy decked out in formalish J Crew clothes wearing a crown & a girl wearin' like a brides maid/prom dress & I thought they were the king & queen of the prom, this dude in Zombie make-up wearing a tuxedo & this girl in a pretty dress with Awesome Blue streaks in her hair looked like they were ghosts from Titanic, A Dude dresses as a priest & another dude in a demon get up, apart they looked like normal trick or treator, but together they made sense as Good & Evil...

Miki costume was Dope... she was a wind up doll with an actual wind thingie on her back, Oracle was well... I dressed in 70's garb & I was tryin' 2 figure out if he looked like a Brady Brother or a Partridge Boy... Tina aka MoonChyld was a fem bot... oh yeah... there was alota fake fur goin' on @ the party also!  Dymphna was Tank Girl!

The costume I was thinking of doing was a picture frame, but construction on that from when I decided to do that would of been limited!  Then I decided on being a dice, but materials for that was like well... I didn't have enough materials for that.  So I jus' took my vampire teeth, wore black clothes, my Customatix shoes, & this olive-y green polyester dress jacket & I was the Polyester Cat Walk Fasion Model Vampire!

Then there were alota sexy nightie gown girls, oh, there was this clown mime, & I think 1 of my favorites of the night was this Dude who was freom San Diego & he was a Pepridge Farm Goldfish!  Oh yeah, Dodja was a "cereal killer"; he wore cereal boxes on his shirt w/ knives sticking out of them & blood stains all around!  Oh Yeah... then there was Veronica who was that evil lady in 101 Dalmations!!

Everyone at the party was pretty much animated!  It was Fun!!  OK.. I'm done =)  LoL

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] Thusday Night: Thirsty Bear and Bad Kitty

I started school again last Thursday.  I mean, I had to like re-enter University of Phoenix 'cause of the appendix drama that happened 2 months ago & I had to drop.  So now I"m back there again basically starting over & redoing the class I like did 1/2 way before, but now my class nights are on Thursday instead of MOnday.

But it's Groovy 'cause ofcourse it means that I could go out dancing a lil' b4 I head back to the East Bay, ya know!  So after class, I went directly to Thirsty Bear!  That was fun!!  There were a few family folks hangin out there, there was yummy House music playing, & it was fun!  BUt the only place you could dance was upstairs and there was a private party going on so I could dance there!  Oh yeah... I don't remember who the DJ was, but man, he played some nice laid back funky house tunes!  But I did feel like hella bad I missed Cubik Y Origami do their live set =(

So After socializing for a while, I went strait to Bad Kitty @ Anu!  Wow... LoL... that place is pretty nice!  As soon as I got in there, Seraphim was spinning some old skool Beastie Boys!!  Dope!  Then she started up the Electro Clash... YUMMY!  It's fun dancing to Electro Clash 'cause it's almost like well... I was doin' alota mod stuff from like the 80s... lol

Then Samira went on & busted out the Hard, New Skool Breakbeats in her set!  She totally kept it up for most of her set!  Then she went in2, what I know her best for, the Dreamy Breakbeats with like alota soft, sustained instruments & this funky 2-4 beat!  This was a fun set!

J-Rock went on next & kept it on with the hard, new skool breakbeats!  I could sworn that he slipped in sme old skool tracks in there as well!!  But what really got me was the last track he played!!! 2 Step!!  I Loved it!

There wasn't too many people there on Thursday.  Oh My Goodness man, it was Groovy though 'cause there was this one kid there that said soemthing to the effect that sine this was Seraphim's night @ Anu, he had to support 'cause he's a huge fan of hers!!  Sweet!  The bartendaer there, Mohall {sp}, is pretty so nice! 

I mean... this was like my 1st time ever going to this event, but man, I totally missed Seraphim so much!  So yeah... this may be my after class hang out before I head home!!!  

Seriously... this is a fun lil' Thursday night hotspot to check out!!!  The music's always gonna be good 'cause you got 2 Groovy residents; Seraphim & Feliz Da Dog (woof woof).

Oh yeah... thanks 2 everyone who gave me birthday gifts that night!!!  Hello 2Day, Nico & Pedro, you 2 fuckin' Rock...Thanks! =)

Good Stuff!

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

At 10:55 PM 10/30/2003, shawn allen wrote:

>quoth Starchild:
> > Finally, this is a bit of a side note, but I think the nationalism
> > implied by language like "our" troops -- as if the lives of American
> > soldiers are more important than the lives of the Iraqi civilians --
> > is unfortunate.
>
>I agree with that 100%. We've lost what, a little more than 300 lives
>total?  Some international aid organizations put the Iraqi death toll
>before May 1st at nearly 8,000. More Iraqi's die every day that we're
>there, either shot by edgy young soldiers or blown up in attempts by
>loyalists to wear down the occupying forces.
>
> > Saddam Hussein killed lots of "his" own people, and despite the tragic
> > loss of civilian lives during and after the war, I believe that more
> > innocent people probably would have died in the long run had the
> > Baathist regime not been ousted.


Counting the human cost

Total war dead (Iraq)

Between 10,800 and 15,100, with a midpoint of 12,950

Combatants killed (Iraq)

Between 7,600 and 10,800, with a midpoint of 9,200

Noncombatants killed (Iraq)

Between 3,200 and 4,300, with a midpoint of 3,750

War dead (Baghdad)

Between 4,376 and 5,726, with a midpoint of 5,051

Combatants killed (Baghdad)

Between 2,224 and 3,531, with a midpoint of 2,878

Noncombatants killed (Baghdad)

Between 1,990 and 2,357, with a midpoint of 2,174

· Source: Project on Defence Alternatives research

<http://www.comw.org/pda>www.comw.org/pda





Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"They can get all the synthesizers they want, but nothing will ever take 
the place of the human heart."
-Johnny Cash

Subject: [sfraves] BSP - Come join the .newstylesound. .recordings. announce list!  (dj2, Origami, Cubik, Loopsurgeon)

I'm starting a little low-traffic announce/discussion list so that
people can have an easy way to know when one of the .newstylesound.
artists are playing out, when we've got a new release about to drop,
etc.  I'd estimate 1-5 posts per month, unless a bunch of people sign
up and some kind of interesting discussion pops up :)

Get hooked up at:
http://lists.djorigami.com/listinfo.cgi/newstylesound-announce-djorigami.com

If you'd like to know what Origami, Cubik, Loopsurgeon, dj2, or any
other NSS folks are up to, please subscribe!  I promise not to spam
you.

Also, if anyone would like a newstylesound sticker or two, hit me up
and I'll drop 'em in the mail.  They are blue on white, with the same
NSS logo you can see at djorigami.com.

Cheers,
George C. 
www.djorigami.com

Subject: [sfraves] 7 deadly sins revu


7 deadly sins was lots of fun.

The space was well decorated and varied in mood atmosphere. 

Big ups to the pangea / eden collective.  Thank you for a wonderful event.

The Highlights of the event were Rexual Healing and Oracle (soon to be known as Adam Weaver).  The track selection was off the hizzle and mixing was top notch.

Thanks for bringing dj Assault.  A very nice man indeed.  A true entertainer getting on the mic often to get and keep the crowd peak'd.  More west coast dj's should do this.  I know there are a lot of talented mc's out there doing it, but having the dj get on the mic actually works well.  dj's take note.

I saw alotsa friends there and was having a great time with them.

the schedule was thrown off a bit and I couldn't stay to see Praxis.  he is one of my favorite live acts.

guess i will just have to be satisfied with his records for now.

love always wins over the darkest hearts.
JOnas

ght
somehow compare the style of the Warp Brothers to Prodigy or Chemical
Brothers but the truth is that they created their own creative and unique
sound, like you can read in an article of the Face magazine. =0D
=0D
Although the Warp Brothers are friendly people - they are in possession o=
f a
lethal weapon, which is called Harder House. =0D
=0D
Remarkable is their success in the UK sales-charts #9 and Top 10 position=
s
in several Sales -Charts.In Denmark they were rewarded with gold. Undoubt=
ed
the Warpies as they are keenly called by their fans turn it up on stage! =
=0D
=0D
 =0D
=46rom New York.... =0D
DJ DRC =0D
San Francisco's Pioneer DJ DRC has relocated to New York City and is gear=
ed
up to take the Electronic Music Industry by storm. With her Mixed Album=20
UNDEFINED" in the works and a list of releases on IMIX, Vision Music, Off
World, Merge, Twin Soul and her own label Undefined Musik, DRC equivocate=
s
the expeditious pace of her new stomping grounds. Her original music is a=
lso
featured in two movies, "Vision of Vibe" with Carl Cox and "Intellect" be=
ing
released this February 2003, featuring Paul Van Dyk and many others. DRC'=
s
latest single SEEKER can be heard on the SPANKEE clothing line website. W=
ith
all this under her belt and more, it is obvious DRC has already had her
finger on the pulse of the Big Apple/ Manhattan. =0D
DRC Returns to S.F. for a special set at COLD PHUSION! =0D

From sfraves-return-107864-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon Nov 03 18:39:07 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-107864-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 91616 invoked by uid 1103); 3 Nov 2003 18:39:06 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 91586 invoked from network); 3 Nov 2003 18:39:06 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [67.119.87.60]
X-Originating-Email: [electrofunk138@hotmail.com]
From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Mon, 03 Nov 2003 10:39:02 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <BAY8-F644gTtso91Dpg00035d96@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Nov 2003 18:39:04.0714 (UTC) FILETIME=[C1F106A0:01C3A239]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!

Holy fucking shit is all I can say. Otherworld and Tenderloft pulled off a 
SEVERELY kickin' party Friday night.

I arrived to the warehouse a smidge on the early side, and it was a beehive 
of activity. People running to and fro doing last minute prep work. They 
were just barely finishing up when people started to arrive, but things just 
kind of fell into place, and the next thing you knew, the party was in full 
swing.

This party had a really old skooly kinda vibe to it. Everyone was very 
friendly, the music was pumping, but it didn't have the overproduced massive 
feel to it at all. It was still very homey and raw. This was the 1st party 
in a LONG TIME that I just kind of met people all night randomly. (you 
people all know who you are, please for the love of god do NOT make me do a 
"shout out"...lol).

The music is what really cinched it for me tho...some of the best tunes I 
have heard in a long time as well.

Mutex started off with some hard techno and kinda got people in the mood to 
party. The next person I caught was Nemo, who played some really nice D&B. I 
believe after him was DJ M who also played some decent D&B. I was still kind 
of getting adjusted to everything at this point, so I didn't have time to 
properly observe any of the dj's. The 1st act i caught that I could pay 
attention to was Azeem. After Shortbus had played me some of Azeem's stuff 
the week before, I was itching to see what he was like live, and damn if 
that guy didn't deliver the goods! It's nice to hear hip-hop on a soundsytem 
that is big enough to pump, but not so huge that the sound just kinda of 
turns into a mess. Azeem and DJ Zeph kept it live and funky their whole set. 
I managed to slip into the main room during Azeems set to check out John 
Tejada, who was dropping some of the funkiest techno & tech-house I have 
ever heard. That motherfucker was mixin' smooth as buttah, and not even 
breakin' a sweat. He had the dancefloor positively jumping. I made it 
upstairs to the chill room to catch a house DJ who was pretty damn good, but 
unfortunately was being plagued by technical difficulties. Never got the 
guys name, but he was pretty fucking good despite the problems. I had never 
seen Jon Williams, so I worked my way back downstairs to catch some of him, 
and godamm the guy was just bangin' it. Gritty, dirty, sexy, bangin' techno. 
My new mission in the next few weeks is to pick up some of the stuff he was 
dropping, cuz it was fucking ILL. Made my hair stand on end!!!! I also 
caught a few minutes of the infamous RedStickMan as he dropped booty house 
and worked his way into NEW ORDER (yay, my favorite!). I was kind of running 
on empty tho, and had to find a place to gather my few remaining braincells, 
so off I went in search of a quiet spot...

The night for me is kind of a blur. I was running around trying to absorb as 
much as I could, meet as many people as I could, and have fun...all of which 
I managed to do. Definately one of the better parties I have been to in a 
LONG time. One of the best parts for me was seeing the smiles on all the 
Otherworld crew' faces as they went about their various duties through the 
night. These were the smiles of people who were happy with the results of 
their efforts, and since I was witness to their efforts, I know they busted 
their asses, and deserved to have those smiles at the end of the night.

Anyhoo....big BIG ups to Otherworld and Tenderloft for properly introducing 
me to Bay Area partying. I had a fucking BLAST, and will definately be 
around for anything else you throw at us.....

Respect.

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Substructure
DC/MD/VA/CA
http://www.djmarcom.com
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
AIM: OPKing138

Subject: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!(part 2)

How could I have forgot two of the BEST parts of the evening???? See what 
happens when my little brain gets taxed too hard? lol

Ok... I caught two other acts that blew my mind Friday night. 1st off, and 
most importantly Andres Octavio...the guy played the illest dub set I have 
ever heard. I've heard tons of dub house sets, but this was just str8 up 
dub, and it was SLEAZY. So fucking deep, dark, nasty and kinky it wasn't 
even funny. Fucking blew my mind. And the guy is HELLA nice to boot. Also, 
Freaky Chakra did a live set that was pretty godamm on point. He played a 
little less electro than I wanted to hear, but he was workin' it 
nonetheless. Even tho he was just rocking a laptop, a sequencer and a couple 
other little pieces of gear, he looked like he was busy creating a monster. 
Met him at the end of the night, and he was extremely genuine and nice.

Once again, let me reiterate how fucking sick this party 
was....FAN-FUCKINGTASTIC!!!!

M-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!(part 2)

Well, for as long as I have been a dancer (years!) I still have trouble identifying the various types of EDM, let alone the numerous DJs in the scene.

So, I just let the music move me.

I gave up on wondering (or figuring out) who's playing what.

But your review was right on the money. Thanks for providing these details.

I just know that I couldn't stop dancing, all night long, and I kept running back and forth between the rooms. Plus the D&B was some of the best I have heard lately. 

Also, the decorations had the Halloween spirit (for example, a graveyard in the smoking room), and the vibe was incredible. I kept seeing people that I know from all over the rave scene. 

Seems to me that this crew really had their act together and they pulled it off quite nicely. I had a big smile on my face all night long. I was the happy dancer.

Greg VP
aim: poloraveboi

> >do a "shout out"...lol).
> >
> >The music is what really cinched it for me tho...some of the best tunes I 
> >have heard in a long time as well.
> >
> >Mutex started off with some hard techno and kinda got people in the mood to 
> >party. The next person I caught was Nemo, who played some really nice D&B. 
> >I believe after him was DJ M who also played some decent D&B. I was still 
> >kind of getting adjusted to everything at this point, so I didn't have time 
> >to properly observe any of the dj's. The 1st act i caught that I could pay 
> >attention to was Azeem. After Shortbus had played me some of Azeem's stuff 
> >the week before, I was itching to see what he was like live, and damn if 
> >that guy didn't deliver the goods! It's nice to hear hip-hop on a 
> >soundsytem that is big enough to pump, but not so huge that the sound just 
> >kinda of turns into a mess. Azeem and DJ Zeph kept it live and funky their 
> >whole set. I managed to slip into the main room during Azeems set to check 
> >out John Tejada, who was dropping some of the funkiest techno & tech-house 
> >I have ever heard. That motherfucker was mixin' smooth as buttah, and not 
> >even breakin' a sweat. He had the dancefloor positively jumping. I made it 
> >upstairs to the chill room to catch a house DJ who was pretty damn good, 
> >but unfortunately was being plagued by technical difficulties. Never got 
> >the guys name, but he was pretty fucking good despite the problems. I had 
> >never seen Jon Williams, so I worked my way back downstairs to catch some 
> >of him, and godamm the guy was just bangin' it. Gritty, dirty, sexy, 
> >bangin' techno. My new mission in the next few weeks is to pick up some of 
> >the stuff he was dropping, cuz it was fucking ILL. Made my hair stand on 
> >end!!!! I also caught a few minutes of the infamous RedStickMan as he 
> >dropped booty house and worked his way into NEW ORDER (yay, my favorite!). 
> >I was kind of running on empty tho, and had to find a place to gather my 
> >few remaining braincells, so off I went in search of a quiet spot...
> >
> >The night for me is kind of a blur. I was running around trying to absorb 
> >as much as I could, meet as many people as I could, and have fun...all of 
> >which I managed to do. Definately one of the better parties I have been to 
> >in a LONG time. One of the best parts for me was seeing the smiles on all 
> >the Otherworld crew' faces as they went about their various duties through 
> >the night. These were the smiles of people who were happy with the results 
> >of their efforts, and since I was witness to their efforts, I know they 
> >busted their asses, and deserved to have those smiles at the end of the 
> >night.
> >
> >Anyhoo....big BIG ups to Otherworld and Tenderloft for properly introducing 
> >me to Bay Area partying. I had a fucking BLAST, and will definately be 
> >around for anything else you throw at us.....
> >
> >Respect.
> >
> >Marc(O)
> >*THWAP!*//Substructure
> >DC/MD/VA/CA
> >http://www.djmarcom.com
> >deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
> >AIM: OPKing138
> >
> >_________________________________________________________________
> >Cheer a special someone with a fun Halloween eCard from American Greetings! 
> >Go to  http://www.msn.americangreetings.com/index_msn.pd?source=msne134

Subject: [sfraves] Sweet! - Moving Forward

Content-Type: text/plain; x-avg-checked=avg-ok-174B2D0B; charset=us-ascii; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit


>
>Lost Tribe Presents . . .
>
>is still reeling from the abrupt cancellation of our Halloween event.
>All of the tickets had been distributed, Bruce from JK had spent many hours
>fine-tuning the sound systems, Mike Clay had spent hours setting up and 
>preparing the visuals,
>The DJs had spent many hours preparing special sets to blow you away,
>Jack Cleveland had pretty an artshow of his original works designed to 
>titillate,
>and we had spent many hours carving pumpkins, planning treats, surprises,
>a really fun 'only on Halloween' ceremony, and decorating the place - even
>the bathrooms had been made 'special'.
>
>The sad truth is - there was no GOOD reason for the cancellation.
>Unbeknown to us, in early October, RawHide was visited by agents
>of the Alcoholic Beverage Commission (ABC).  During the course of ABC's
>inspection they observed patrons drinking alcoholic beverages outside
>on the rooftop garden deck - according to ABC, this was a violation of the 
>"rules"
>(even though it had been going on for years and years) - they cited the owner
>and his license to sell alcoholic beverages was suspended for 3 weeks.
>The owner never contacted us to explain this - he went on vacation.
>
>When we reached the owner on Monday the 27th, he explained to us what had 
>happened
>and he was anxious because he hadn't been given his license back - that 
>happened on Tues.
>On Wednesday, he told us that he wasn't going to allow our event to go 
>until 4 because
>we didn't have an 'after-hours' permit (even though, legally, it was his 
>job to obtain it).
>Thanks to some much appreciated quick action from both John Wood and 
>Terrance Alan
>of the San Francisco Late Nite Coalition and the city's new Entertainment 
>Commission -
>we were assured on Wednesday evening that we could have the necessary 
>permits in time.
>
>On Thursday, we were 9/10 of the way through filling out the permit 
>application with
>RawHide's owner when he changed his mind and told us he just wasn't, under 
>any circumstances,
>going to allow us to go until 4 am.  This was a bummer - but we attempted 
>to let as many of you
>as possible know so that you could adjust your evening plans accordingly - 
>many thanks to
>the DJs for agreeing to the changes.
>
>On Friday afternoon, as we were completing the decorating, RawHide's owner 
>was very nervous -
>the place had yet to be properly cleaned (his cleaning crew hadn't shown 
>up) and he kept
>changing agreements that we had all agreed to in August when we booked the 
>place and
>confirmed both in September and earlier in the week.  Still, we were 
>trying to work through issues,
>including helping him clean the place, when he announced that it was just 
>too much stress for him
>and that he was cancelling the event - shock hardly describes our reaction 
>- true, we only
>had a verbal agreement with the guy, but over 500 people were planning on 
>Sweet! in less than
>5 hours and we had done a very successful event with the same owner in August.
>I don't know what are legal rights are with a verbal contract, but if 
>anyone does, we would
>sure appreciate hearing from them.
>
>No amount of persuasion, or even an intervention from the person who had 
>introduced us to the owner,
>was successful in getting him to change his mind.  Was he nervous about a 
>potential return visit
>from ABC ? - definitely - but in talking to him we also learned that he 
>had not taken care of
>properly staffing the place for the evening - he only had one bartender 
>due in, instead of the 3 required,
>he had not followed through on getting 2 coat-check people, even his bar 
>backs were unavailable.
>We had handled security - including an extra person to keep drinks from 
>going out on the roof deck.
>Nothing we had done or were willing to do was going to change his mind.
>
>Our opinion on anyone ever working with this owner again should be obvious.
>
>Those of you who know or understand the logistics of putting on an event 
>of this size can appreciate
>that we had already spent several thousand dollars worth of unrecoverable 
>costs on this event - everything from
>getting tickets printed to a dozen jack-o-lanterns.  Many of you know that 
>Lost Tribe Presents
>has been operating "in the red" for the past couple of years because we 
>absorbed the cost overruns
>from the Illuminaughty 2002 project at Burning Man.  This cancellation 
>(the first in almost 7 years of
>putting on events) couldn't have come at a worse time, fiscally, for us.
>
>We are still working out exactly what we are going to do - but rest 
>assured that though it may take
>a little time - everyone will either receive a full refund or satisfaction 
>for the money they spent on this event.
>We really appreciate the calls of concern and expressions of support we 
>have received from you in the
>past few days.  At the present time, the only financially viable solution 
>for us will be to present a "make up"
>event in the near future.  We are working on that now and you can expect 
>to hear from us shortly as to the
>"what" "when" "where" and "who's gonna play". We are hoping to present the 
>same lineup we had planned on
>for Halloween with perhaps a couple of additional pleasant surprises !
>The most difficult aspect of putting on a legal late night event is always 
>finding a location -
>so, if you have any connections, or ideas - please let us know right away!
>We can also promise you this - the "make-up" event will be even better 
>than what we had planned
>for Halloween.
>
>Once the make up event is in place, you will have the option to trade in 
>your Halloween tickets for tickets
>to the new event - or receive a refund for the Halloween tickets.  For 
>now, hand on to your tickets!
>Stay tuned, we're going to make this right.
>If you think that we do not have your current email address and you are 
>holding tickets - please send it
>to us so that we can more easily keep you in the loop.
>
>And, once again, thanks to Spesh and the people at Qool for inviting 
>anyone with a Sweet! ticket to
>attend their party on Saturday nite for free.
>
>Thanks again, for you patience and support.
>
>Matt & Jim
>Lost Tribe Presents
>
>PS - Would any of the following people please contact us 
>immediately:  Christopher Sharpe, Wendy Lau,
> 
>Rich Herling, Toffer, and Sarah Harbin



--=====================_736629136==.ALT
Content-Type: text/html; x-avg-checked=avg-ok-174B2D0B; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

<html>
<body>
<blockquote type=cite class=cite cite><br>
Lost Tribe Presents . . . <br><br>
is still reeling from the abrupt cancellation of our Halloween
event.<br>
All of the tickets had been distributed, Bruce from JK had spent many
hours<br>
fine-tuning the sound systems, Mike Clay had spent hours setting up and
preparing the visuals,<br>
The DJs had spent many hours preparing special sets to blow you
away,<br>
Jack Cleveland had pretty an artshow of his original works designed to
titillate,<br>
and we had spent many hours carving pumpkins, planning treats,
surprises,<br>
a really fun 'only on Halloween' ceremony, and decorating the place -
even <br>
the bathrooms had been made 'special'.<br><br>
<b>The sad truth is - there was no GOOD reason for the 
cancellation.<br>
</b>Unbeknown to us, in early October, RawHide was visited by 
agents<br>
of the Alcoholic Beverage Commission (ABC).&nbsp; During the course of
ABC's<br>
inspection they observed patrons drinking alcoholic beverages
outside<br>
on the rooftop garden deck - according to ABC, this was a violation of
the &quot;rules&quot;<br>
(even though it had been going on for years and years) - they cited the
owner<br>
and his license to sell alcoholic beverages was suspended for 3
weeks.<br>
The owner never contacted us to explain this - he went on
vacation.<br><br>
When we reached the owner on Monday the 27th, he explained to us what had
happened<br>
and he was anxious because he hadn't been given his license back - that
happened on Tues.<br>
On Wednesday, he told us that he wasn't going to allow our event to go
until 4 because<br>
we didn't have an 'after-hours' permit (even though, legally, it was his
job to obtain it).<br>
Thanks to some much appreciated quick action from both John Wood and
Terrance Alan<br>
of the San Francisco Late Nite Coalition and the city's new Entertainment
Commission -<br>
we were assured on Wednesday evening that we could have the necessary
permits in time.<br><br>
On Thursday, we were 9/10 of the way through filling out the permit
application with<br>
RawHide's owner when he changed his mind and told us he just wasn't,
under any circumstances,<br>
going to allow us to go until 4 am.&nbsp; This was a bummer - but we
attempted to let as many of you<br>
as possible know so that you could adjust your evening plans accordingly
- many thanks to<br>
the DJs for agreeing to the changes.<br><br>
On Friday afternoon, as we were completing the decorating, RawHide's
owner was very nervous -<br>
the place had yet to be properly cleaned (his cleaning crew hadn't shown
up) and he kept<br>
changing agreements that we had all agreed to in August when we booked
the place and <br>
confirmed both in September and earlier in the week.&nbsp; Still, we were
trying to work through issues,<br>
including helping him clean the place, when he announced that it was just
too much stress for him<br>
and that he was cancelling the event - shock hardly describes our
reaction - true, we only<br>
had a verbal agreement with the guy, but over 500 people were planning on
Sweet! in less than<br>
5 hours and we had done a very successful event with the same owner in
August.<br>
I don't know what are legal rights are with a verbal contract, but if
anyone does, we would<br>
sure appreciate hearing from them.<br><br>
No amount of persuasion, or even an intervention from the person who had
introduced us to the owner,<br>
was successful in getting him to change his mind.&nbsp; Was he nervous
about a potential return visit<br>
from ABC ? - definitely - but in talking to him we also learned that he
had not taken care of <br>
properly staffing the place for the evening - he only had one bartender
due in, instead of the 3 required,<br>
he had not followed through on getting 2 coat-check people, even his bar
backs were unavailable.<br>
We had handled security - including an extra person to keep drinks from
going out on the roof deck.<br>
Nothing we had done or were willing to do was going to change his
mind.<br><br>
Our opinion on anyone ever working with this owner again should be
obvious.<br><br>
Those of you who know or understand the logistics of putting on an event
of this size can appreciate<br>
that we had already spent several thousand dollars worth of unrecoverable
costs on this event - everything from <br>
getting tickets printed to a dozen jack-o-lanterns.&nbsp; Many of you
know that Lost Tribe Presents<br>
has been operating &quot;in the red&quot; for the past couple of years
because we absorbed the cost overruns<br>
from the Illuminaughty 2002 project at Burning Man.&nbsp; This
cancellation (the first in almost 7 years of<br>
putting on events) couldn't have come at a worse time, fiscally, for
us.<br><br>
<b>We are still working out exactly what we are going to do - but rest
assured that though it may take<br>
a little time - everyone will either receive a full refund or
satisfaction for the money they spent on this event.<br>
</b>We really appreciate the calls of concern and expressions of support
we have received from you in the<br>
past few days.&nbsp; At the present time, the only financially viable
solution for us will be to present a &quot;make up&quot;<br>
event in the near future.&nbsp; We are working on that now and you can
expect to hear from us shortly as to the<br>
&quot;what&quot; &quot;when&quot; &quot;where&quot; and &quot;who's gonna
play&quot;. We are hoping to present the same lineup we had planned
on<br>
for Halloween with perhaps a couple of additional pleasant surprises
!<br>
The most difficult aspect of putting on a legal late night event is
always finding a location -<br>
so, if you have any connections, or ideas - please let us know right
away!<br>
<b>We can also promise you this - the &quot;make-up&quot; event will be
even better than what we had planned<br>
for Halloween.<br><br>
</b>Once the make up event is in place, you will have the option to trade
in your Halloween tickets for tickets<br>
to the new event - or receive a refund for the Halloween tickets.&nbsp;
For now, hand on to your tickets!<br>
<b>Stay tuned, we're going to make this right.<br>
</b>If you think that we do not have your current email address and you
are holding tickets - please send it <br>
to us so that we can more easily keep you in the loop.<br><br>
And, once again, thanks to Spesh and the people at Qool for inviting
anyone with a Sweet! ticket to <br>
attend their party on Saturday nite for free.<br><br>
T<b>hanks again, for you patience and support.<br><br>
</b>Matt &amp; Jim<br>
Lost Tribe Presents<br><br>
PS - Would any of the following people please contact us
immediately:&nbsp; Christopher Sharpe, Wendy Lau,<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Rich Herling, Toffer, and Sarah Harbin</blockquote></body>
<br>
</html>

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Nov 2003 21:18:02.0445 (UTC) FILETIME=[F6DF47D0:01C3A24F]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!(part 2)

As always it was a fabulous party at Otherworld. Toss in the addition of
Tenderloft to the mix and you got the double fisting of fun. That graveyard
that Marin created was awesome. The visuals setup with the rear-projection
onto parachutes made for a nice atmospheric feeling. Actually all the shutes
and curtains that broke up the main space was a blessing. The main room can
get a little thin and the way it was sectioned off kept the energy focused.

In all honesty I just ran around all night being goofy. That's what I was in
the mood for. Hanging out with friends in a super-fun atmosphere. I also
haven't been going out much lately. That break from things made the party
that much more enjoyable. It was great to see so many people I hadn't seen
in a while all in the same spot. It's these kind of parties that I solely
want to attend. I look forward to the next one, although I think the effort
that went into that party will be hard to top.

side note: On the way to Otherworld we stopped by Noodle Factory to see
Marshal and hear how things sounded (he got more gear!). I think that was
the most done up I've seen that place. Music - well - not my thing. But I'm
sure things were quite fun since they had all the rooms open. I hadn't seen
that occur in over a year. I miss the holes in the wall to climb through. =(

:: r y a n ::

----- Original Message ----- 
From: <gregvp@comcast.net>
To: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
Cc: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, November 03, 2003 11:47 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!(part 2)


Well, for as long as I have been a dancer (years!) I still have trouble
identifying the various types of EDM, let alone the numerous DJs in the
scene.

So, I just let the music move me.

I gave up on wondering (or figuring out) who's playing what.

But your review was right on the money. Thanks for providing these details.

I just know that I couldn't stop dancing, all night long, and I kept running
back and forth between the rooms. Plus the D&B was some of the best I have
heard lately.

Also, the decorations had the Halloween spirit (for example, a graveyard in
the smoking room), and the vibe was incredible. I kept seeing people that I
know from all over the rave scene.

Seems to me that this crew really had their act together and they pulled it
off quite nicely. I had a big smile on my face all night long. I was the
happy dancer.

Greg VP
aim: poloraveboi

> How could I have forgot two of the BEST parts of the evening???? See what
> happens when my little brain gets taxed too hard? lol
>
> Ok... I caught two other acts that blew my mind Friday night. 1st off, and
> most importantly Andres Octavio...the guy played the illest dub set I have
> ever heard. I've heard tons of dub house sets, but this was just str8 up
> dub, and it was SLEAZY. So fucking deep, dark, nasty and kinky it wasn't
> even funny. Fucking blew my mind. And the guy is HELLA nice to boot. Also,
> Freaky Chakra did a live set that was pretty godamm on point. He played a
> little less electro than I wanted to hear, but he was workin' it
> nonetheless. Even tho he was just rocking a laptop, a sequencer and a
couple
> other little pieces of gear, he looked like he was busy creating a
monster.
> Met him at the end of the night, and he was extremely genuine and nice.
>
> Once again, let me reiterate how fucking sick this party
> was....FAN-FUCKINGTASTIC!!!!
>
> M-
>
>
> >From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
> >To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> >Subject: [sfraves] RR: SPECTRE Review!
> >Date: Mon, 03 Nov 2003 10:39:02 -0800
> >
> >Holy fucking shit is all I can say. Otherworld and Tenderloft pulled off
a
> >SEVERELY kickin' party Friday night.
> >
> >I arrived to the warehouse a smidge on the early side, and it was a
beehive
> >of activity. People running to and fro doing last minute prep work. They
> >were just barely finishing up when people started to arrive, but things
> >just kind of fell into place, and the next thing you knew, the party was
in
> >full swing.
> >
> >This party had a really old skooly kinda vibe to it. Everyone was very
> >friendly, the music was pumping, but it didn't have the overproduced
> >massive feel to it at all. It was still very homey and raw. This was the
> >1st party in a LONG TIME that I just kind of met people all night
randomly.
> >(you people all know who you are, please for the love of god do NOT make
me
> >do a "shout out"...lol).
> >
> >The music is what really cinched it for me tho...some of the best tunes I
> >have heard in a long time as well.
> >
> >Mutex started off with some hard techno and kinda got people in the mood
to
> >party. The next person I caught was Nemo, who played some really nice
D&B.
> >I believe after him was DJ M who also played some decent D&B. I was still
> >kind of getting adjusted to everything at this point, so I didn't have
time
> >to properly observe any of the dj's. The 1st act i caught that I could
pay
> >attention to was Azeem. After Shortbus had played me some of Azeem's
stuff
> >the week before, I was itching to see what he was like live, and damn if
> >that guy didn't deliver the goods! It's nice to hear hip-hop on a
> >soundsytem that is big enough to pump, but not so huge that the sound
just
> >kinda of turns into a mess. Azeem and DJ Zeph kept it live and funky
their
> >whole set. I managed to slip into the main room during Azeems set to
check
> >out John Tejada, who was dropping some of the funkiest techno &
tech-house
> >I have ever heard. That motherfucker was mixin' smooth as buttah, and not
> >even breakin' a sweat. He had the dancefloor positively jumping. I made
it
> >upstairs to the chill room to catch a house DJ who was pretty damn good,
> >but unfortunately was being plagued by technical difficulties. Never got
> >the guys name, but he was pretty fucking good despite the problems. I had
> >never seen Jon Williams, so I worked my way back downstairs to catch some
> >of him, and godamm the guy was just bangin' it. Gritty, dirty, sexy,
> >bangin' techno. My new mission in the next few weeks is to pick up some
of
> >the stuff he was dropping, cuz it was fucking ILL. Made my hair stand on
> >end!!!! I also caught a few minutes of the infamous RedStickMan as he
> >dropped booty house and worked his way into NEW ORDER (yay, my
favorite!).
> >I was kind of running on empty tho, and had to find a place to gather my
> >few remaining braincells, so off I went in search of a quiet spot...
> >
> >The night for me is kind of a blur. I was running around trying to absorb
> >as much as I could, meet as many people as I could, and have fun...all of
> >which I managed to do. Definately one of the better parties I have been
to
> >in a LONG time. One of the best parts for me was seeing the smiles on all
> >the Otherworld crew' faces as they went about their various duties
through
> >the night. These were the smiles of people who were happy with the
results
> >of their efforts, and since I was witness to their efforts, I know they
> >busted their asses, and deserved to have those smiles at the end of the
> >night.
> >
> >Anyhoo....big BIG ups to Otherworld and Tenderloft for properly
introducing
> >me to Bay Area partying. I had a fucking BLAST, and will definately be
> >around for anything else you throw at us.....
> >
> >Respect.
> >
> >Marc(O)
> >*THWAP!*//Substructure
> >DC/MD/VA/CA
> >http://www.djmarcom.com
> >deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass

Subject: Re: [sfraves] DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME SWEATING! Re: [sfraves] impending draft?

Does anyone REALLY think that people like me volunteer to risk their lives for 
their god, country or corps?!?!  I dunno bout other people, but I didn't!  I'm 
not about trying to help George W make up for his father's mistakes.  I 
volunteered coz I knew that my boys and gurrls are out there.  If something 
were to happen to them, and I knew that I didn't do anything to prevent it, I 
could never live with myself.  THAT is the REAL REASON some people volunteer 
to serve their country.

Frank

Subject: RE: [sfraves] DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME SWEATING! Re: [sfraves] impending draft?

I'm going to post something I wrote in my journal a little while ago.
Unfortunately I do understand the need for military in this world but it
makes me no less disheartened at the scale it is used in this world.  I
have a friend about to join the army, and even though he knows the
concequences of the field he's going in to, it saddens me that we live
in a country where as a last ditch effort to gain money for college and
"direction" or "self-worth" we have people join the military.  Below is
just an observation.  If I'm wrong on anything please let me know.  I
like to be corrected.

We have 6 branches of the military. 1(yeah right) worldwide intelligence
agency, 6 majro nationwide intelligence and law enforcement agencies
and... ready.... 0.. not one. zip... zilch.. not a single governmental
agency devoted to true peacekeeping. All of our supposed peace keeping
organizations have to be non-governmental agencies like the Red Cross,
Salvation Army, Peace Corps etc... Debate if you will that it will cost
nothing but the tax payers heavily to have such a military sized force
devoted to humanitarian efforts to improve conditions in other countries
directly and solely for the purpose of peace and prosperity. Well, it
costs the tax payers heavily, including those part of it to run the
Army, Air Force, Marines, Navy, National Guard, Coast Guard, NSA, CIA,
FBI, US Marshall's, Secret Service, ATF, DEA and probably a few more
designed to destroy first, ask questions second. If I am wrong please
let me know but peace seems to be in the public's hands and almost
solely dependent on the publics generosity to devote time or money while
the government wants a large part of destruction with a little help
towards peace, usually handed out in tax breaks to peace organizations.
(Yes, I know that the military does good deeds, but they're also bred in
boot camp to become uncaring and unquestioning of superiors for conflict
resolution, not the spread of peace. Peace is not something learned at
gunpoint.) 

-Rayn

Subject: RE: [sfraves] DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME SWEATING! Re: [sfraves] impending draft?

Rayn,
Your friend did not HAVE TO join the military.  He was not drafted.  No one 
held a gun to his head or twisted his arm to the point of breaking.  Money for 
college, direction and self-worth are just BENEFITS to serving in the armed 
forces.  They should not be the reasons why people sign up.  This is like 
saying you'd sign up to work in a funeral home as a embalmist just so you 
could have a free funeral benefit!  If people sign up for the wrong reasons, 
that's their own damn fault!  I'm just glad that there are still people out 
there that serve their country for the RIGHT reasons.

We officially have five branches of service in the military.  I didn't count 
the Guard and reserve because when they are activated, they are integrated 
into the other branches.  There are now 14 agencies in the US Intelligence 
Community.  These agencies either specialize in intelligence, or have 
personnel that perform an intelligence function.

You are right!  I totally agree with your statements on peace-keeping.  How 
can you expect people that are trained to kill & destroy to be effective peace-
keepers?  If I was president or a member of Congress, I'd draft a bill to 
allocate funding to the Peace Corps.  They NEED a bigger budget!  We don't 
even pay those poor bastards!  THey need to get paid for the services they 
provide!  Give them a bigger budget, reorganize, equip them, train them, and 
make the Peace Corps do the peacekeeping duties!

Let the trained killers & destoyers do what they're trained to do, and leave 
the peace-keeping to dedicated peace-keepers!


Frank
vote for me in 2007!  lol

Quoting Rayn <acydrayn@hotmail.com>:

> I'm going to post something I wrote in my journal a little while ago.
> Unfortunately I do understand the need for military in this world but it
> makes me no less disheartened at the scale it is used in this world.  I
> have a friend about to join the army, and even though he knows the
> concequences of the field he's going in to, it saddens me that we live
> in a country where as a last ditch effort to gain money for college and
> "direction" or "self-worth" we have people join the military.  Below is
> just an observation.  If I'm wrong on anything please let me know.  I
> like to be corrected.
> 
> We have 6 branches of the military. 1(yeah right) worldwide intelligence
> agency, 6 majro nationwide intelligence and law enforcement agencies
> and... ready.... 0.. not one. zip... zilch.. not a single governmental
> agency devoted to true peacekeeping. All of our supposed peace keeping
> organizations have to be non-governmental agencies like the Red Cross,
> Salvation Army, Peace Corps etc... Debate if you will that it will cost
> nothing but the tax payers heavily to have such a military sized force
> devoted to humanitarian efforts to improve conditions in other countries
> directly and solely for the purpose of peace and prosperity. Well, it
> costs the tax payers heavily, including those part of it to run the
> Army, Air Force, Marines, Navy, National Guard, Coast Guard, NSA, CIA,
> FBI, US Marshall's, Secret Service, ATF, DEA and probably a few more
> designed to destroy first, ask questions second. If I am wrong please
> let me know but peace seems to be in the public's hands and almost
> solely dependent on the publics generosity to devote time or money while
> the government wants a large part of destruction with a little help
> towards peace, usually handed out in tax breaks to peace organizations.
> (Yes, I know that the military does good deeds, but they're also bred in
> boot camp to become uncaring and unquestioning of superiors for conflict
> resolution, not the spread of peace. Peace is not something learned at
> gunpoint.) 
> 
> -Rayn
>

Quoting Rayn <acydrayn@hotmail.com>:

> I'm going to post something I wrote in my journal a little while ago.
> Unfortunately I do understand the need for military in this world but it
> makes me no less disheartened at the scale it is used in this world.  I
> have a friend about to join the army, and even though he knows the
> concequences of the field he's going in to, it saddens me that we live
> in a country where as a last ditch effort to gain money for college and
> "direction" or "self-worth" we have people join the military.  Below is
> just an observation.  If I'm wrong on anything please let me know.  I
> like to be corrected.
> 
> We have 6 branches of the military. 1(yeah right) worldwide intelligence
> agency, 6 majro nationwide intelligence and law enforcement agencies
> and... ready.... 0.. not one. zip... zilch.. not a single governmental
> agency devoted to true peacekeeping. All of our supposed peace keeping
> organizations have to be non-governmental agencies like the Red Cross,
> Salvation Army, Peace Corps etc... Debate if you will that it will cost
> nothing but the tax payers heavily to have such a military sized force
> devoted to humanitarian efforts to improve conditions in other countries
> directly and solely for the purpose of peace and prosperity. Well, it
> costs the tax payers heavily, including those part of it to run the
> Army, Air Force, Marines, Navy, National Guard, Coast Guard, NSA, CIA,
> FBI, US Marshall's, Secret Service, ATF, DEA and probably a few more
> designed to destroy first, ask questions second. If I am wrong please
> let me know but peace seems to be in the public's hands and almost
> solely dependent on the publics generosity to devote time or money while
> the government wants a large part of destruction with a little help
> towards peace, usually handed out in tax breaks to peace organizations.
> (Yes, I know that the military does good deeds, but they're also bred in
> boot camp to become uncaring and unquestioning of superiors for conflict
> resolution, not the spread of peace. Peace is not something learned at
> gunpoint.) 
> 
> -Rayn

Subject: RE: [sfraves] DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME SWEATING! Re: [sfraves]  impending

At 06:51 PM 11/3/03 -0500, Zephyr Stormrider wrote:
>Rayn,
>Your friend did not HAVE TO join the military.  He was not drafted.  No one
>held a gun to his head or twisted his arm to the point of breaking.  Money 
>for
>college, direction and self-worth are just BENEFITS to serving in the armed
>forces.  They should not be the reasons why people sign up.

but what percentage do actually sign up for those reasons?  remember the
ads for the armed forces - "Be all you can be"?  those ads emphasized the
reasons you state - the armed forces became just another job, a badly paid
one, as i understand it (but that is a different issue)

>This is like
>saying you'd sign up to work in a funeral home as a embalmist just so you
>could have a free funeral benefit!  If people sign up for the wrong reasons,
>that's their own damn fault!  I'm just glad that there are still people out
>there that serve their country for the RIGHT reasons.

well, i'm certainly supporting your attitude here, it seems like the right one.
but i have a problem with the executive branch using the military as a 
political
tool (for ultimately domestic issues).  the death of everyone in Iraq is on
GWB's head and i think they were needless deaths.  sure, something had to
be done, but i do not like being lied to about the motivations.

You are right!  I totally agree with your statements on peace-keeping.  How
>can you expect people that are trained to kill & destroy to be effective 
>peace-
>keepers?  If I was president or a member of Congress, I'd draft a bill to
>allocate funding to the Peace Corps.  They NEED a bigger budget!  We don't

according to the veterans i know of the Peace Corp, it's a gigantic boondoggle.

as for the draft, there was a recent story in the SFBg (or SF weekly) about
how the gov. strongarmed the local school districts into giving them info
on high school seniors etc.  this has been happening across the country.
i don' t like what it portends

doug

wow!  15" is pretty big for personal use [no matter
what peeps say].  these speakers [jbl or mackie] sound
great in a personal studio with no more than 12"s.  i
have a pair of 12" vintage jbl's and have no need for
more sound...and they aren't self powered!  you could
save some money by downsizing the drivers...unless you
have plans of these speaks leaving your house/ studio,
for, lets say, the CLUB!  anyway...just my opinion..

Mackies, mos def.  The nice thing about them is they'll go ungodly loud
and they make them with little coloration, a little bit more like
studio monitors than PA speakers.

The JBL stuff is ok, but the EONs and the like have always seemed a
little bass-light.  SRM 450s are sweet, portable, and not so much money
you'll be crying.

George C.

At 03:58 PM 11/3/2003, zephyr@steelwolverine.com wrote:

>Check out this quotation...

>Frank

>"Our Country won't go on forever, if we stay soft as we are now. There won't

>women

Well, I guess if these invaders will actually breed a hardier race, a la 
Darwin, I say let them have at it:)

I love quotes.  Especially from famous American generals.  Here's one from 
another general:

Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired 
signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not 
fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not 
spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius 
of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at 
all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a 
cross of iron.
--Dwight Eisenhower 1953 speech

Love,

Apollo

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"They can get all the synthesizers they want, but nothing will ever take 
the place of the human heart."
-Johnny Cash

Subject: [sfraves] Re: Sweet! - Moving Forward

Jim,

	Indeed an unfortunate chain of events. Too bad it's probably =20
impossible to sue the Alcohol and Beverage Commission for its asinine =20=

citation or its failure to renew Rawhide's license in accord with the =20=

time frame given in the citation. Government agencies don't like to be =20=

held to the same standards as ordinary businesses when it comes to =20
improper action and negligence.

	Your caution against other promoters working with Rawhide's =
owner =20
sounds well-advised too. I hope you will post the name of this =20
individual. That way people will also know to be wary if they happen to =20=

come across him in some other aspect of the entertainment business and =20=

future owners of the establishment will not have their reputations =20
unjustly tarred if the business changes hands. If it's worth =20
publicizing the facts, it's worth identifying the person behind them.

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild =
>>>


On Monday, November 3, 2003, at 12:59  PM, Jim Cyr wrote:

>
> Lost Tribe Presents . . .
>
> is still reeling from the abrupt cancellation of our Halloween event.
> All of the tickets had been distributed, Bruce from JK had spent many =20=

> hours
> fine-tuning the sound systems, Mike Clay had spent hours setting up =20=

> and preparing the visuals,
> The DJs had spent many hours preparing special sets to blow you away,
> Jack Cleveland had pretty an artshow of his original works designed to =
=20
> titillate,
> and we had spent many hours carving pumpkins, planning treats, =20
> surprises,
> a really fun 'only on Halloween' ceremony, and decorating the place - =20=

> even
> the bathrooms had been made 'special'.
>
> The sad truth is - there was no GOOD reason for the cancellation.
> Unbeknown to us, in early October, RawHide was visited by agents
> of the Alcoholic Beverage Commission (ABC).=A0 During the course of =
ABC's
> inspection they observed patrons drinking alcoholic beverages outside
> on the rooftop garden deck - according to ABC, this was a violation of =
=20
> the "rules"
> (even though it had been going on for years and years) - they cited =20=

> the owner
> and his license to sell alcoholic beverages was suspended for 3 weeks.
> The owner never contacted us to explain this - he went on vacation.
>
> When we reached the owner on Monday the 27th, he explained to us what =20=

> had happened
> and he was anxious because he hadn't been given his license back - =20
> that happened on Tues.
> On Wednesday, he told us that he wasn't going to allow our event to go =
=20
> until 4 because
> we didn't have an 'after-hours' permit (even though, legally, it was =20=

> his job to obtain it).
> Thanks to some much appreciated quick action from both John Wood and =20=

> Terrance Alan
> of the San Francisco Late Nite Coalition and the city's new =20
> Entertainment Commission -
> we were assured on Wednesday evening that we could have the necessary =20=

> permits in time.
>
> On Thursday, we were 9/10 of the way through filling out the permit =20=

> application with
> RawHide's owner when he changed his mind and told us he just wasn't, =20=

> under any circumstances,
> going to allow us to go until 4 am.=A0 This was a bummer - but we =20
> attempted to let as many of you
> as possible know so that you could adjust your evening plans =20
> accordingly - many thanks to
> the DJs for agreeing to the changes.
>
> On Friday afternoon, as we were completing the decorating, RawHide's =20=

> owner was very nervous -
> the place had yet to be properly cleaned (his cleaning crew hadn't =20
> shown up) and he kept
> changing agreements that we had all agreed to in August when we booked =
=20
> the place and
> confirmed both in September and earlier in the week.=A0 Still, we were =
=20
> trying to work through issues,
> including helping him clean the place, when he announced that it was =20=

> just too much stress for him
> and that he was cancelling the event - shock hardly describes our =20
> reaction - true, we only
> had a verbal agreement with the guy, but over 500 people were planning =
=20
> on Sweet! in less than
> 5 hours and we had done a very successful event with the same owner in =
=20
> August.
> I don't know what are legal rights are with a verbal contract, but if =20=

> anyone does, we would
> sure appreciate hearing from them.
>
> No amount of persuasion, or even an intervention from the person who =20=

> had introduced us to the owner,
> was successful in getting him to change his mind.=A0 Was he nervous =20=

> about a potential return visit
> from ABC ? - definitely - but in talking to him we also learned that =20=

> he had not taken care of
> properly staffing the place for the evening - he only had one =20
> bartender due in, instead of the 3 required,
> he had not followed through on getting 2 coat-check people, even his =20=

> bar backs were unavailable.
> We had handled security - including an extra person to keep drinks =20
> from going out on the roof deck.
> Nothing we had done or were willing to do was going to change his =
mind.
>
> Our opinion on anyone ever working with this owner again should be =20
> obvious.
>
> Those of you who know or understand the logistics of putting on an =20
> event of this size can appreciate
> that we had already spent several thousand dollars worth of =20
> unrecoverable costs on this event - everything from
> getting tickets printed to a dozen jack-o-lanterns.=A0 Many of you =
know =20
> that Lost Tribe Presents
> has been operating "in the red" for the past couple of years because =20=

> we absorbed the cost overruns
> from the Illuminaughty 2002 project at Burning Man.=A0 This =
cancellation =20
> (the first in almost 7 years of
> putting on events) couldn't have come at a worse time, fiscally, for =20=

> us.
>
> We are still working out exactly what we are going to do - but rest =20=

> assured that though it may take
> a little time - everyone will either receive a full refund or =20
> satisfaction for the money they spent on this event.
> We really appreciate the calls of concern and expressions of support =20=

> we have received from you in the
> past few days.=A0 At the present time, the only financially viable =20
> solution for us will be to present a "make up"
> event in the near future.=A0 We are working on that now and you can =20=

> expect to hear from us shortly as to the
> "what" "when" "where" and "who's gonna play". We are hoping to present =
=20
> the same lineup we had planned on
> for Halloween with perhaps a couple of additional pleasant surprises !
> The most difficult aspect of putting on a legal late night event is =20=

> always finding a location -
> so, if you have any connections, or ideas - please let us know right =20=

> away!
> We can also promise you this - the "make-up" event will be even better =
=20
> than what we had planned
> for Halloween.
>
> Once the make up event is in place, you will have the option to trade =20=

> in your Halloween tickets for tickets
> to the new event - or receive a refund for the Halloween tickets.=A0 =
For =20
> now, hand on to your tickets!
> Stay tuned, we're going to make this right.
> If you think that we do not have your current email address and you =20=

> are holding tickets - please send it
> to us so that we can more easily keep you in the loop.
>
> And, once again, thanks to Spesh and the people at Qool for inviting =20=

> anyone with a Sweet! ticket to
> attend their party on Saturday nite for free.
>
> Thanks again, for you patience and support.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] ATP: EQUIPMENT: Self-Powered Monitor's

  It depends what you are looking for. Both Mackies
and JBL's are great, but for different reasons. 

 Personally I think the JBL's sound better. The mids
are cleaner, plus if you get the newer G2's they have
high and low eq's (Mackies don't offer this). I have
four of them, two for my dj set up in my studio, and
two for gigs. I LOVE them. Couldn't be happier.

 If you are more concerned with volume then I would
recomend the Mackies. They do have smaller drivers
with 12 " woofers rather then 15's like the Eon's, but
they are capable of being pushed to much higher volume
levels than the JBL's. I personally find them lacking
in the mid range though. They seem to be all highs and
lows to my ears. That is just my personal oppinion
though.


 Basically it just depends what is more important to
YOU. Sound quality or volume. Either way you decide to
go you will have a great set of moniters as both
brands are top notch.

 Hope that helps.


 Kevin James

Subject: Re: [sfraves] impending draft?

	If the military didn't offer benefits such as money for college, they 
wouldn't be able to fill their recruitment quotas. I was in the Army 
reserves and I didn't meet anyone who wasn't trying to maximize his or 
her personal benefits, nor anyone who seemed to be primarily motivated 
by a desire to serve his or her country.

	It wasn't always thus. During the Revolutionary War against England, 
when it was a clear fight for freedom, soldiers volunteered without pay 
in General Washington's army. Perhaps if the U.S. still had a 
citizen-run government which clearly stood for liberty not only in 
places like Iraq but here in the states as well, things would be 
different. Instead, most of the truly dedicated, patriotic folks were 
joining the anti-government militia movement, at least before the Feds 
put a lid on it via infiltration and crackdowns and the media tarred it 
by association with the likes of Timothy McVeigh.

	Who wants to go and fight for a big-government welfare state that 
taxes people worse than the British monarchy did, crushes innovation 
and creativity, and tries to tell you how to run your own life? Not me.

Peace, love & liberty,
									<<< Starchild >>>

>From: Kevin James <djkevinjames@yahoo.com>
>To: Jack Triumph <jacktriumph@hotmail.com>, SFRaves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: Re: [sfraves] ATP: EQUIPMENT: Self-Powered Monitor's
>Date: Mon, 3 Nov 2003 17:00:48 -0800 (PST)
>
>   It depends what you are looking for. Both Mackies
>and JBL's are great, but for different reasons.
>
>  Personally I think the JBL's sound better. The mids
>are cleaner, plus if you get the newer G2's they have
>high and low eq's (Mackies don't offer this). I have
>four of them, two for my dj set up in my studio, and
>two for gigs. I LOVE them. Couldn't be happier.
>
>  If you are more concerned with volume then I would
>recomend the Mackies. They do have smaller drivers
>with 12 " woofers rather then 15's like the Eon's, but
>they are capable of being pushed to much higher volume
>levels than the JBL's. I personally find them lacking
>in the mid range though. They seem to be all highs and
>lows to my ears. That is just my personal oppinion
>though.
>
>
>  Basically it just depends what is more important to
>YOU. Sound quality or volume. Either way you decide to
>go you will have a great set of moniters as both
>brands are top notch.
>
>  Hope that helps.
>
>
>  Kevin James
>
>
>

Subject: [sfraves] Did anyone go to Lil' Monsters?

I found out, after I had already made plans for halloween, that Happy 
Kids was throwing another Lil' Monsters.  And I'm really curious as to 
how it went, who played, did it go all night, and so on.

Before they went on hiatus, I used to have a lot of fun at HK parties, 
and still have some really fond memories (and pictures) of them.  I 
even had a blast at that one ill-fated clusterfuck of a Lil' Monsters 
at that soccer arena place.  But as much as I wish them well, some of 
the things I have learned since, about what was going on "behind the 
scenes" at the time, have left me with a "wait and see" inclination 
before I start to go to their parties again.  (Ahhh.... ignorance can 
be such bliss sometimes...)

So, I really am curious as to how this Lil' Monsters went down.  Anyone 
care to enlighten me?

Thanks.


cya,
john


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Why not have events all over north CA? like in this county

Additionally, getting permits in many of the less urban areas of 
California can be somewhat problematic. Outside of urban areas, and 
outside the bay area in particular, there is usually a less tolerant 
attitude towards electronic music and those in power generally 
associate electronic music with raves with "drug orgies" with NIMBY 
(Not in my Backyard).

Josh
On Thursday, October 9, 2003, at 06:40 PM, Sarilion wrote:

The 15 inch Mackies are real bargains for the hefty seeming price. (900.00
or more a piece)
 They have the same tweeter and are only 100 watts more, but the highs sound
good after 3 hours of pounding and there is some solid lows.
A big drawback is that it is not easy to lift 90 pounds onto a tripod.

I didn't go but I talked to some people who said it was very good. It was 
held at a place in SF that might be seeing more parties in the months to come -- 
a nice venue. I had tons of fun at Lil Monsters in 1999. That one was awesome: 
 a mini-massive at a warehouse in Richmond that will never be used again. The 
next one had some problems but was still great. 
I wanted to check out this year's Lil Monsters but it said presale only, and 
I didn't think I could get to Skills in time. I went to Nightmare on Evo 
Street and had a fantastic time, so everything worked out fine. Later, i heard that 
Lil Monsters did have tickets at the door and that it went well, and I was 
glad to hear that. 
I'm still not sure what to think about the comeback of Happy Kids. I'm 
wishing them well, and hoping Lil Monsters is a good sign for their return. 

-------------------------------1067967143--

Additionally, getting permits in many of the less urban areas of 
California can be somewhat problematic. Outside of urban areas, and 
outside the bay area in particular, there is usually a less tolerant 
attitude towards electronic music and those in power generally 
associate electronic music with raves with "drug orgies" with NIMBY 
(Not in my Backyard).

Josh

Additionally, getting permits in many of the less urban areas of 
California can be somewhat problematic. Outside of urban areas, and 
outside the bay area in particular, there is usually a less tolerant 
attitude towards electronic music and those in power generally 
associate electronic music with raves with "drug orgies" with NIMBY 
(Not in my Backyard).

Josh

same style in breaks that you think blow them off the wall? 

i would have to say DJ Iecy i like his Orlando/flordia breaks he dose wow 
dose it so ever move to dance floor. *it would be cool to see those to super 
stars live* 

I would like to know if DJ Iecy or Baby Anne would be coming to the North 
part of CA, anytime soon oh well. To bad some of are productions crews could not 
pay for them on a bill it would be sweet.....!!!! hell yes.....  


i have always love the sounds of DJ Icey on the turn tables he is quick with 
the change up and loves his fader :-) also Baby Anne wow what can i say what a 
cute girl oh my god she is a hottie and also she is hot on the tables wow 
*back stage with those 2 would be so much fun* 


hm.........

-------------------------------1067985990
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

no opinion on this but wanted to share a bit of trivia, thanks to Frankie 
Bones, who said in an interview that DJ Icey got his name because he keeps his 
home really cold. Has nothing to do with being a "cool guy" or drugs or anything 
else, just the temperature of his home. 

Speakin' of Ice, though ... lol ... anybody remember our own local "DJ Ice", 
Dan Smith from Novato?  He used to post on SFR. He threw a pretty decent party 
at the officer's club at Hamilton Field, and later on he threw an excellent 
underground in an abandoned building at the same base. We probably all got a 
lifetime's worth of asbestos:  there was so much whitish powder in the air that 
I couldn't even take flash pictures!  That was bad, and the shuttle system was 
terrible too (25 people packed into a single cargo van going up a bumpy 
road), but it was fun to go to a real live unauthorized party. The only way the 
cops found the party was by following the van. 

Ice, ice, baby  ;)

-------------------------------1067985990--

Subject: RE: [sfraves] DJ icey or Baby Anne  ?

I like both of them, but personally when I saw em live Baby Anne played
the better set... And she did not have a moustache ;)

My favorite guys out of Florida aside from Rabbit in the Moon but off
the same label are Jackal and Hyde (well maybe from Florida).  I went
back to Utah for Halloween and a party to see DJ Mea spin and had no
idea they were going to be there.  I remember sitting watching their
live PA and mentioned to one of my old friends, man, these guys sound a
lot like one of my favorites, Jackal and Hyde.  Some other dude was
like, this is Jackal and Hyde.  Seriously one of the best parties I've
ever been to.  Top floor of a warehouse with a huge elevator that made
me think of a Skinny Puppy video and meat grinders, but when we got up
top there was a grid of lazers shooting across the ceiling and smiles
and crazy costumes everywhere.  Great vibe, and although there were cops
patrolling the neighborhood and even just sitting outside the party, no
bust. 

-Rayn
