Subject: [sfraves] Ultraworld revisited

yo, while waxing nostalgic about that Ultraworld /
Balti-bore post,  I dug up this old story.  I posted
it years ago so like, sorry andy.  :o)

those were some good times for me when it was all
fresh and exciting and new worlds were opening up.

peace,
bf
.....

"Back East"
by boomerang fidget
  
I haven't been back east in five years.   In
Baltimore, I was an old school freak.  Always busting
out the headspins on the dancefloor, mackin on the
ladies and all of that.

But one night 5 years ago, all of that changed.   I
was at this Ultraworld party one night, busting out
the boomerang tricks.  You already know I was
impressing the ladies, but what you prolly don't know
is that I had just eaten a 5-alarm chili dinner. 
Well, I was out there on the floor trippin my electric
funk hips all over the place, when I cut loose with
the most horrific fart ever.  

It was awful!  The dancefloor cleared, as bodies
climbed over bodies in desperate search for exits. 
The needle skipped off the record and Scott Henry
tumbled ass-over-microchip from the dj booth.   

The fire marshal was called to evacuate the building,
and swarms of journalists arrived, breaking what would
become the first press on this new threat to our
nations youth.

In shame, I went home and packed my bags.  In the
morning I caught the first bus to San Francisco.  I
could start my life over on the west coast, a shadow
of my former self.  

It took me years to come to terms with my suffering.  
At my peak I had been the rave mack daddy, scoring all
the ladies and trippin nutwax on the dancefloor.  But
in the course of a few fleeting moments, all of that
had been lost, slipped away like water though my
fingers. 

In California, I parked it down low and stayed deep
underground for years. The Happy Kids crew took me in
like family, but they never knew about my sordid past.
  Every once in a while when the fire marshal would
show up to make sure things were under control, I felt
the darkness in my heart.

Last week,  I decided to go Back East.  I'm sure that
my old friends presumed me dead, or had simply
forgotten about me.  But I went home, to face the
demons.  Surely no one would remember that moment 5
years ago, when I had caused so much embarrassment on
the dancefloor! Surely, people would have moved on to
other things! 

My first night home, I went out to a party. 
Thankfully, I didn't recognize anyone.  This  was a
brand new crowd of ravers!  Soon, I became more
relaxed in my old environment, and started grooving on
the new music.  I realized that the DJ, too, was a
fresh face. 

I said to this kid next to me, "I've never seen that 
DJ before.  How long has she been spinning?"

"Well,"  the kid said. "She spun at her first
party...let's see...three years, two months, and five
days after Boomerang Fidget cut that big fart on the
dancefloor." 













---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] Oliver Bondzio -- Anyone know dis dude?!

In case of.. Oliver Bondzio (cd)
German techno at its finest!
I love that motherfucker.. He is one of the two members of hardfloor. His
mix cd is so fuqn sick! It has always been some of my favorite german
techno. The second to last track is Mathematical Breakfast, by Oliver
Bondzio himself, one of my favorite techno tracks. Anyone here know of
this mugg and care to recommend some similar stuff? I need to get myself
some nice new techno beats.. I've been listening to oldschool NYC Techno
like DJ DB (before he spun drum&bass) and german techno the last couple of
days..

-- Daniel Kox

Sorry for responding so late to these posts.  

Ironically, I remember an article about raves in the
Baltimore newspaper back in the early '90s. 
Ultraworld came under a lot of heat for a New Years
flyer that featured Uncle Sam wearing a pot leaf on
his jacket.  

of course the controversy was about promoting (or
acknowledging) drug use at parties that UW was
promoting.   Lonnie Fisher called the pot leaf a
"stupid mistake," but he got a lot of bad press for
it.

peace,
bf

At 04:16 AM 11/4/2003, hak thedj wrote:

>there was a docu about raves that came out in 93 i think. it was about 
>raves in the US and showed parties from just about every major city in the 
>US that had raves at the time. it also interviewed dj's, promoters, 
>ravers. now, that was a COOL movie. it really showed the potential the 
>scene at the time had, and it was b4 there were any division's in the 
>scene; i.e all the music was the same. no sub genres. it was house and 
>hardcore, but both were played by all dj's interchangebly at the time 
>anyways...
>what was the title of that? was it, united states of rave? anyone? apollo?

hi hak,

"Better Living Through Circuitry" fits the bill, and included interviews 
with the likes of Genesis P-Orridge (Psychic TV) and Keoki, but this was 
released, I think, in 1999.

Moontribe down in LA did some early filming of the desert rave scene but I 
don't think any of it was ever released except, perhaps, some 16mm footage 
in "Synergy: Visions of Vibe" released recently on DVD.

I also remember seeing some shorts made in the UK in the early nineties 
about the acid house rave movement in the UK, but they didn't cover the US.

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"


U

Frank

A government should not mobilize an army out of anger, military leaders should 
not provoke war out of wrath.  Act when it is beneficial, desist if it is 
not.  Anger can revert to joy, wrath can revert to delight, but a nation 
destroyed cannot be restored to existence, and the dead cannot be restored to 
life.  Therefore an enlighteneted government is careful about this, a good 
miltary leadership is alert to this.  This is the way to secure a nation and 
keep the armed forces whole.
-- Master Sun Tzu, The Art of War

again... not trying to be a fucking nag, but I thought that I'd toss in a 
couple pennies.

no music." -Lewis Thomas

'ProgressiveSoul'

pnm://live.selekta.com/livestream/cantos.rm


Guest:

founder of primalsounds.com

Carl Saunders
UK

Carl was introduced to the underground dance music scene in 1995 and was
instantly hooked on the DJ line. His enthusiasm and inquisitiveness of
dance music have always been constantly high and ultimately led Carl to
play many varied events across the UK.

Carl began by co-promoting and DJing at local events for students. These
events proved extremely popular and it was not uncommon to see
gatecrashers enter by window. For the duration of his college life he
presented his own weekly dance music show on the college radio station and
to mark the end of his college years, he co-promoted a 1000-capacity event
and warmed up for worldwide DJ Danny Howells.

Local promoters "Technosis" were the first to take an interest in Carl's
DJing, and after fulfilling many guest spots, Carl is now a firmly
established resident at this thriving night of underground Techno-Trance
in the heart of Hampshire's countryside! In 1999, Carl started his
residency at "The Voodoo Lounge" (Leicester Square), London, playing a
fortnightly three-hour Funky House set along side Ben Cherrill and Luke
Neville (Manifesto Records). Aside his two residencies, Carl has played
many guest spots at clubs in Southampton, Bristol, Guildford, London and
Nottingham (Media) to name a few.

His love for dance music is reflected in PrimalSounds.com, established and
run by Carl.

>well.  dj's take note.
>
>I saw alotsa friends there and was having a great time with them.
>
>the schedule was thrown off a bit and I couldn't stay to see Praxis.  he is 
>one of my favorite live acts.
>
>guess i will just have to be satisfied with his records for now.
>
>love always wins over the darkest hearts.
>JOnas
>

------=_NextPart_001_0002_01C3A3EA.86FAE450
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

This Thursday I'll be back San Francisco to help raise money for a
really good cause. The funds raised from this benefit are going directly
to help house a 24 year old woman and her 20 month old daughter. If you
have the time and can spare the ten spot, then I'd love to see you
there. And if you can't go to dance, then perhaps you can drop them a
contribution (see  <http://www.1-by-1.org/> website for details). This
one is legit and it's doing wonders for familys...


1-by-1 and Maximum Productions present:

RAISE THE ROOF 

Party for a night and house a family for a year!

Featuring:

Dragn'fly (11:00pm - 1:00am)
Lick the DJ
and more...

plus... beatboxing by Z-Rox


at Cloud 9
34 7th Street @ Market
$10 cover
21+

For more information visit: 

 <http://www.1-by-1.org/> http://www.1-by-1.org

Raise the roof at Cloud 9 and help end homelessness in the Bay Area, one
family at a time. 

Break the cycle. 
We find families a stable place to live, helping to break the cycle of
homelessness. 

In for the long haul. 
We work with families, over a period of time, until they become self
sufficient. 

Every penny counts. 
All donations go directly to supporting the families we serve. 

Helping those who help themselves. 
Our families are motivated, drug free, and willing to work to help
themselves. 

Fill in the gap. 
Our families pay for part of their own rent and expenses - we fill the
gaps. 

At the event, you will be helping Amy and her 20 month old daughter
Julia. If we can fill CLOUD 9, we can provide housing for Amy and Julia
for a whole year. 

Come Raise the Roof! 

Click for more information on our  <http://www.1-by-1.org/approach.asp>
approach,  <http://www.1-by-1.org/approach_families.asp> families and
<http://www.1-by-1.org/donate.asp> how-to-donate.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GOS - WAS --> rave docu circa 93? 


Holy sh*$ and the memories come flooding back fast!.. I actually have the 
flyer, one of the biggest of it's time, from a party (i believe the original 
venue was busted and it was moved to DV8, if I remember correctly) and 
called GOS where they showed that Generation of Sound film... I think it was 
the 'Juice' guys (Noel, Buck, Josh and company..) What an incredible time to 
be part of the growing SF scene.. and behind the post office.. damn.. 
another incredible set of memories.. I bought all my Fresh Jive gear there.. 
FJ was my sh*$ then. I was definately an FJ label whore, I mean damn that 
sh*$ was fresh!

I have that flyer scanned if anyone wants to see it, mail me and I'll shoot 
it over. Strait History baby. A nice trip back in time..

Check out this lineup..
Friday October 2nd, 1992
GOS '92

Theater 1
DOC MARTIN
STEVE LORIA

Theater 2
THE GOS DOCUMENTARY IN THE SEATED ARENA

Theater 3
SCOTT HARDKISS
NOEL

Theater 4 - special Fresh Jive video lounge
THE FUNKY HIP HOP GODS OF LOS ANGELES
DJ MIKE MESSEX & SEAN PERRY

Generation of Sound - A Documentary of Raves around the Nation with 
exclusive interviews with:

FROM LOS ANGELES:

MORIA OF BATLINE
FJ JON WILLIAMS

flyer, one of the biggest of it's time, from a party (i believe the original=
=20
venue was busted and it was moved to DV8, if I remember correctly) and=20
called GOS where they showed that Generation of Sound film... I think it was=
=20
the 'Juice' guys (Noel, Buck, Josh and company..) What an incredible time to=
=20
be part of the growing SF scene.. and behind the post office.. damn..=20
another incredible set of memories.. I bought all my Fresh Jive gear there..=
=20
FJ was my sh*$ then. I was definately an FJ label whore, I mean damn that=20
sh*$ was fresh!

I have that flyer scanned if anyone wants to see it, mail me and I'll shoot=20
it over. Strait History baby. A nice trip back in time..

I remember seeing this thing at Macworld SF last year. It was pretty 
weak at the time. Horrible latency issues plagued his demonstrations. 
If my faded memory serves correct, he didn't even have the Mac version 
with him at the time. Not a huge deal overall, but if you're demo-ing 
your product at the premier Mac trade show, you ought to have your Mac 
version with you.

Hopefully it's better by now.

Here's my all time classic lineup, 1996 in Chicago:

Derrick Carter
Joey Beltram
Stacey Pullen
Mike Dearborn
The Surgeon
DJ Hell
Diz
Claude Young
Robert Armani

Two djs from overseas, three more from out of state, and some of the best
Chicago had to offer, no fluff, all for $15.

The best house and techno lineup I've ever heard, off the hook!

-Andrew

Holy sh*$ and the memories come flooding back fast!.. I actually have the
flyer, one of the biggest of it's time, from a party (i believe the original
venue was busted and it was moved to DV8, if I remember correctly) and
called GOS where they showed that Generation of Sound film... I think it was
the 'Juice' guys (Noel, Buck, Josh and company..) What an incredible time to
be part of the growing SF scene.. and behind the post office.. damn..
another incredible set of memories.. I bought all my Fresh Jive gear there..
FJ was my sh*$ then. I was definately an FJ label whore, I mean damn that
sh*$ was fresh!

I have that flyer scanned if anyone wants to see it, mail me and I'll shoot
it over. Strait History baby. A nice trip back in time..

Date: Thu, 6 Nov 2003 01:45:48 -0800 (PST)
From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
X-X-Sender: andy@atari
To: Andrew Phelan <vgsandrew@hotmail.com>
cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <Law14-OE47VX0ObQ7uV0000da42@hotmail.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.4.44.0311060040250.5040-100000@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] [nerdy info/semi BSP] Re: [sfraves] Midi turntable


On Wed, 5 Nov 2003, Andrew Phelan wrote:
-&e->For all the visual folk on the list:
-&e->
-&e->http://ejenterprises.tv/faqs.php4?num=04
-&e->
-&e->A midi turntable adapter to control visuals, don't know how well it
-&e->works, but the concept is pretty cool!

First off, EJ works fine (when I saw it in spring of this year at least).
I've seen it, had a chance to lay hands on it and play, etc.  Cool stuff!

In a similar sorta vein, you should check this out...

http://www.mspinky.com/

I'm fairly involved with the project (my old bedroom in Sunnyvale was a
testing ground for it, and I demo'd it as this year's NAMM convention).
It comes with a stand alone app that works in a similar fashion to other
mp3/audio file turntable controls but that's not the sick part.  It also
comes with a max/msp interface object, which allows you to use a turntable
to apply accurate low latency/high precision control to anything max does
(visuals, midi, custom applications, robotics, etc).

A modern Mac with a decent audio interface can do realtime blending of two
movies (mixing, chromakey, whatever) with each movie controlled by a
seperate turntable... weird stuff mang!  And audio out if it is *tight*,
you can use it for scratching, beatmatching, all sorts of mixing, etc.

Available at $99 for the standalone version (vinyl and basic playback
software only) or in pricier packages with Max/MSP (a popular experimental
audio programming language that I use for live and studio work) or
Max/MSP+Jitter (Jitter being the visuals add-on pack to Max, for those who
know this is what Mike uses for the syncronized visual brainfuckery in our
BiPole sets).

This site describes the package deals, as well as a good overview of what
it all looks like/works like.

http://www.cycling74.com/products/mspinky.html

andyw


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:  Girls fucking suck.

Well, part of it is if you try to treat them too well, they may think that
you don't have a 'backbone'. Often times, if you're too nice, girls treat
you like shit. If you're a "dick" or rather, don't pay quite as much
attention to them, they seem to fight for your attention more. They may
think that you have more going for you, are more confident, or are less
of a spinless suck up if you're a bit of a "dick", but thats not to say
you should be mean to them. I've read a few things about this, and it
often mentions if you are too nice you may seem spineless. Or maybe, if
she is really hot, she is just simply young and full of herself and thinks
she is too good for you. Basically, bro, my advice to you is pop your
collar and keep it moving. If you are letting her stomp on you and not
doing anything about it, you lack pride. That is never a pretty trait. A
weak little man that can just get shit on. Stand up for yourself, have a
spine. If you got a lot of shit going for you, there will be others. If
you carry yourself with pride and confidence, girls will admire that. Be
confident in yourself, or change what you don't like about yourself. You
can always work on yourself whether it be social aptitude, muscle build,
penis size, whatever the fuck is making you lack confidence. Do your
thing bro, don't let her get to you too much, as hard as it is. Go get
semi-drunk with a bunch of your friends and talk to some other young
pretty girls. If she is feeling like this, she is possibly talking to
other guys. I dunno bro, my heart goes out to you. I know what its like to
really be into a fine girl. It can mess with a guys head more than
anything and bring out uglier sides in him, such as sucking up and
forgetting about his own pride! Hit me up if you bothered reading this and
found it to be the least bit helpful, which I hope it was. I'm stoned and
ranting..

peace
-- Daniel Kox

Subject: [sfraves] NRR (ranting about love for EDM and networking with fellow EDM heads)

I'm an electronic music head til the day I die
Electronic music has healed my soul many times
I owe a great deal to electronic music

I'm going to promote it and contribute to it as much as I can
for the rest of my life

Anyone care to help?!

Anyone care to discuss good shit with me? Recommend shit, trade some
music, and whatever else..

I don't want to trade any cds that artists release, or anything else
illegal
Just live sets, or clips, or whatever the fuck

Anyways, if you have a recorded cd on your hard drive for 24 hours and
then delete it, its legal, or some shit, I believe..

So?! Mofoz, please do hit me up if you share the love for EDM that I do?!

I'm mostly into Techno, House, Jungle, and some Breaks, although I'd like
to expand my Breaks collection of live sets! I am into some trance, but I
try to stay away from that crap and progressive, although there is still
some very good trance and progressive!


plurdizzle my nizzle
beyatch

As an occasional post-er and frequent read-er of this wonderful list, I =
would like to ask everyone who has had the benefit of seeing the new =
matrix to please not ruin it for the rest of us..sorry that's about as =
nice as I can say it...I want to see the movie very badly, as I am sure =
others do also, and I hate having surprises ruined especially on a good =
movie. I plan on spending my life savings to see it at the Metreon, =
which is where I saw the previous 2.=20

sequel, by all mean shoot it from the hip. ;)

thanks for your understanding.

hmm...  seems that caps are back in fashion.

if you haven't seen it, refrain from reading emails that contain
"matrix" or "revolutions" in the subject line.

it's a nice, easy and lower-case way of not ruining the movie for you and
keeping the whinging down for the rest of us.

Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <Sea2-F16vjo1Cy4dzUk0003f40c@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 06 Nov 2003 20:09:36.0488 (UTC) FILETIME=[E6C53680:01C3A4A1]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] DMT DIMITRI at (((THUMP))) this saturday in san francisco...beessspee

aloha all,

hope all are well.  in case you hadn't heard who is headlining (((thump))) 
on saturday at the dna, it is the one and only DIMITRI.  as most of you know 
we generally book live acts for thump, as there are very few international 
trance artists that can truly stand on their own as just DJs.  while dimitri 
is an accomplished producer with the good, the bad and the ugly (which is 
dimitri, dado/deedrah, and serge of total eclipse/antidote - which is a 
*ridiculous* line-up that we're working on for a future party), he is 
ostensibly the best trance DJ in the world, IMHO.

part of what makes him one of the, if not the, best trance djs in the world 
is his experience with the international scene since its inception.  he gets 
it and he knows how to convey it.  that plus his personal relationships with 
the best producers in the world for 15 years that give him all new tracks to 
light it up with.  that plus his innate sense of programming - building the 
perfect journey.  that plus he's been beat matching in the trance scene for 
many years when others were still crashing DATs together at 155bpm.  ;)

at any rate, DIMITRI has never disappointed me with one of his sets.  he is 
a gentle person and is truly one of the gems of the scene - but don't let 
that fool ya, he's a ripping hard DJ with wicked, wicked-good, 
wicked-whacked music that won't be coming out for months or years.

also we've got the head of maia records, arturo, up from mexico city (our 
first mexican DJ/act ever - very excited to support our brothers of the 
north american scene!), plus dutch and the thick progressive beats of kepi 
and the beautiful voice of kat to start the evening.  
drum'n'bass-breakz'nfunk upstairs with felix, cosmic selector (live), and 
android.

i missed wizzy so i'm looking forward to a damn good time this saturday.  
won't you come out and play?

for more info und zee presales:- http://www.thumpradio.com/thumpparty.cfm

peace, trance, and thump,

-bri

>>the ugly (which is dimitri, dado/deedrah, and serge of total

>>he gets it and he knows how to convey it.  that plus his personal 
>>relationships with the best producers in the world for 15 years that give 
>>him all new tracks to light it up with.  that plus his innate sense of 
>>programming - building the perfect journey.  that plus he's been beat 
>>matching in the trance scene for many years when others were still 
>>crashing DATs together at 155bpm.  ;)
>>
>>at any rate, DIMITRI has never disappointed me with one of his sets.  he 
>>is a gentle person and is truly one of the gems of the scene - but don't 
>>let that fool ya, he's a ripping hard DJ with wicked, wicked-good, 
>>wicked-whacked music that won't be coming out for months or years.
>>
>>also we've got the head of maia records, arturo, up from mexico city (our 
>>first mexican DJ/act ever - very excited to support our brothers of the 
>>north american scene!), plus dutch and the thick progressive beats of kepi 
>>and the beautiful voice of kat to start the evening.  
>>drum'n'bass-breakz'nfunk upstairs with felix, cosmic selector (live), and 
>>android.
>>
>>i missed wizzy so i'm looking forward to a damn good time this saturday.  
>>won't you come out and play?
>>
>>for more info und zee presales:- http://www.thumpradio.com/thumpparty.cfm
>>
>>peace, trance, and thump,
>>
>>-bri
>>

>>MSN Messenger with backgrounds, emoticons and more. 
>>http://www.msnmessenger-download.com/tracking/cdp_customize

>>>most of you know we generally book live acts for thump, as there are very 
>>>few international trance artists that can truly stand on their own as 
>>>just DJs.  while dimitri is an accomplished producer with the good, the 
>>>bad and the ugly (which is dimitri, dado/deedrah, and serge of total 
>>>eclipse/antidote - which is a *ridiculous* line-up that we're working on 
>>>for a future party), he is ostensibly the best trance DJ in the world, 
>>>IMHO.
>>>
>>>part of what makes him one of the, if not the, best trance djs in the 
>>>world is his experience with the international scene since its inception. 
>>>  he gets it and he knows how to convey it.  that plus his personal 
>>>relationships with the best producers in the world for 15 years that give 
>>>him all new tracks to light it up with.  that plus his innate sense of 
>>>programming - building the perfect journey.  that plus he's been beat 
>>>matching in the trance scene for many years when others were still 
>>>crashing DATs together at 155bpm.  ;)
>>>
>>>at any rate, DIMITRI has never disappointed me with one of his sets.  he 
>>>is a gentle person and is truly one of the gems of the scene - but don't 
>>>let that fool ya, he's a ripping hard DJ with wicked, wicked-good, 
>>>wicked-whacked music that won't be coming out for months or years.
>>>
>>>also we've got the head of maia records, arturo, up from mexico city (our 
>>>first mexican DJ/act ever - very excited to support our brothers of the 
>>>north american scene!), plus dutch and the thick progressive beats of 
>>>kepi and the beautiful voice of kat to start the evening.  
>>>drum'n'bass-breakz'nfunk upstairs with felix, cosmic selector (live), and 
>>>android.

I'd probably end up dead (with a big ass grin stuck on my face)... that's
some sick shit!  Mo' top shelf techno + house (and yes I do realize that
lineup is way more techno than house, I'm cool with more house too)!  Why
the hell is there a rift in the cultures here in SF?

I miss Martin's parties where he'd have Jon Williams and Stacey Pullen at
peak hour in the middle of a lineup that was otherwise all house from when
you got there till dawn with the crowd goin strong hands in the air just
feelin it.  summer night, on a almost totally unlit motorcyle track full
of nutters and tents.  that's the way it should be done!

boot!

The path of the righteous man is beset on all sides by the inequities of the selfish and the tyranny of evil men. Blessed is he, who in the name of charity and good will, shepherds the weak through the valley of darkness, for he is truly his brother's keeper and the finder of lost children. And I will strike down upon thee with great vengeance and furious anger those who would attempt to poison and destroy my brothers. And you will know my name is the Lord when I lay my vengeance upon thee.


http://www.ifxgroup.net/snd/FART_19.WAV

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

     Ok.... so how about a real review. So it has a awsome CG battle scene 
with the sentinals and the mech soldiers, that alone was worth my $5 matinee 
ticket, the scenes where the young kid has to reload the mech and open the thingy 
were kind of touching, & it was actually sad when trininy ... towards the 
end. i actually noticed people sniffling in the theatre. I like the last flying 
rain battle between super enhanced oracle/smith and neo in his last stand. The 
flying exchange of punches was so Dragonball-esk. So did anyone notice the 
blatent holy grail image in the matrix in the begining credits? or how about the 
blatent cross of light inside neo when he ...? Does anyone know what 
"Merovingian" really means? look it up. Anyways I like how the film starts out as 
everything you know about the your world is a lie, then it ventures into there are 
greater problems at hand. Such as the war with the robots in the real world. 
The robots were consequently products of man's own sin and selfishness, where 
as in the End Neo must battle his great opposite anti-neo like character and 
sacrifice himself in order to save man from the product of thier own sin. I mean 
it's not exactly a bible movie or anything of that sort but I like how it 
borrows ideas from many religions, myths & philosophies to the extream point 
where a fundementalist christian might think of the movie as a heresy, untill at 
the end you see the cross of light and neo laying crusified style being 
recycles back into the computer mainfraim. as if to say haha the whole idea was 
christian after all... iono i mean if they didn't want people think to of it as 
christian why did they put the cross of light and the holly grail into the movie? 
I mean it's not "bible" christian but it's like "gnostic" christian ideas 
like from the dead sea scrolls, that kind of stuff. I could go on & on, iono why 
none of the other movie reviews ever talk about this but i think it's really 
blatent in the movie. it's cool tho because weather or not you like or 
understand the message you still get your money's worth in the special effects and 
action and drama of the movie. - johnny

--part1_26.4113f997.2cdc3e7e_boundary--

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it (was Re: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME...)

Doug,

	I have a theory. You may not like it.

	There is a term that sums up the trends you are talking about 
(militarization, "love it or leave it," "the president is always 
right," etc.) These are all elements of nationalism. Like other forms 
of collectivism, nationalism is extremely dangerous. Along with racism 
and state socialism it was the backbone of Nazi ideology in Hitler's 
Germany.

	In the United States however, many of those who oppose nationalism 
have lost credibility since the 1960s. Why? Because they continue to 
put most of their energy into advocating a discredited and unworkable 
philosophy of wealth redistribution and economic micromanagement.

	During the past 20 years, the Soviet empire has collapsed. Statist 
regimes like those in North Korea and Zimbabwe continue to act as 
factories of poverty and human rights abuses. Meanwhile people living 
in free market oriented countries like Taiwan and Hong Kong have seen 
dramatic improvements in their lives. Other places like New Zealand, 
Ireland, and even "communist" China have seen dramatic benefits from 
free market reforms. Most of the European welfare states continue to 
stagnate. Around the world there is more and more evidence piling up 
that economic freedom works and government control and regulation 
doesn't.

	Most Americans are coming to realize that continued growth of 
government spending, programs, and taxes is simply not an option, and 
even what we have now is probably unsustainable. This realization 
didn't exist half a century ago. Back then it was widely believed that 
these trends could go on indefinitely, and that communism or something 
like it was the "wave of the future." Reality intervened with a sharp 
wake-up call. By the mid 1990s, even Bill Clinton was forced to 
acknowledge in a speech that "the era of big government is over."

	Unfortunately the federal government has become a runaway train. It 
kept growing under Clinton, and still keeps growing under Bush. More 
regulations. More spending. More people in prison. Thousands of new 
laws every year.

	And here is the danger: Any government big enough to do something for 
everybody and keep you safe from every possible danger is big enough to 
take everything away and throw *you* into a concentration camp. (Maybe 
they'll even recycle that saccharine slogan, "No child left behind.")

	Here's the decision facing anti-nationalists in the U.S.: Would you 
rather focus on dragging the failed ideology of Marx and Lenin into the 
21st century by advocating more and more government in order to "help" 
people? Or would you rather stop this country from becoming a police 
state?

Peace, love & liberty,
							<<< Starchild >>>

Damn holmes,
    I made the same mistake a couple of months ago.  I started diggin' on 
this chick and we got down a couple of times and then I started to actually 
like her.  I started treating her really well and I even went to Hawaii to 
stay with her for a week.  Big mistake!  It ruined everything.  I guess what 
I am tryin' to say is that I feel for ya.  I know what it's like when you 
find a great person and then you treat them too well.  I've now realized 
that it's all about having fun and being nice to girls, but not breakin' 
your back for them.  As much as girls pretend that they want you to do 
everything in the world for them, if you don't show them that you are an 
insensitive male every once in a while, they just stop wanting you as much.  
I think the trick is a balance of being nice and sweet when they don't 
expect it and kind of being a man when they expect you to be a bitch.  Yeah, 
that's it...  She was a good booty, wasn't she?  I hate gettin' addicted to 
the booty!  Oh yeah, another brief side note, if you aren't sure if a girls 
into you, don't have slow sex with her.  Gets people all attached and causes 
fucked up emotional boundaries that y'all might not be ready for.  My 
advice, when you start a relationship out, nash as hard as you can to 
establish a meaningless foundation on sex.  I'm still babbling...
Joe.

http://www.ibiblio.org/team/fun/birthday/

"... Happy Birthday to You, the four-line ditty was written as a classroom
greeting in 1893 by two Louisville teachers, Mildred J. Hill, an authority
on spirituals, and Dr. Patty Smith Hill, professor emeritus of education
at Columbia University.  The melody of the song Happy Birthday to You was
composed by Mildred J.  Hill, a schoolteacher born in Louisville, KY, on
June 27, 1859.  The song was first published in 1893, with the lyrics
written by her sister, Patty Smith Hill, as "Good Morning To All."

Happy Birthday to You was copyrighted in 1935 and renewed in 1963.  The
song was apparently written in 1893, but first copyrighted in 1935 after a
lawsuit (reported in the New York Times of August 15, 1934, p.19 col. 6)

In 1988, Birch Tree Group, Ltd. sold the rights of the song to Warner
Communications (along with all other assets) for an estimated $25 million
(considerably more than a song). (reported in  Time, Jan 2, 1989 v133 n1
p88(1)

In the 80s, the song Happy Birthday to You was believed to
generate about $1 million in royalties annually.  With Auld Lang Syne and
For He's a Jolly Good Fellow, it is among the three most popular songs in
the English language. (reported in  Time, Jan 2, 1989 v133 n1 p88(1)

Happy Birthday to You continues to bring in approximately 2 million
dollars in licensing revenue each year, at least as of 1996 accounting,
according to Warner Chappell and a Forbes magazine article..."

<3

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it (was Re: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME...)

--- Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net> wrote:
> 	Here's the decision facing anti-nationalists in the U.S.: Would you 
> rather focus on dragging the failed ideology of Marx and Lenin into
> the 
> 21st century by advocating more and more government in order to
> "help" 
> people? Or would you rather stop this country from becoming a police 
> state?
> 
> Peace, love & liberty,
> 							<<< Starchild >>>

The problem is, it seems that even when we elect people that come in
under the auspices of "no more big government!", they don't mean "no
more oppression" or "less nonviolent criminals in prison" - they mean,
"no regulation of businesses", "lowered capital gains taxes", "no more
checks and balances on capitalism", etc.  

All well and good for the corporate interests- but not at all
liberty-minded.  The right says they are for shrinking government, but
it seems they simply want to bleed social programs and award contracts
to their CEO friends, take away civil rights yet relax standards for
worker's quality of life, etc.  They want to bulldoze through countries
and simultaneously lower the wages of the brave people manning the
"bulldozers".

I may sound like a commie, but in this I'm more of a humanitarian.  I
want to see people taken care of, whether that means boosting education
so people can take care of themselves or keeping social programs
accessable to those who we've failed as a country to develop the
potential of.

So, to me, if I'm going to have to choose between somebody who wants
the government out of business's way under the guise of "liberty", and
somebody who'll keep schools, welfare and medicare funded, but who may
be more wasteful with money, I'll choose the latter.  Better to waste
in the process of providing care than to retain revenue and watch the
country fall (further) apart.  There is enough of an emphasis on money
in this country without the government, too, prioritizing it higher
than the right for its citizens to live with dignity and comfort.

There are few true libertarians that are well-supported and mainstream
enough to achieve high office- the American public fears change, which
means we're back to the old GOP-Dems crux time and time again. 
Overspending vs. Abandonment.

two cents in the swear jar,
George C.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it (was Re: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME...)


Right... both Democrats and Republicans are making the governemnt bigger...
just in different places.

however, the Democrats, under Clinton, were able to pay for their big
government programs, and they ended the term with a surplus.

The Republicans, however, can't financially manage their big goverment, 
and have us sinking rapidly into an endless hole of debt.  Debt that us 
younger americans will have to bear the burden of for the rest of our life.

I am voting for the party who can financially manage their big goverment
spending.  

Becuase lets face it.. unless you vote Libertarian... big goverment is not
going anywhere.

-troy



On Thu, Nov 06, 2003 at 05:07:15PM -0800, Starchild wrote:
> Doug,
> 
> 	I have a theory. You may not like it.
> 
> 	There is a term that sums up the trends you are talking about 
> (militarization, "love it or leave it," "the president is always 
> right," etc.) These are all elements of nationalism. Like other forms 
> of collectivism, nationalism is extremely dangerous. Along with racism 
> and state socialism it was the backbone of Nazi ideology in Hitler's 
> Germany.
> 
> 	In the United States however, many of those who oppose nationalism 
> have lost credibility since the 1960s. Why? Because they continue to 
> put most of their energy into advocating a discredited and unworkable 
> philosophy of wealth redistribution and economic micromanagement.
> 
> 	During the past 20 years, the Soviet empire has collapsed. Statist 
> regimes like those in North Korea and Zimbabwe continue to act as 
> factories of poverty and human rights abuses. Meanwhile people living 
> in free market oriented countries like Taiwan and Hong Kong have seen 
> dramatic improvements in their lives. Other places like New Zealand, 
> Ireland, and even "communist" China have seen dramatic benefits from 
> free market reforms. Most of the European welfare states continue to 
> stagnate. Around the world there is more and more evidence piling up 
> that economic freedom works and government control and regulation 
> doesn't.
> 
> 	Most Americans are coming to realize that continued growth of 
> government spending, programs, and taxes is simply not an option, and 
> even what we have now is probably unsustainable. This realization 
> didn't exist half a century ago. Back then it was widely believed that 
> these trends could go on indefinitely, and that communism or something 
> like it was the "wave of the future." Reality intervened with a sharp 
> wake-up call. By the mid 1990s, even Bill Clinton was forced to 
> acknowledge in a speech that "the era of big government is over."
> 
> 	Unfortunately the federal government has become a runaway train. It 
> kept growing under Clinton, and still keeps growing under Bush. More 
> regulations. More spending. More people in prison. Thousands of new 
> laws every year.
> 
> 	And here is the danger: Any government big enough to do something 
> 	for everybody and keep you safe from every possible danger is big enough to 
> take everything away and throw *you* into a concentration camp. (Maybe 
> they'll even recycle that saccharine slogan, "No child left behind.")
> 
> 	Here's the decision facing anti-nationalists in the U.S.: Would you 
> rather focus on dragging the failed ideology of Marx and Lenin into the 
> 21st century by advocating more and more government in order to "help" 
> people? Or would you rather stop this country from becoming a police 
> state?
> 
> Peace, love & liberty,
> 							<<< Starchild >>>
> 	
> 
> On Wednesday, November 5, 2003, at 04:26  AM, Douglas Fraser wrote:
> 
> >I said 'strongarming', not collecting.  The school districts based 
> >their logic on
> >privacy concerns and then the gov. made threats regarding educational 
> >funding.
> >
> >that's a little different than "we'd like to set up a table at the 
> >next job fair"
> >
> >the overall thing i am concerned with is the possible growing 
> >militarization of
> >american culture.  ok, you scoff, but this is a slow and subtle 
> >phenomena, so
> >it just doesn't happen like "poof!".  the "America! Love it or leave 
> >it!" and "the
> >president is always right!" crowd have been steadily gaining more 
> >influence
> >over the past 20 years.  e.g. nowadays, stuff like FOX News is 
> >blithely accepted
> >Where are these trends leading us?
> >
> >doug
> >
> >

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: the matrix:revolutions WARNING PLOT HOLES! (duh)


!! WARNING WARNING !!

Plot holes enclosed.





Uhh, I'm slightly confused about this major plot hole that was introduced
in part three...

The entire premise for this series was that the machines could not get
power from the sun, and hence had to start harvesting power from humans...
Right...  okay...  Fine...  I don't think this strategy is really
worthwhile, but I can go along with it.

The scene where neo and trinity fly through the clouds and see the sun
(ooohh its soo pretty), shows that it is in fact possible to access the
sun, and it's energy.

I mean maybe they are AU (artificial unintelligence), or maybe they just
like to take the difficult road...  But uhh...  wouldn't it be easier to
make floating solar collectors, or satellites, or hell, even harness some
of that menacing lightning that seems to be everywhere all the time, than
to farm and harvest humans for thier body heat?

I still find it hard to believe that the human body generates more energy
than it takes in...  Yeah right we're all fusion reactors..  wheee.


matrix 3 boo hiss...  The only redeeming scene in the whole movie was the
attack, even though the AU machines thought it would be more effective to
fly around in pretty formations wasting time, than to actually swarm the
humans and eradciate them...  oh well...  I hate it when the 'enemy' gets
dummed down so much that they are not frightening anymore.



Bah

> > regulations. More spending. More people in prison. Thousands of new
> > laws every year.
> >
> > 	And here is the danger: Any government big enough to do something
> > 	for everybody and keep you safe from every possible danger is big 
>enough to
> > take everything away and throw *you* into a concentration camp. (Maybe
> > they'll even recycle that saccharine slogan, "No child left behind.")
> >
> > 	Here's the decision facing anti-nationalists in the U.S.: Would you
> > rather focus on dragging the failed ideology of Marx and Lenin into the
> > 21st century by advocating more and more government in order to "help"
> > people? Or would you rather stop this country from becoming a police
> > state?
> >
> > Peace, love & liberty,
> > 							<<< Starchild >>>
> >
> >
> > On Wednesday, November 5, 2003, at 04:26  AM, Douglas Fraser wrote:
> >
> > >I said 'strongarming', not collecting.  The school districts based
> > >their logic on
> > >privacy concerns and then the gov. made threats regarding educational
> > >funding.
> > >
> > >that's a little different than "we'd like to set up a table at the
> > >next job fair"
> > >
> > >the overall thing i am concerned with is the possible growing
> > >militarization of
> > >american culture.  ok, you scoff, but this is a slow and subtle
> > >phenomena, so
> > >it just doesn't happen like "poof!".  the "America! Love it or leave
> > >it!" and "the
> > >president is always right!" crowd have been steadily gaining more
> > >influence
> > >over the past 20 years.  e.g. nowadays, stuff like FOX News is
> > >blithely accepted
> > >Where are these trends leading us?
> > >
> > >doug
> > >
> > >
> > >At 05:28 AM 11/5/03 -0500, Zephyr Stormrider wrote:
> > >>Doug,
> > >>Recruiters have been collecting information from high schools for
> > >>years.  This
> > >>is not a new phenomenon.

Subject: [sfraves] BAD KITTY FUCKIN ROCKED LASTNIGHT =)

OK... so like I had the best time lastnight ging out than I have well... since last Friday actually... but no I mean, there was jus' alota unexpected people I ended up seeing lastnight that I didn't know I would see!!!

when I 1st got 2 Anu... the 1st 2 people I bump in2 are Brandon (@Invibe) & Dann Carr!!  Good shit man... it was sooooooo Awesome seein' them 'cause I miss those fuckers when I don't see them 4 a loooong perios of time (Red Bull Vodka, what?)

Sarah Delush was spinning her Electro Clash & I Loved it!!!

Ok ... I reeeeeeeeeeeeally gotta talk about Andy's set... It was Fuckin' Amazing... but ya know... I expected nothing less from him...

I mean.. ok.. he started out like w/ hella old school like Acid House stuff I guess & Old Old Old Breakbeaty kinda stuff.. then he slowly went in2 Ghetto Tek like kinda breifly it seemed... LoL... oh man... he played some really garbage can instrument sounding house music... Totally spun some Electro Clash sound songs in there... Ooooh my gosh... I totally creamed when Some acid Breakbeats were spun... OK... but I LOOOOOOOOOOOVED it when he closed w/ fuckin' B-52s!!!  Loved it!!!

I mean... it was like when he started spinning I was like sooooooo confussed... it's like I didn't know what I was suppose 2 do 'cause like I wanted 2 stay... really wanted 2 stay ... but it was either I stay in the City @ someone's pad or take bart home & my time was like totally running out 2 catch the last bart train home...

OK... HELLO 2DAY, I said my Byes & I was Heeeeeeeeeella sad man 'cause I hate leaving things like early... was walkin' to go outside w/ my back pack then, Oh My Goodness, this Dude, Heeeeeeela tall Dude, comes up & hugs me!!  So I'm so like not 1 2 not pass up a hug... I thought he mighta been some kinda reeeeeeally drunk guyt who needed a hug... but it was Fuckin' Atomic.. Hello 2Day... my Baby Bro was in the house & well... he lives in Davis now so I (begged - added by phil while Osby was talking to his mom) demanded that he gave me a ride home last night so I wouldn't have 2 take bart & he did!!!  YAAAAAAY!!!

I'm sooooo happy he here now 'cause I really want him 2 meet all the people I know (well.... ost of the people I know) & get Homeboy exposed 2 night life up here 'cause it was all about Candy Parties @ Qtopia 4 him...

BUt yeah... I guess it was a last minute booking... but Forest popped up & that was YUMMY!!!  I mean.. she strait up spun this fucked up, delicious, bad ass Electro that went in2 break beats that went in2 Electro Clash... it was amusing watching this 2 guys & 1 girl dance on the floor!!   I actually wanted 2 grab that girls ass 'cause I dunno... ya kknow how like urges jus' pop up "who know's where thoughts come from" kinda dealie... but I didn't grab her ass  there was this 1 guy who was the butch dude who like would start grinding the gay guy in red dude who mighta been from France then well.. he came up 2 me a few time & tried grinding w/ me... that was fun!!  Then he would start grinding w/ the French Girl wear stripes who ass I wanted to grab...  it was funny.. me & Steph were like hella talkin' about them while they wre in front of us... they wre really fun 2 watch!

OK... SFRer's who showedup... ZARBET was there.. I swear man... his hair keeps gettting shorter & shorter every time I see him, Greg VP was there 4 a while, oh oh... SFR Newbie Atomic (AtawmicSFR on SFR... my Baby Bro) totally shock the hell outta me but was there also!! YAAAAAy... ummmmm... hmmmmm... then there were alota jus' random people I know from around the way there also!!  

it was a totally fun night & if y'all ain't ben there yet 2 kick it... I dunno what the fuck you're waiting 4... I know it's a totally ruanchy neighborhood & stuff... b ut I think Bad Kitty more than makes up 4 that!!!  Where else can U here that much Awesome Music in 1 night???

Who's goin to Harverst btw???  I still got some tickets I need 2 sell & if U want met up sometime this weekend or swing by my pad... I got a few more than I need... so hey... contact me =)

OK... Have a Groovy Weekend <3 Gianni... if your reading this... call me!

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

This week on Daytrippin' we join our resident DJ's Buckner and Sean Davis as we welcome Noe'l. So tune in and Get Down this Saturday to the funky-techy deep house goodliness you know and love. Tune your browser to www.pulseradio.net This and Every Saturday for the very best underground dance music. From 1-4pm EST
 
Pulseradio.net is a global internet radio station featuring 3 hour shows from all over the world! Started in Australia, the pulse crew has grown to represent shows from the U.K., the Far East, All parts of the US including shows from San Fran, New York, Orlando and Miami, South Africa, and Toronto, Canada.
 
While this email originates with the DJ's of Daytrippin which airs every Saturday from 1-4pm EST, we wish to highlight other shows as well. Here is a small list of the shows broadcast each Saturday as well as their corresponding genre of dance music. For a complete list, visit www.pulseradio.net and view the 'full schedule' for the whole week!
 
ALL TIMES EASTERN STANDARD TIME
5-8am The FatPharm playing Breaks and Bootlegs (AU-Sydney)
10am-1pm Rhythmic Jungle Punch playing Jungle/Drum 'n' Bass (US-Orlando)
1pm-4pm Daytrippin playing House, leaning toward tech and funk (US-Orlando)
4pm-7pm Gettin Smitten playing House, D 'n' B, Downtempo (US-Orlando)
7pm-10pm Euphoric Excursions playing Trance, Prog House and Breaks (US-Orlando)
10pm-1am Energy Guide playing Breaks (US-Orlando)

Date: Fri, 7 Nov 2003 15:11:06 -0800 (PST)
From: Karina <karina@hyperreal.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Message-ID: <20031107151001.J24207@taz3.hyperreal.org>
SFRaves<-_->http: //www.sfraves.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SRR: {hahahahah} BEHIND THE BUZZ: DO THESE STREET DRUGS REALLY MAKE
 SEX BETTER?

URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n1469/a06.html
Newshawk: End Marijuana Prohibition: www.mpp.org
Pubdate: Wed, 01 Oct 2003
Source: Playboy Magazine (US)
Copyright: 2003 Playboy Enterprises, Inc.
Contact: edit@playboy.com
Website: http://www.playboy.com/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/343
Author: James R. Petersen

"BEHIND THE BUZZ: DO THESE STREET DRUGS REALLY MAKE SEX BETTER?

LSD, Ecstasy, Steroids

LSD

HYPE: When LSD first became popular on the street, the drug was said to
turn your entire body into an erection, make sex last forever and create
orgasms that touched the cosmos.

STREET REP: After experimentation, many guys found that LSD was just as
likely to shrink your package to the size of a baby carrot--or at least
make you think it had.  Sex could be cosmic or comic.  Out-of-body sexual
experience was an oxymoron.  Caution, kids.

HYSTERIA: Rumors circulated that a medical study had found that LSD
damaged chromosomes, leading to the idea that recreational use might leave
you resembling a character drawn by R.  Crumb.  Or worse.

REALITY CHECK: "The early science about the drug's causing mutations
turned out to be bogus.  But the mere factoid popping up in the middle of
a psychedelic ascent could and did trigger countless bad trips," says
Ethan Nadelmann, head of the Drug Policy Alliance.  In other words, the
promised six-hour orgasm could become a three-day nightmare of torturous,
repetitive thoughts--such as, Oh, my God, don't let my kids grow up to be
Republicans.

MDMA

HYPE: As Jacob Sullum relates in Saying Yes: In Defense of Drug Use,
pharmaceutical giant Merck first synthesized MDMA ( better known today as
ecstasy ) in 1912.  But it wasn't until the 1970s that MDMA became popular
as a therapeutic drug.  Therapists reported that it produced feelings of
euphoria and empathy in patients and could "enhance communication and
insight." A leading proponent of the drug called it "penicillin for the
soul."

STREET REP: A person who distributed MDMA on the club scene in Texas
during the 1980s chose the name ecstasy because "he felt it would sell
better than a drug called empathy." The drug's street rep promised
enhanced sexual pleasure.  Time quoted one source who said the experience
felt like a six-hour orgasm ( what the hell is it with the six hours? ),
and crafty dealers started stamping white pills with sex.  Ecstasy became
known as the hug drug in part because of the feelings of affection it
caused.  But in many men it triggered impotence.

HYSTERIA: The Drug Enforcement Administration considers ecstasy the legal
equivalent of heroin ( a Schedule I drug ), invoking images of death by
overdose.  Indeed, the Drug Abuse Warning Network documents a handful of
MDMA-related deaths each year.

REALITY CHECK: Ecstasy impairs the body's ability to regulate temperature.
Ravers can die from overheating and dehydration.  Common sense says that
to play it safe, users should drink plenty of water, abstain from alcohol
and get off the dance floor every now and then.  Ironically, the rave
mantra "hydrate, hydrate" led to deaths by water intoxication--too much
water too quickly can mess up the sodium level in your blood and cause
your brain to swell.  That's not the part of your body you want to become
tumescent.  The guys in lab coats have reported that ecstasy causes
structural changes in the brains of raving rats that have been forced to
consume the drug for extended periods of time or in exorbitant amounts.
Studies involving humans are harder to read.  One shows impairment in
current users but not former ones.  Scientists have documented decreased
performance on cognitive or recall tasks executed by users.  The
government crusade against ecstasy, well intentioned as it may be,
obstructs attempts to self-regulate.  As it did during the 1960s, the
street takes better care of its own than the DEA does: ravers offer sample
testing to weed out counterfeit drugs, including those that may contain
the potentially lethal PMA.

STEROIDS

HYPE: Steroids enhance performance, maximize the effects of workouts, cut
recovery time and turn every weekend jock into Mr.  Olympia.

STREET REP: Few guys talk about the zits, the weird behavior or the sexual
side effects.  There is a widely told story about a weightlifter who
boasted about his chest, biceps and calf measurements but also admitted
that his testicles had shrunk to the size of peanuts.  Then there was the
steroid-crazed athlete who fucked a Coke machine.

HYSTERIA: Doctors have used steroids safely on patients since the 1930s.
It is only the specter of unsupervised use, coupled with uncorroborated
anecdotal evidence, that leads to crisis.  One of the common fears is that
steroid use messes with liver function and thickens the muscles of the
heart.

REALITY CHECK: Some weightlifters who use steroids have heart and liver
ailments.  But a 1999 study at the University of North Texas found that
steroids were not the cause.  Pump ridiculous amounts of weight even
without steroids, and you are likely to suffer liver damage and thickening
of the left ventricular wall of the heart.

Yoga, anyone? We hear it's great for sex..."   --

I'm still laughing over this article,
Karina
**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

>From: Karina <karina@hyperreal.org>
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: [sfraves] SRR: {hahahahah} BEHIND THE BUZZ: DO THESE STREET DRUGS 
>REALLY MAKE SEX BETTER?
>Date: Fri, 7 Nov 2003 15:11:06 -0800 (PST)
>
>URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n1469/a06.html
>Newshawk: End Marijuana Prohibition: www.mpp.org
>Pubdate: Wed, 01 Oct 2003
>Source: Playboy Magazine (US)
>Copyright: 2003 Playboy Enterprises, Inc.
>Contact: edit@playboy.com
>Website: http://www.playboy.com/
>Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/343
>Author: James R. Petersen
>
>"BEHIND THE BUZZ: DO THESE STREET DRUGS REALLY MAKE SEX BETTER?
>
>LSD, Ecstasy, Steroids
>
>LSD
>
>HYPE: When LSD first became popular on the street, the drug was said to
>turn your entire body into an erection, make sex last forever and create
>orgasms that touched the cosmos.
>
>STREET REP: After experimentation, many guys found that LSD was just as
>likely to shrink your package to the size of a baby carrot--or at least
>make you think it had.  Sex could be cosmic or comic.  Out-of-body sexual
>experience was an oxymoron.  Caution, kids.
>
>HYSTERIA: Rumors circulated that a medical study had found that LSD
>damaged chromosomes, leading to the idea that recreational use might leave
>you resembling a character drawn by R.  Crumb.  Or worse.
>
>REALITY CHECK: "The early science about the drug's causing mutations
>turned out to be bogus.  But the mere factoid popping up in the middle of
>a psychedelic ascent could and did trigger countless bad trips," says
>Ethan Nadelmann, head of the Drug Policy Alliance.  In other words, the
>promised six-hour orgasm could become a three-day nightmare of torturous,
>repetitive thoughts--such as, Oh, my God, don't let my kids grow up to be
>Republicans.
>
>MDMA
>
>HYPE: As Jacob Sullum relates in Saying Yes: In Defense of Drug Use,
>pharmaceutical giant Merck first synthesized MDMA ( better known today as
>ecstasy ) in 1912.  But it wasn't until the 1970s that MDMA became popular
>as a therapeutic drug.  Therapists reported that it produced feelings of
>euphoria and empathy in patients and could "enhance communication and
>insight." A leading proponent of the drug called it "penicillin for the
>soul."
>
>STREET REP: A person who distributed MDMA on the club scene in Texas
>during the 1980s chose the name ecstasy because "he felt it would sell
>better than a drug called empathy." The drug's street rep promised
>enhanced sexual pleasure.  Time quoted one source who said the experience
>felt like a six-hour orgasm ( what the hell is it with the six hours? ),
>and crafty dealers started stamping white pills with sex.  Ecstasy became
>known as the hug drug in part because of the feelings of affection it
>caused.  But in many men it triggered impotence.
>
>HYSTERIA: The Drug Enforcement Administration considers ecstasy the legal
>equivalent of heroin ( a Schedule I drug ), invoking images of death by
>overdose.  Indeed, the Drug Abuse Warning Network documents a handful of
>MDMA-related deaths each year.
>
>REALITY CHECK: Ecstasy impairs the body's ability to regulate temperature.
>Ravers can die from overheating and dehydration.  Common sense says that
>to play it safe, users should drink plenty of water, abstain from alcohol
>and get off the dance floor every now and then.  Ironically, the rave
>mantra "hydrate, hydrate" led to deaths by water intoxication--too much
>water too quickly can mess up the sodium level in your blood and cause
>your brain to swell.  That's not the part of your body you want to become
>tumescent.  The guys in lab coats have reported that ecstasy causes
>structural changes in the brains of raving rats that have been forced to
>consume the drug for extended periods of time or in exorbitant amounts.
>Studies involving humans are harder to read.  One shows impairment in
>current users but not former ones.  Scientists have documented decreased
>performance on cognitive or recall tasks executed by users.  The
>government crusade against ecstasy, well intentioned as it may be,
>obstructs attempts to self-regulate.  As it did during the 1960s, the
>street takes better care of its own than the DEA does: ravers offer sample
>testing to weed out counterfeit drugs, including those that may contain
>the potentially lethal PMA.
>
>STEROIDS
>
>HYPE: Steroids enhance performance, maximize the effects of workouts, cut
>recovery time and turn every weekend jock into Mr.  Olympia.
>
>STREET REP: Few guys talk about the zits, the weird behavior or the sexual
>side effects.  There is a widely told story about a weightlifter who
>boasted about his chest, biceps and calf measurements but also admitted
>that his testicles had shrunk to the size of peanuts.  Then there was the
>steroid-crazed athlete who fucked a Coke machine.
>
>HYSTERIA: Doctors have used steroids safely on patients since the 1930s.
>It is only the specter of unsupervised use, coupled with uncorroborated
>anecdotal evidence, that leads to crisis.  One of the common fears is that
>steroid use messes with liver function and thickens the muscles of the
>heart.
>
>REALITY CHECK: Some weightlifters who use steroids have heart and liver
>ailments.  But a 1999 study at the University of North Texas found that
>steroids were not the cause.  Pump ridiculous amounts of weight even
>without steroids, and you are likely to suffer liver damage and thickening
>of the left ventricular wall of the heart.
>
>Yoga, anyone? We hear it's great for sex..."   --
>
>I'm still laughing over this article,
>Karina
>**************************************************************
>******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
>If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
>much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
>& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
>-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

Hi, I'm trying to avoid the dreaded "cross-posting" but I do want to 
encourage people to go to this party if they can. Sound Asylum 4 was in SF but got 
shut down, and tomorrow (Saturday 11/8) there will be a makeup party in 
Sacramento.  It's in a permitted venue so there should be no worries about getting shut 
down. (Details below)

I know it's a bit of a drive to Sac from the Bay Area but I think it's going 
to be an excellent party!  Also, those of you who live in Sac or Yuba City or 
up in the hills somewhere, here's a good chance to go to an excellent party 
that's brought TO you instead of you having to drive to the Bay Area. 
Hope to see a lot of people there. 

A special CD release party for the long awaited arrival of "Hard Dance 
Sessions Volume One," a fully licensed 2-disc CD mixed by Steve Hill and DJ Denise 
(Tripoli Trax, Y2K Records, Neon Lights)

Room 1:
10-11 Keef vs. Danny Boy
11-12 Huey
12-1  Joey Mazzola
1-2   Denise
2-3   Dyloot
3-4   Dragn'fly

Room 2:
10-11 Sosh
11-12 Uphonic
12-1  Kidz at Play (happy birfday Mike!)
1-2   Scepter
2-3   Aleks
3-4   Tamim

FREE for all Sound Asylum 4 bracelet or unused ticket holders (please bring 
them to the event)
$7 general admission (either presale or door)
Presales available at: In Tha Mix (Sacramento), Skills (Berkeley), Frequency 
8 (SF) & Solid Grooves (Santa Clara)
Sound & intelligent lighting in Room 1 by Lite Brite Productions
Sound in Room 2 by Summit Sound
Laser in Room 1 by Stim-U-Lights
All *responsible* ages welcome
10pm-4am
100% permitted venue: Club Dimension, 5560 Palm Ave., Sacramento, 95841.

Info, directions & updates:  (415) 995-2334 / www.djdenise.com.  Email: 
info@djdenise.com

Subject: [sfraves] SFRCAL 11.07.03

WOW,

This calendar marks the 5th year I've been sending out the calendar. It's
amazing how time flies. First calendar was 11.06.1998. Taking a trip down
memory lane, the calendar output has changed and so has the interface!

Here's what my first calendar looked like:
http://www.sfraves.org/archives/sfrcal/1998/110698.txt

5 years ago tonight there was a plethora of fun stuff going on.. namely
Always Something to Remember presents The Moon, Immersion Productions
presents Stereoscopic and Trance & Jungle Factory presents  (((Radar..Waves=
)))
to name a few.....

If you haven't already, register as a user and create a profile. Then you
will have full access to posting events, creating groups and performance
connections, emailing your events from Hyperreal.org and so much more!

Register to create a profile
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/add_person_form

To add an event:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/add_event_form

Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a
leaf. -Tagore

Thank you!

<3 Karina

Friday, November 7, 2003 ** Breakthru presents...Chris Carter [TCR, UK] **

CHRIS CARTER [TCR / BOTCHIT & SCARPER / FORGED / London, UK]

Making his first San Francisco appearance, Chris Carter is generally
regarded as one of breakbeat's most creative and talented artists. From
his early work on Botchit with partner BLIM, to his latest releases on
labels like Forged and TCR, Chris brings a distinct sound, which
incorporates his diverse musical influences and cutting edge production.

DJ fans of Carter include Rennie Pilgrem, BLIM, Laurent Garnier, Adam
Freeland, Terminalhead, Hybrid, Hyper and Koma Bones to name but a few.
Carter is often to be found in Rennie Pilgrems studio where his drumming
and beat programming skills are called upon to augment Pilgrems remixes.
His tracks have been included on the =91Botchit Breaks=92 albums, =92Modern=
izm=92
mixed by BLIM, =91Nu Breed=92 mixed by Lee Burridge, Y4K mixed by Koma&Bone=
s
and TCR50. Chris Carter has collaborated with BLIM on a track for his
debut album and is working on material with Vlad from Breakneck aswell as
new solo material for release on TCR. He has also just completed a remix
for the Cup of Chi label, a new track called =91BottyFunk=92 for En:Vision =
and
is in the process of making more tunes for Secret Agent =96 on a down tempo
tip.

Chris has now established himself as a popular DJ and has toured all over
Europe aswell as the USA and Australia. His mixes have been heard on radio
stations such as Radio1, Kiss, Galaxy, Ministry, Groovetech and stations
all over the world.

FULL BIO:  http://www.BreakthruSF.net or http://www.tcr.uk.com

----------- PLUS!!! -------------- _aul _ice *Special Guest* Representing
BOMB Records SF, Super Duck Breaks, D.I.T.C. New York.

Jah Y'Zer [Dubphonik] Inna dancehall styleee....BOH!

Rasta Cue Tip [Various Blends] Rinsin the hip-hop/dancehall flavas as only
he can!

Clockwork [Breakthru] Resident deck technician on the onez n twoz...

Andres Octavio [Breakthru] Silky smooth mixing that is always on point!

A:Dubl [Breakthru] Evil mastermind 'pon the decks...

Friday, November 7, 2003 ** Breakthru **

Once again Breakthru brings you the most upfront breaks in San Francisco.
Making his first debut San Francisco appearance, we have Chris Carter
[TCR, Botchit & Scarper, Forged, UK] coming all the way from London to
rock the dancefloor. Resident support from A:Dubl [Breakthru] and Andres
Octavio [Breakthru, Stress Collective]. Upstairs hip-hop and dancehall
room: Paul Nice [D.I.T.C., NYC], a legend of the hip-hop scene will be
dropping hip-hop and funk upstairs. Alongside him will be Jah Y'Zer
[dubphonik] dropping sick dancehall tunes, Rasta Cue Tip [various blends]
rinsing the hip-hop/dancehall fusion, with resident support from Clockwork
[Breakthru]. This event WILL reach capacity, so PLEASE arrive early to
insure entrance. The Sitio will be transformed into a visual delight! 2
Rooms, 7 incredible dj's, 1 night. This all goes down at "The Sitio".
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D914 Sa=
n
Francisco California, USA

Friday, November 7, 2003 ** Tribal Souls - Nov 2003 **

Tribal Souls. Tribal/Tech House. This monthly party is in a well hidden
underground spot in the east bay area. This month we have managed to hide
Dano's (red melon, sf) passport. His return to our hideout comes after
speding a good portion of this year in Europe and Asia on tour. Joining
him will be our friends: Shawn(houseplant), Kevin & Wabo (rise @
sharky's), and our residents Jesse, Stevo and Phil Gauthier. All ages
welcome. 10p-6a. $10 all night long ;).

California, USA

Sunday, November 9, 2003 ** SERVICE THIS **

folks in the service industry (ie. restaurants and bar employees), but it
is most definitely open to all. Featured DJ's are: DJ Remnant @ 10:00pm;
M.O. Leisure @ 11:00; and TophOne (RedWine) and Charlotte the Baroness
(RedWine/End-Up) will be working the house from 12:00-3:00am. Weather
permitting, we'll be enjoying the spacious back patio overlooking the
water as well as getting our groove on inside. You can expect some great
funk and hip-hop for openers and whatever Toph and the Baroness decide to
spin to make you shake it. Cover is only $10.

Saturday, November 15, 2003 ** HARVEST **

MOKSHA TRIBE PRESENTS

**HARVEST**

Dancing is prominent in all harvest festivities, to bless the seed, assure
fertility, and provide the life force for the next season.

Moksha Tribe celebrates a gathering of the underground tribes to celebrate
our harvest:  the power of music and dance that unites our bodies and
spirits.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Ferona Room:  Techno (in order of appearance)

nomadicDJ (Moksha Tribe, SF) Reclipse (BayRaves, Deciblast) Special 2X4
set with Chris Jackson and Andy W: Chris Jackson (Resourcerecords.com,
Refined Music, Jump Recordings, SJ) Andy W (Resourcerecords, Refined
Music, Viberation)
 catharsis (EGR Records / www.egregious.net / Redwood City)  (This is the
official record release party for Cartharsis's new Xenos EP:  EGR-01)
Shawn Allen (Moksha Tribe, SF)


The Kornwolf Room:  Drum 'n' Bass, Breaks, Ambient

Phaedrus (Moksha Tribe, SF, HIP) hak (Easeuprecords, Killlasubz) Jauncy
(Moksha Tribe, SF) Calamity Jane (Moksha Tribe, SF, Ambreaks) V0lljude
(Dub Beautiful Collective)


Visuals by Viberation Graphics Special 5 Screen Video Installation
Lighting Support by Radiant Atmospheres Sound by SWAT

As always, you will be treated with love and respect and offered:

Free Water Free Fruit Free Refreshments Free Toys Free Coffee

Massages by Ravin Riz to benefit Larkin Street

Convenient Bay Area location

SERVICES http://www.larkinstreetyouth.org/

collective members.

Sunday, November 16, 2003 ** Endup's 30th Anniversary **

The Endup Nightclub, a San Francisco night life institution, will
celebrate its 30th Anniversary on Sunday November 16, 2003 from 6:00 AM to
8:00 PM.

This special event will feature a musical tribute to the past by special
guest DJs including JENO, LEWIS, and JIM HOPKINS. Endup Resident DJs:
DAVID HARNESS; The BARONESS; ADRIAN; VINCE; NOBEL; and DAVID PETERSON will
join them.

The event will also a photo and video retrospective, catered food,
champagne and cake, door prizes, and a commemorative CD giveaway.
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D893 Sa=
n
Francisco California, USA

Sunday, November 16, 2003 ** Progression @ 26 Mix **

pro=B7gres=B7sion n.  The process of progressing; progress.  Movement from =
one
member of a continuous series to the next.  A continuous series; a
sequence.

As unique as the progressive genre itself, we are pleased to present to
you: =91Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will
entail some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of
the best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.  This is your
personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory experience built
around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for the masses to join
our party, a temporal community where an attitude of acceptance, comradery
and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our underground movement,
with its roots founded on electronic music and our personal desire to
expose it to everyone.

Join our family and experience what an awesome year it has been musically
for our DJ=92s of this up-and-coming progressive collective.

Every 3rd SUNDAY of the Month Next event is NOVEMBER 16th! Starts @ 8:00
pm

26 MIX 3024 Mission Street San Francisco CA. 94110-4502 21+ please $0.00
Cover

RESIDENT DJ'S -- DJ JACK TRIUMPH (FriskyRadio.com, KZSU Radio, Qo=F6l Guest=
)

Saturday, January 17, 2004 ** Cold Phusion Winter Music Festival by BR
Productions, Next Level Promotions, and KCRH 89.9FM **

 he COLD PHUSION Winter Music Festival! Line-up TEASER!!! COLD PHUSION
will feature over 40+ Artists performing on 4 MASSIVE stages of sound! THE
WARP BROS: The legendary Warp Brothers - DJ's Oliver Goedicke and J=FCrgen
Dohr. It did not take a long time and their first single Phatt Bass hit
the German market and made it to the top 3 in the dance charts! Shortly
after this they entered the Sales-Charts Europe wide up to the #2! No
wonder that they draw the music business attention, with placing a solid
techno-track in the sales-charts.Shortly after their uplifting style
flooded Europe, the wave swept over to the US, Canada, Australia and
Japan. You might somehow compare the style of the Warp Brothers to Prodigy
or Chemical Brothers but the truth is that they created their own creative
and unique sound, like you can read in an article of the Face magazine.
Although the Warp Brothers are friendly people - they are in possession of
a lethal weapon, which is called Harder House. Remarkable is their success
in the UK sales-charts #9 and Top 10 positions in several Sales -Charts.In
Denmark they were rewarded with gold. Undoubted the Warpies as they are
keenly called by their fans turn it up on stage! DJ DRC: San Francisco's
Pioneer DJ DRC has relocated to New York City and is geared up to take the
Electronic Music Industry by storm. With her Mixed Album "UNDEFINED" in
the works and a list of releases on IMIX, Vision Music, Off World, Merge,
Twin Soul and her own label Undefined Musik, DRC equivocates the
expeditious pace of her new stomping grounds. Her original music is also
featured in two movies, "Vision of Vibe" with Carl Cox and "Intellect"
being released this February 2003, featuring Paul Van Dyk and many others.
DRC's latest single SEEKER can be heard on the SPANKEE clothing line
websight. With all this under her belt and more, it is obvious DRC has
already had her finger on the pulse of the Big Apple/ Manhattan. DRC
Returns to S.F. for a special set at COLD PHUSION! PLUS MORE CALIFORNIA

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it (was Re: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME...)

Just to interject a minor bit of common sense, the economic climate has been
vastly different between Bush and Clinton, that has much to do with surplus
or the lack thereof.  And if you can't see this and/or think Bush caused the
recession you really should brush up on basic macro-economics before
spouting about either party as it relates to fiscal issues and such.

> On Thu, Nov 06, 2003 at 05:07:15PM -0800, Starchild wrote:
> > Doug,
> >
> > I have a theory. You may not like it.
> >
> > There is a term that sums up the trends you are talking about
> > (militarization, "love it or leave it," "the president is always
> > right," etc.) These are all elements of nationalism. Like other forms
> > of collectivism, nationalism is extremely dangerous. Along with racism
> > and state socialism it was the backbone of Nazi ideology in Hitler's
> > Germany.
> >
> > In the United States however, many of those who oppose nationalism
> > have lost credibility since the 1960s. Why? Because they continue to
> > put most of their energy into advocating a discredited and unworkable
> > philosophy of wealth redistribution and economic micromanagement.
> >
> > During the past 20 years, the Soviet empire has collapsed. Statist
> > regimes like those in North Korea and Zimbabwe continue to act as
> > factories of poverty and human rights abuses. Meanwhile people living
> > in free market oriented countries like Taiwan and Hong Kong have seen
> > dramatic improvements in their lives. Other places like New Zealand,
> > Ireland, and even "communist" China have seen dramatic benefits from
> > free market reforms. Most of the European welfare states continue to
> > stagnate. Around the world there is more and more evidence piling up
> > that economic freedom works and government control and regulation
> > doesn't.
> >
> > Most Americans are coming to realize that continued growth of
> > government spending, programs, and taxes is simply not an option, and
> > even what we have now is probably unsustainable. This realization
> > didn't exist half a century ago. Back then it was widely believed that
> > these trends could go on indefinitely, and that communism or something
> > like it was the "wave of the future." Reality intervened with a sharp
> > wake-up call. By the mid 1990s, even Bill Clinton was forced to
> > acknowledge in a speech that "the era of big government is over."
> >
> > Unfortunately the federal government has become a runaway train. It
> > kept growing under Clinton, and still keeps growing under Bush. More
> > regulations. More spending. More people in prison. Thousands of new
> > laws every year.
> >
> > And here is the danger: Any government big enough to do something
> > for everybody and keep you safe from every possible danger is big enough
to
> > take everything away and throw *you* into a concentration camp. (Maybe

> > state?

> >On Thu, Nov 06, 2003 at 05:07:15PM -0800, Starchild wrote:
