> > > I have a theory. You may not like it.
> > >
> > > There is a term that sums up the trends you are talking about
> > > (militarization, "love it or leave it," "the president is always
> > > right," etc.) These are all elements of nationalism. Like other forms
> > > of collectivism, nationalism is extremely dangerous. Along with racism
> > > and state socialism it was the backbone of Nazi ideology in Hitler's
> > > Germany.
> > >
> > > In the United States however, many of those who oppose nationalism
> > > have lost credibility since the 1960s. Why? Because they continue to
> > > put most of their energy into advocating a discredited and unworkable
> > > philosophy of wealth redistribution and economic micromanagement.
> > >
> > > During the past 20 years, the Soviet empire has collapsed. Statist
> > > regimes like those in North Korea and Zimbabwe continue to act as
> > > factories of poverty and human rights abuses. Meanwhile people living
> > > in free market oriented countries like Taiwan and Hong Kong have seen
> > > dramatic improvements in their lives. Other places like New Zealand,
> > > Ireland, and even "communist" China have seen dramatic benefits from
> > > free market reforms. Most of the European welfare states continue to
> > > stagnate. Around the world there is more and more evidence piling up
> > > that economic freedom works and government control and regulation
> > > doesn't.
> > >
> > > Most Americans are coming to realize that continued growth of
> > > government spending, programs, and taxes is simply not an option, and
> > > even what we have now is probably unsustainable. This realization
> > > didn't exist half a century ago. Back then it was widely believed that
> > > these trends could go on indefinitely, and that communism or something
> > > like it was the "wave of the future." Reality intervened with a sharp
> > > wake-up call. By the mid 1990s, even Bill Clinton was forced to
> > > acknowledge in a speech that "the era of big government is over."
> > >
> > > Unfortunately the federal government has become a runaway train. It
> > > kept growing under Clinton, and still keeps growing under Bush. More
> > > regulations. More spending. More people in prison. Thousands of new
> > > laws every year.
> > >
> > > And here is the danger: Any government big enough to do something
> > > for everybody and keep you safe from every possible danger is big
> >enough to
> > > take everything away and throw *you* into a concentration camp. (Maybe
> > > they'll even recycle that saccharine slogan, "No child left behind.")
> > >
> > > Here's the decision facing anti-nationalists in the U.S.: Would you
> > > rather focus on dragging the failed ideology of Marx and Lenin into
the
> > > 21st century by advocating more and more government in order to "help"
> > > people? Or would you rather stop this country from becoming a police
> > > state?

--- Gururattan Kaur Khalsa
<gururattan@yogatech.com> wrote:
>To: <KYtraining@yahoogroups.com>
>From: "Gururattan Kaur Khalsa"
><gururattan@yogatech.com>
>Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2003 20:28:20 -0700
>Subject: [KY Online Training] NMB#75 Harmonilc
>Condordance
>
>Happy Full Moon in Aries tonight, Oct 9th.  Its
>been a wild one.
>
>
>
>Blessings,
>
>
>
>Gururattan Kaur
>
>
>
>#75HarmonicCon
>
>
>
>NEW MILLENNIUM BEING
>
>
>
>
>
>Number 75, October 9, 2003
>
>
>
>By Gururattan Kaur Khalsa, Ph.D.
>
>
>
>The Harmonic Concordance
>
>Lunar Eclipse November 8-9
>
>
>
>
>
>At the precise moment of the total Lunar
>Eclipse November 8, 2003 5:14 PM PST (November
>9, 1:14 GMT), six planets (including Chiron)
>form an almost perfect Star of David or Grand
>Sextile.  It is awe inspiring to look at this
>chart.  The symmetry and patterns display a
>moment of rare beauty that impacts the heart.
>
>
>
>This event happens at the same moment at every
>location on Earth.  Many around the world will
>gather to align in prayer and meditation.  The
>hours around this time are a sacred time to be
>present to the universal harmony and peace that
>exists in all our hearts. By spending this time
>together, wherever we are, we all synergize to
>ground Light and Love on Planet Earth.  (*1)
>
>
>
>The eclipse itself takes place at 16 degrees
>Scorpio/Taurus.  The Sun in Scorpio forms a
>triangle in the water signs with Mars in 10
>degrees Pisces and Saturn at 13 degrees Cancer.
>  The Moon in Taurus forms a triangle in the
>earth signs with Chiron at 14 degrees Capricorn
>and Jupiter at 14 degrees Virgo.  Together, in
>the compatible or complementary feminine water
>and earth signs, they create a Star of David. The hexagonal formation is 
>called a Grand
>Sextile.
>
>
>
>This is a very rare occurrence.  John Mirehiel
>first saw this formation while viewing the
>evolution of planetary positions using a
>sophisticated software program.  He saw the
>pattern begin to form early in November and
>come into exact position November 8th.   With
>further investigation, he found that this same
>formation has and would not occur during the
>4,000-year span between 1000 BC and 3000 CE. It could be much longer.  This 
>is the time
>period that Murehiel researched. (* 2)  No one
>else has documented the same alignment before
>or after these dates.
>
>
>
>There are many other astrological alignments
>and events happening at the same time.  Let's
>examine them and their significance in our
>lives.  I have noted the degrees so that those
>of you who have your birth charts handy can see
>where the planets fall in your chart.  These
>are the arenas in your life that are currently
>being activated, impacted and transformed.  The
>rest of you will intuitively know how these
>energies impact you by what's happening in your
>lives.
>
>
>
>
>
>STAR OF DAVID - GRAND SEXTILE
>
>
>
>Astrologically a Grand Sextile is a very rare
>alignment.  It forms a mutually receptive and
>unobstructed flow of energy between six
>heavenly bodies, which are sequenced at 60
>degrees or the Sextile aspect.  There are six
>sextiles in this configuration.
>
>
>
>The energy flow is further facilitated by the
>trining or 120 degree relationship between the
>two sets of three planets in the same element
>(water and earth this time.)  The Star of David
>is formed by two inverted Grand Trines. Sextiles and Trines are the easy or 
>flowing
>aspects in astrology.  Their energetic
>interaction is supportive and complementary. The widest orb, or difference 
>in degrees, is
>only 5 and 1/2 degrees.  These tight orbs
>further enhance the open energy flow, which
>creates a powerful vortex.
>
>
>
>Sextiles and trines allow forward movement
>without resistance.  If we go with the flow,
>life unfolds with little effort.  "In the
>elements of water and earth, this grade sextile
>presents a special opportunity for the
>emotional and physical manifestations of
>consciousness to ascend into a higher order of
>awareness and integration."  (*3 116 Austin)
>
>
>
>
>
>THE PLANETARY PLAYERS ARE PERSONAL
>
>
>
>The planetary energies present at the six
>points in the star are personal planets, which
>represent or are metaphors for important
>aspects of our individuality and personal
>expression.
>
>
>
>The SUN is the primal energy that animates our
>being.  It represents our will, vitality,
>creativity and the conscious purpose of our
>unique expression.  In Scorpio, the Sun is
>completely authentic and purposeful in its
>quest for total transformation and rebirth.
>
>
>
>MARS represents the spiritual warrior in us
>that courageously, with passion and innate
>willingness, takes action to fully express who
>we are.  In Pisces, Mars is fully ampted by his
>divine connection and his desire to serve the
>Infinite.
>
>
>
>SATURN gives us the substance and the grit to
>manifest our dreams.  Saturn offers us patience
>and a sense of order that make it possible to
>efficiently plan and execute our concrete
>plans.  When we play by the rules and persevere
>with discipline, the alchemy of manifestation
>is our reward.  Saturn in Cancer reminds us
>that self-nurturing, kindness to all and caring
>for the Earth are included in the rules.
>
>
>
>JUPITER represents how we tap into good
>fortune, how we expand and find wisdom. Jupiter represents our innate 
>optimism,
>generosity and enthusiasm for life.  In Virgo,
>Jupiter offers a chance to discriminate and to
>make wise choices concerning our goals.  What
>service and self-healing path most supports
>your life's purpose and work?
>
>
>
>THE MOON is the inner, feminine aspect of our
>being, which expresses through our instinctual
>self, our emotions and our subconscious.  In
>Taurus, the Moon reminds us to comfort
>ourselves with the beauty of the Earth, to
>soothe our bodies with sweet pleasures, to
>honor the Earth as our mother and to wisely use
>our personal and collective resources to meet
>our basic emotional and physical needs.
>
>
>
>CHIRON is an essential component of the pattern
>because it completes the Grand Sextile.  Chiron
>orbits between the inner and outer planets and
>is often referred to as the rainbow bridge
>between our personal and transpersonal
>realities.  Chiron reveals the place of power
>inside us that has been camouflaged with human
>wounds.  Chiron symbolizes the hidden gift that
>we must discover to make the conscious
>connection between our human incarnation and
>our soul self.  In Capricorn, Chiron instructs
>us how to initiate ourselves into Divine
>consciousness by living a path of Dharma (not
>Karma).  If we patiently take one step at a
>time, we will find our destination inside
>ourselves.  In our hearts we discover that we
>are already living the unfoldment of our
>destiny path.
>
>
>
>The above heavenly bodies are all what we call
>personal planets.  They represent different
>aspects of our personal unfoldment.  The outer
>planets, Uranus, Neptune and Pluto, represent
>different aspects of our collective lives and
>transpersonal realities.  The outer planets are
>conspicuously absent from the Grand Sextile. Individual choice and personal 
>free will are
>thus the underlying dynamic of this formation.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>INTEGRATION OF MALE/FEMALE POLARITIES
>
>
>
>The masculine/feminine dynamic is a powerful
>factor in the astrological configurations of
>November 8th.   It is interesting to note that
>the Sun, Mars and Saturn are considered
>masculine planets and are in the feminine water
>signs.  Jupiter and Chiron are also considered
>masculine planets and they are in the feminine
>earth signs.
>
>
>
>There are 3 oppositions incorporated in the
>Grand Sextile.  As I have discussed before,
>oppositions form an energetic interchange
>between complementary male or female energies,
>in this case, Earth and Water (feminine). Oppositions offer an opportunity 
>to achieve
>balance and the potential for the integration
>of opposites at a higher level of being.  The
>energies thus create equilibrium and wholeness
>in this peacefully dynamic vortex.
>
>
>
>JUPITER/ MARS OPPOSITION
>
>Benefic Jupiter in Earth Mother Virgo grounds,
>inspires and expands Mars divinely inspired
>action in Pisces.
>
>
>
>MOON/SUN OPPOSITION
>
>The Moon in Taurus and the Sun in Scorpio work
>together to direct us towards wiser use of our
>individual and collective resources.  The North
>Node of the Moon conjunct the Moon makes sure
>that we notice that respectful use of our
>resources is a requirement that we can no
>longer ignore.
>
>
>
>CHIRON/SATURN OPPOSITION
>
>Chiron in Capricorn and Saturn in Cancer show
>us that caring and compassion form the most
>effective context for success in this world.
>
>
>
>The Saturn-Chiron and the Jupiter-Mars
>oppositions indicate a reconciliation of
>father/son energies and a realignment of the
>establishment and the powers that be.  This
>further supports and influences a planetary
>shift in consciousness.
>
>
>
>There are other dynamic alignments supporting
>the reinstatement of feminine power and the
>goddess.  Venus is in a rare conjunction with
>the asteroid goddesses Vesta and Juno in
>Sagittarius.  Venus is also conjunction by
>declination with Pallas Athena, the goddess of
>wisdom. The various expressions of the goddess
>are working together to ensure that the truth
>of the divine feminine will be revealed,
>respected and revered.
>
>
>
>
>
>THE LUNAR ECLIPSE
>
>
>
>Eclipses are evolutionary events that influence
>us months before and after the event.  They
>create energetic openings that support quantum
>shifts in consciousness.  LUNAR ECLIPSES are
>super Full Moons.  They empower us to let go of
>aspects of the past that no longer serve us and
>realign our values.  SOLAR ECLIPSES are super
>New Moons.  They embody the energy of a new
>beginning as well as the completion of a
>previous cycle.
>
>
>
>This total Lunar Eclipse adds an immense charge
>and significance to the Grand Sextile.  It
>energizes this beneficent configuration with a
>massive infusion of both lunar and solar
>energies.
>
>
>
>Lunar Eclipses mark a pivotal turning point in
>a cycle or a milestone in a sequence of events.
>  In Taurus/Scorpio, the Full Moon Eclipse
>"provides a focal point for the potential
>alchemical transformation of physical reality,
>as we know it."  (*4)
>
>
>
>Eclipses in one polarity usually continue for
>one and a half to two years.  However, the
>Taurus/Scorpio eclipses extend from November
>2002 through April 2005.  Six months ago there
>was total Lunar Eclipse at 24 degrees
>Taurus-Scorpio.  This was energized by Neptune,
>which was stationary that day as it turned
>retrograde.  Neptune retrograde gives us the
>space to examine whether our inner reality
>consists of illusions or divine connection.
>
>
>
>There are eclipses in Gemini/Sagittarius
>(November 23) and Aries/Libra during the same
>time period.  This gives us 2 and half years to
>examine Taurus/Scorpio issues, which focus on
>the use of both our personal and collective
>resources.  We are being asked to seriously
>examine how we use the Earth's resources.  A
>transformation of attitude and policy from
>exploitation, waste and depletion to
>conservation, renewal and sustainability is
>urgently required.
>
>
>
>
>
>THE SCORPIO/TAURUS DYNAMIC
>
>
>
>Scorpio specializes in intense evolution. Scorpio initiates us through 
>catharsis, death,
>rebirth and renewal.  It deals with crisis,
>conflict, life and death issues and with life
>and death itself. (*5)   Scorpio obliges us to
>get to the bottom of issues, to face the hard
>truth, to expose corruption, hidden agendas and
>dishonesty and to clean up what is out of
>integrity.  Scorpio embraces confrontation as a
>means to connect with our deepest power.  It
>tests and develops our inner spiritual strength
>by obliging us to face our fears.  The promise
>is that if we do so and let go of what doesn't
>work for us anymore (or maybe never did) we
>experience inner personal power.
>
>
>
>Taurus provides us with the energy and
>incentive to examine our values and establish
>those that align with what we really wish to
>get out of life.  The Taurus Moon highlights
>attachments that no longer serve us and old
>patterns of self-indulgence and excessive
>materialism that need to be released.  Taurus
>wants us to align and shift our values, but not
>give up comfort and beauty, which are high on
>the Taurus priority list.  Transformation is
>required, but it should be well planned out,
>orchestrated and creative.  Taurus favors
>peace, pleasure and plenty.
>
>
>
>Together Scorpio and Taurus are exposing the
>underlying polarization and conflict in all
>areas related to resources.  They are bringing
>to our attention to the fact that life and
>death decisions must be made in areas related
>to water, the Earth and health.  Taurus says
>lets turn our values around from profits to
>people.  Scorpio reminds us it is a matter of
>survival.  Uranus is activating people power so
>that transformation becomes a viable realty
>that we work together to achieve.
>
>
>
>
>
>URANUS GOES DIRECT IN AQUARIUS
>
>
>
>Uranus adds a burst of revolutionary fever to
>the November 8th alignment.  Uranus goes direct
>after being in retrograde since June 6th.  At
>its stationary position in Aquarius just before
>reversing direction at 28 degrees Aquarius, it
>is in its most powerful position during its
>84-year cycle.  Uranus in Aquarius is going to
>wake up even those who specialize in denial and
>disregard for change.  The evolutionary winds
>of change are blowing in everyone's direction. The signs read either 
>breakthrough or
>breakdown, depending on your approach to life
>and view of reality.  If we have used the last
>5 months for inner re-evaluation, we are ready
>for revolutionary change.  The Sabian symbol
>for 29 (28+) degrees is appropriately, "A
>butterfly emerging from a chrysalis."  The
>inner change and liberation that we embraced
>during the retrograde period can now support us
>in making our contribution to the world.
>
>
>
>The Uranus factor can create intense emotional
>energy.  Uranus is certainly not emotional, but
>we might be if we resist some of the
>transformation required.  We may come face to
>face with some strong feelings triggered by
>undeniable messages that things need to change
>related to finances, relationships, sexuality
>and other areas of our well-being.  The key now
>is not to give up and try to hide.  The secret
>is to use the available energy to renew and
>revitalize our lives.  The excitement of
>unexplored possibilities offer us a chance to
>take a leap of faith, leave our fear behind and
>uncover the deepest passions that animate our
>lives.
>
>
>
>
>
>MARS RETURNS TO 10 DEGREES PISCES
>
>
>
>The evening before the eclipse, Mars returns to
>10 degrees Pisces, the exact position where it
>went retrograde July 30, 2003.  Mars went
>direct at 0 degrees Pisces September 27th.  But
>the full renewal of the planet after a
>retrograde period is not complete until it
>returns to the position at the time it went
>retrograde.  Mars has now been transformed and
>trained to take action with kindness and
>compassion.   Where 0 to 10 degrees Pisces
>falls in our birth chart is where our
>perception of the true nature of Mars is being
>revealed.  If we can act from a place of inner
>peace, we can move forward with confidence in
>this arena of our lives.
>
>
>
>
>
>SQUARES REQUIRE ACTION
>
>
>
>Each of the planetary interactions has a
>different energy dynamic.  TRINES and SEXTILES
>are the "easy" aspects.  They support us with
>the energy of flow.  There is no resistance. There is also no energy to 
>take action. SQUARES provide the energy to take action. OPPOSITIONS provide 
>the interrelationships
>needs for synthesis and cooperation.
>
>
>
>The November 8th alignment contains 5 dynamic
>squares that support us in taking action to
>bring our deeply held values into reality. What is interesting about these 
>squares is that
>they involved "dynamically compatible" planets.
>
>
>
>VENUS AND MARS LOVE EACH OTHER
>
>
>
>Venus in 7 degrees Sagittarius squares Mars in
>10 degrees Pisces.  Yes, Venus and Mars are
>going to have to talk and work together to make
>something significant happen.   They are both
>vibrating frequencies of higher values and
>Spirit at this time.  There is nothing better
>than the Infinite as an inspiring context to
>unite them to support mutual goals.
>
>
>
>MERCURY AND URANUS LOVE TO COMMUNICATE
>
>
>
>Mercury in 24 degrees Scorpio and Uranus in 28
>degrees Aquarius are square.  It is an
>opportune time to have a real honest
>communication about values, what is really
>important and transformation.  How about people
>power to make it all happen?  Mercury the
>messenger can certainly get the word out there
>and Uranus can mobilize the team of humanity
>for action.
>
>
>
>JUPITER AND PLUTO LOVE TO EXPAND OUR REALTY
>
>
>
>Jupiter in 14 degrees Virgo squares Pluto in 16
>degrees Sag.  Jupiter in Virgo wants us to
>increase the time and effort we devote to
>taking care of ourselves and serving the
>Divine.  Pluto agrees as long as our fitness
>program includes spiritual fitness and is
>uplifting and meaningfully fun.
>
>
>
>THE SUN AND NEPTUNE SEE NOTHING BUT BLUE SKY
>
>
>
>The Sun in 16 degrees Scorpio and Neptune in 10
>degrees Aquarius are squared off.   The willful
>Sun shines his light through the Scorpio
>transformation matrix and miraculously merges
>with the Neptune latticework, which
>conveniently has a human embodied light worker
>at each intersection of the grid.  The arena is
>clear and the team is already mobilized to make
>a difference in this world.
>
>
>
>NEPTUNE AND THE MOON DREAM TOGETHER EVERY NIGHT
>
>
>
>Neptune in 10 degrees Aquarius and the Moon in
>16 degrees Taurus square each other.  They are
>both dreaming of a world of the people, by the
>people and for the people so that we the people
>may not perish from the Earth.  Mother Moon is
>holding the intention of everyone being taken
>care of, having enough to be comfortable and
>enjoying feeling secure.  Heart power is going
>to mobilize them to make things happen.
>
>
>
>
>
>DIVINE PRESENCE
>
>
>
>The moment of the Harmonic Concordance
>coincides with many other significant time
>lines discovered, researched and prophesized by
>seers, mystics and scientists.   Various
>spiritual traditions indicate the autumn of
>2003 as a time when a shift in planetary
>consciousness will occur.
>
>
>
>Whatever the source and interpretation, the
>common theme is that the energy of the Harmonic
>Concordance supports accelerated growth and
>encourages transcendence.  Scorpio invites us
>to birth a new consciousness where we
>experience our unity with, not separation from,
>Spirit.  Taurus invites us to redefine what we
>give our energy and resources to and establish
>a new baseline of value for our existence. Both material and spiritual 
>transformation are
>the order of the day.
>
>
>
>As I mentioned above, all the major energy
>interactions (aspects) are present in this
>chart.  The sextiles and trines create an
>atmosphere of effortless flow.  The oppositions
>produce dynamic synergies and alignment.  The
>squares propel us into action.  The heavenly
>bodies are in supportive relationship with each
>other.  Why not us?   Harmony, wholeness,
>perfection and completeness pervade the chart. Why not the world?
>
>
>
>There is a profound sense of the presence of
>the Divine in the November 8th chart.  It is
>elegant beyond imagination.  Some have
>commented that it has the astrological
>signature of the Ascension, ascension of Mother
>Earth and all human beings.  However we view
>it, a signature of beauty, peace and harmony is
>present.  We want to take a deep breath and
>capture this moment of unity and power.  What
>is so special is the cosmic support to find the
>balance and alignment within so that we can
>operate from this consciousness all the time.
>
>
>
>The message is that this experience is
>available at each moment.  We are at choice to
>bring Light and Love into our consciousness and
>to live from the awareness that we are made up
>of the same substance that animates the entire
>universe.  When we do so, we understand the
>power of our projections.  We realize how we
>have created our current world through our
>projection of fear and how we can change it. Understanding and 
>acknowledging our immense and
>unlimited power, empowers us to operate from
>our hearts.
>
>
>
>
>
>THE MOMENT IS NOW
>
>
>
>We can pierce the veil that apparently
>separates physical and non-physical realities
>at any time.  We do not have to wait until
>November 8th.  If we wait for the moment, we
>can be disappointed that we missed it.  The
>energies are building up to support the
>awakening of our transcendent consciousness. It is a process that will 
>continue because an
>expanded reality is not only being made known
>to us.  A new reality is being infused into the
>Earth and into our beings.  We will no longer
>be separated between worlds.  Our world will
>merge into the luminous world of the next
>dimension.
>
>
>
>Our task now is to awaken ourselves up to
>experience a reality that exists beyond fear,
>illusion and insecurity.  To do so we must
>prepare our bodies to receive high frequencies
>of energy, discipline our minds and open up our
>upper chakras with meditation.
>
>
>
>
>
>BETWEEN LUNAR AND SOLAR ECLIPSES
>
>
>
>Eclipses build on each other. The total solar
>eclipse November 23 is at 1 degree
>Gemini/Sagittarius.  I have chosen the title of
>NMB #74 "Face the Light of Your Soul" as the
>theme for the workshop that I am teaching that
>day in San Diego.  (*6)
>
>
>
>The Taurus/Scorpio eclipses in November 2002
>initiated an intense time of cleansing and
>preparation for the two eclipses in November
>2003.  Between November 8 and 23 we are
>receiving a powerful infusion of Light that
>supports our personal and planetary shift in
>consciousness.  The vibration of our physical,
>mental, emotional and spiritual bodies will
>accelerate rapidly during this time.  We are
>each being bathed with high frequencies of
>Light, which create the opening of our heart
>chakra.
>
>
>
>As this Love energy integrates into our cells,
>we will experience shifts in every facet of our
>lives.  Pay attention and observe the tangible
>evidence of shifting, balancing and harmony
>taking place in and around you.  Notice that
>past patterns no longer rule your mind.  Old
>triggers no longer activate anger and
>frustration.  Annoying distractions cease to
>pull you off center.  Watch for the signs
>within yourself, in others and around you. Dare to participate in creating 
>a
>heart-centered world by reaching out and
>acknowledging others.
>
>
>
>The direction and possibility for planetary
>change depends on the intention and quality of
>mass consciousness. As we each change how we
>see ourselves, we transform how we see the
>world and participate in it.  As we cultivate
>balance and peace within our mind, heart and
>body, we instinctively interact with compassion
>and spread Light and Love wherever we go.
>
>
>
>Between now and the end of November, enjoy
>walking into a new world with every step you
>take.
>
>
>

just wanted to send a quick thanks to karina for all her work over the years 
putting out the SFR calendar.

when i first became interested in raving, i somehow found sfraves and i 
subscribed to the calendar (subscribing to the list came later).  and every 
week i'd get an email in my box with a list of parties with karina's 
signature at the bottom.

i think it took over a year for me to finally run into karina at a party!  
thanks again.  ;)

>Friday, November 7, 2003 ** Breakthru presents...Chris Carter [TCR, UK] **
>
>CHRIS CARTER [TCR / BOTCHIT & SCARPER / FORGED / London, UK]
>
>Making his first San Francisco appearance, Chris Carter is generally
>regarded as one of breakbeat's most creative and talented artists. From
>his early work on Botchit with partner BLIM, to his latest releases on
>labels like Forged and TCR, Chris brings a distinct sound, which
>incorporates his diverse musical influences and cutting edge production.
>
>DJ fans of Carter include Rennie Pilgrem, BLIM, Laurent Garnier, Adam
>Freeland, Terminalhead, Hybrid, Hyper and Koma Bones to name but a few.
>Carter is often to be found in Rennie Pilgrems studio where his drumming
>and beat programming skills are called upon to augment Pilgrems remixes.
>His tracks have been included on the Botchit Breaks?albums, 
>Modernizm?>mixed by BLIM, Nu Breed?mixed by Lee Burridge, Y4K mixed by 
>Koma&Bones
>and TCR50. Chris Carter has collaborated with BLIM on a track for his
>debut album and is working on material with Vlad from Breakneck aswell as
>new solo material for release on TCR. He has also just completed a remix
>for the Cup of Chi label, a new track called BottyFunk?for En:Vision and
>is in the process of making more tunes for Secret Agent ?on a down tempo
>tip.
>
>Chris has now established himself as a popular DJ and has toured all over
>Europe aswell as the USA and Australia. His mixes have been heard on radio
>stations such as Radio1, Kiss, Galaxy, Ministry, Groovetech and stations
>all over the world.
>
>FULL BIO:  http://www.BreakthruSF.net or http://www.tcr.uk.com
>

>Sunday, November 16, 2003 ** Progression @ 26 Mix **
>
>pro·gres·sion n.  The process of progressing; progress.  Movement from one
>member of a continuous series to the next.  A continuous series; a
>sequence.
>
>As unique as the progressive genre itself, we are pleased to present to
>you: Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will
>entail some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of
>the best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.  This is your
>personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory experience built
>around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for the masses to join
>our party, a temporal community where an attitude of acceptance, comradery
>and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our underground movement,
>with its roots founded on electronic music and our personal desire to
>expose it to everyone.
>
>Join our family and experience what an awesome year it has been musically
>for our DJs of this up-and-coming progressive collective.
>
>Every 3rd SUNDAY of the Month Next event is NOVEMBER 16th! Starts @ 8:00
>pm

>  he COLD PHUSION Winter Music Festival! Line-up TEASER!!! COLD PHUSION
>will feature over 40+ Artists performing on 4 MASSIVE stages of sound! THE
>WARP BROS: The legendary Warp Brothers - DJ's Oliver Goedicke and Jürgen
>Dohr. It did not take a long time and their first single Phatt Bass hit
>the German market and made it to the top 3 in the dance charts! Shortly
>after this they entered the Sales-Charts Europe wide up to the #2! No
>wonder that they draw the music business attention, with placing a solid
>techno-track in the sales-charts.Shortly after their uplifting style
>flooded Europe, the wave swept over to the US, Canada, Australia and
>Japan. You might somehow compare the style of the Warp Brothers to Prodigy
>or Chemical Brothers but the truth is that they created their own creative
>and unique sound, like you can read in an article of the Face magazine.
>Although the Warp Brothers are friendly people - they are in possession of
>a lethal weapon, which is called Harder House. Remarkable is their success
>in the UK sales-charts #9 and Top 10 positions in several Sales -Charts.In
>Denmark they were rewarded with gold. Undoubted the Warpies as they are
>keenly called by their fans turn it up on stage! DJ DRC: San Francisco's
>Pioneer DJ DRC has relocated to New York City and is geared up to take the
>Electronic Music Industry by storm. With her Mixed Album "UNDEFINED" in
>the works and a list of releases on IMIX, Vision Music, Off World, Merge,
>Twin Soul and her own label Undefined Musik, DRC equivocates the
>expeditious pace of her new stomping grounds. Her original music is also
>featured in two movies, "Vision of Vibe" with Carl Cox and "Intellect"
>being released this February 2003, featuring Paul Van Dyk and many others.
>DRC's latest single SEEKER can be heard on the SPANKEE clothing line
>websight. With all this under her belt and more, it is obvious DRC has
>already had her finger on the pulse of the Big Apple/ Manhattan. DRC
>Returns to S.F. for a special set at COLD PHUSION! PLUS MORE CALIFORNIA

From sfraves-return-108064-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sun Nov 09 03:42:53 2003

list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 61506 invoked from network); 9 Nov 2003 03:42:52 -0000
Date: Sat, 8 Nov 2003 19:42:18 -0800
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
Cc: Douglas Fraser <realityhacker@shaw.ca>,
 Zephyr Stormrider <zephyr@steelwolverine.com>,
 sfraves@hyperreal.org
To: georgeC <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <20031107172106.81500.qmail@web60302.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-Id: <B7D26CC0-1266-11D8-B6EA-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-ELNK-Originating-IP: 65.234.234.76
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Don't waste your vote! (was Re: Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it)

One big reason there are few true libertarians who are mainstream and 
supported enough to win national office in the U.S. is that most 
Americans vote based on how they think *other people* are voting. For 
democracy to work properly, people have to vote for the candidate or 
party that most closely reflects their views. Otherwise you get leaders 
who don't stand for what the people really want, which is where we are 
now.

Too many people vote without integrity. Instead of asking, "Who has the 
best ideas?" voters ask, "Who can win?" They make mental calculations 
like "I can't stand Candidate A, but according to the news only 
Candidate B has a chance of beating him, so I better vote for Candidate 
B even though he's scary too."

People may feel clever for voting this way, but in fact it is dumb even 
if they don't give a shit about democracy. Why? Because one vote won't 
change the outcome of any state or national election. Even in local 
elections it's HIGHLY unusual. Case in point: When I ran for Supervisor 
last year, one of my opponents was always bringing up in debates how 
she previously lost the seat by "only" 712 votes. And nobody called her 
on it, because we all knew that even in a district representing less 
than 10% of San Francisco,  712 votes IS considered a close margin.
And that's just a local election!

Now think about the odds that your single vote will change the outcome 
of a state or national election! Even in the 2000 presidential race you 
would have had to convince several hundred people living in the right 
counties in Florida to switch their votes (just try getting 10 friends 
to vote the way you want!) in order to elect Gore over Bush. And that 
was a freak, once-in-a-lifetime election.

So is voting a waste of time? Not at all! When you vote, you add to 
someone's total. Voting for a candidate or party with a lower total 
makes your vote go proportionally farther. Kind of like how your local 
DJ/producer will notice it more if you buy one of his albums than 
Britney Spears will notice if you buy one of hers.

When it comes to elections, voting for the winner doesn't get you any 
brownie points. It's a secret ballot. And even if you know the guy 
you're voting for won't win in a million years, that's OK. Because it's 
not just about winning. It's about sending a message. And it's about 
beating expectations. If a candidate expected to get 1% gets 5%, that 
is news. The media and the public will have to take the candidate, and 
her party, more seriously.

Next time you vote, take a good look at the names on your ballot. 
Chances are good that the one you've never heard of before belongs to 
the person who would make the best officeholder. You didn't hear about 
them because they got little media coverage due to running with an 
alternative party, they weren't an incumbent, and/or they didn't have a 
truckload of money to spend getting the message out.

Forget what the media says about who will win or who the "serious" 
contenders are. It's a bunch of self-fulfilling bullshit designed to 
marginalize alternative voices. Find out who ALL the candidates are and 
vote with a clear conscience for the one you think is best.

Support the little guys. Vote Libertarian, or vote for another 
alternative party. Don't waste your vote on a Big Government 
Establishment politician!  Would you go to an overpriced massive put on 
by promoters with a bad rep just because you saw a lot of big fliers 
for the party and got six emails about it? Would you buy an insipid, 
flavor-of-the-week mainstream single just because there's a big display 
at Virgin Records and you saw the video on MTV? No? Then why on earth 
would you turn off your cultural radar when it comes to politics and 
vote for a mainstream Democrat or Republican?

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>

(((((((((((((((( Partnership for a Free America - http://www.lp.org - 
(800) ELECT-US ))))))))))))))))


On Friday, November 7, 2003, at 09:21  AM, georgeC wrote:

> The problem is, it seems that even when we elect people that come in
> under the auspices of "no more big government!", they don't mean "no
> more oppression" or "less nonviolent criminals in prison" - they mean,
> "no regulation of businesses", "lowered capital gains taxes", "no more
> checks and balances on capitalism", etc.
>
> All well and good for the corporate interests- but not at all
> liberty-minded.  The right says they are for shrinking government, but
> it seems they simply want to bleed social programs and award contracts
> to their CEO friends, take away civil rights yet relax standards for
> worker's quality of life, etc.  They want to bulldoze through countries
> and simultaneously lower the wages of the brave people manning the
> "bulldozers".
>
> I may sound like a commie, but in this I'm more of a humanitarian.  I
> want to see people taken care of, whether that means boosting education
> so people can take care of themselves or keeping social programs
> accessable to those who we've failed as a country to develop the
> potential of.
>
> So, to me, if I'm going to have to choose between somebody who wants
> the government out of business's way under the guise of "liberty", and
> somebody who'll keep schools, welfare and medicare funded, but who may
> be more wasteful with money, I'll choose the latter.  Better to waste
> in the process of providing care than to retain revenue and watch the
> country fall (further) apart.  There is enough of an emphasis on money
> in this country without the government, too, prioritizing it higher
> than the right for its citizens to live with dignity and comfort.
>
> There are few true libertarians that are well-supported and mainstream
> enough to achieve high office- the American public fears change, which
> means we're back to the old GOP-Dems crux time and time again.
> Overspending vs. Abandonment.
>
> two cents in the swear jar,
> George C.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Don't waste your vote! (was Re: Nationalism and how to successfully oppose it)

I would disagree.
People are smart about their choices now.
In the recent Governor race, I met several people in my friend circle who
believed that Bustamante was going to support their cause (these friends
were Mexicans) and they decided to follow their leader. Others who heard
about Arnold groping the women, decided to move away from him. Yeah, it was
clear right from the beginning that Arnold was winning.

I wouldn't make such broad claims in this day and age.

Everybody should vote, educating the voters is the responsibility of the
candidate, many times they fail to do their part.

In a true democracy, making statements like  "support the small people"
somehow comes off "Corny" to me, coming from someone who wants people to
make their choices more liberally.

Agree?

Anil

From: "Starchild" <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>

Subject: [sfraves] Don't waste your vote! (was Re: Nationalism and how to

> One big reason there are few true libertarians who are mainstream and
> supported enough to win national office in the U.S. is that most
> Americans vote based on how they think *other people* are voting. For
> democracy to work properly, people have to vote for the candidate or
> party that most closely reflects their views. Otherwise you get leaders
> who don't stand for what the people really want, which is where we are
> now.
>
> Too many people vote without integrity. Instead of asking, "Who has the
> best ideas?" voters ask, "Who can win?" They make mental calculations
> like "I can't stand Candidate A, but according to the news only
> Candidate B has a chance of beating him, so I better vote for Candidate
> B even though he's scary too."
>
> People may feel clever for voting this way, but in fact it is dumb even
> if they don't give a shit about democracy. Why? Because one vote won't
> change the outcome of any state or national election. Even in local
> elections it's HIGHLY unusual. Case in point: When I ran for Supervisor
> last year, one of my opponents was always bringing up in debates how
> she previously lost the seat by "only" 712 votes. And nobody called her
> on it, because we all knew that even in a district representing less
> than 10% of San Francisco,  712 votes IS considered a close margin.
> And that's just a local election!
>
> Now think about the odds that your single vote will change the outcome
> of a state or national election! Even in the 2000 presidential race you
> would have had to convince several hundred people living in the right
> counties in Florida to switch their votes (just try getting 10 friends
> to vote the way you want!) in order to elect Gore over Bush. And that
> was a freak, once-in-a-lifetime election.
>
> So is voting a waste of time? Not at all! When you vote, you add to
> someone's total. Voting for a candidate or party with a lower total
> makes your vote go proportionally farther. Kind of like how your local
> DJ/producer will notice it more if you buy one of his albums than
> Britney Spears will notice if you buy one of hers.
>
> When it comes to elections, voting for the winner doesn't get you any
> brownie points. It's a secret ballot. And even if you know the guy
> you're voting for won't win in a million years, that's OK. Because it's
> not just about winning. It's about sending a message. And it's about
> beating expectations. If a candidate expected to get 1% gets 5%, that
> is news. The media and the public will have to take the candidate, and
> her party, more seriously.
>
> Next time you vote, take a good look at the names on your ballot.
> Chances are good that the one you've never heard of before belongs to
> the person who would make the best officeholder. You didn't hear about
> them because they got little media coverage due to running with an
> alternative party, they weren't an incumbent, and/or they didn't have a
> truckload of money to spend getting the message out.
>
> Forget what the media says about who will win or who the "serious"
> contenders are. It's a bunch of self-fulfilling bullshit designed to
> marginalize alternative voices. Find out who ALL the candidates are and
> vote with a clear conscience for the one you think is best.
>

> alternative party. Don't waste your vote on a Big Government
> Establishment politician!  Would you go to an overpriced massive put on
> by promoters with a bad rep just because you saw a lot of big fliers
> for the party and got six emails about it? Would you buy an insipid,
> flavor-of-the-week mainstream single just because there's a big display
> at Virgin Records and you saw the video on MTV? No? Then why on earth
> would you turn off your cultural radar when it comes to politics and
> vote for a mainstream Democrat or Republican?

Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
Cc: "georgeC" <newstylesound@yahoo.com>,
 "Douglas Fraser" <realityhacker@shaw.ca>,
 "Zephyr Stormrider" <zephyr@steelwolverine.com>,
  <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
To: "anilo1" <anilo1@pacbell.net>
From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <001201c3a676$089610b0$0200a8c0@SpareLaptop>
Message-Id: <474C9E01-1287-11D8-B6EA-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: Don't waste your vote! (NRR)

After reading this message, I'm confused. Is it "smart" to vote for a 
politician of Mexican ancestry like Bustamante just because you happen 
to be Mexican instead of based on the issues? Being mistrustful of a 
candidate accused of groping large numbers of women may be smart. Of 
course it's also hypocritical if one says such things matter in the 
case of Arnold Schwarzenegger but not Bill Clinton -- or vice versa.

In any case, I wasn't trying to make a broad generalization that people 
are stupid. With a few notable exceptions (!), most of us are smart 
about some things and dumb about others. I'm just saying an honest look 
at election numbers proves that it's dumb to think that you're wasting 
your vote if you don't go for an establishment choice. This irrational 
"wasted vote syndrome" is the #1 factor keeping Libertarians and other 
alternative parties successfully marginalized.

It's the same phenomenon that causes Las Vegas slot machines and the 
California Lottery to be so profitable: Too many people haven't stopped 
to do the math, which makes them easy targets for manipulation. 
"Support the little guys" may sound corny, but doesn't it make more 
sense in a system run by an entrenched power elite than "Vote for a 
winner" or "It doesn't matter who you vote for, as long as you vote?"

Peace, love & liberty,
								<<< Starchild >>>

>>> potential of.

>>> So, to me, if I'm going to have to choose between somebody who wants
>>> the government out of business's way under the guise of "liberty", 
>>> and
>>> somebody who'll keep schools, welfare and medicare funded, but who 
>>> may
>>> be more wasteful with money, I'll choose the latter.  Better to waste
>>> in the process of providing care than to retain revenue and watch the
>>> country fall (further) apart.  There is enough of an emphasis on 
>>> money
>>> in this country without the government, too, prioritizing it higher
>>> than the right for its citizens to live with dignity and comfort.
>>>
>>> There are few true libertarians that are well-supported and 
>>> mainstream
>>> enough to achieve high office- the American public fears change, 
>>> which
>>> means we're back to the old GOP-Dems crux time and time again.
>>> Overspending vs. Abandonment.
>>>
>>> two cents in the swear jar,
>>> George C.
>>

Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio 11/09 : Dirtbox Kru in DIRTBOX ALLSTARS II :.


Tonight we have a special presentation for you here on Dirtbox Radio: Part
two of the Dirtbox Allstars series.  It's a rare event where we can
actually get all of the members of the Dirtbox Kru here in the studio and
jam out hard for y'all.

due to circumstances out of our control, but it'll be a damn tight show
nonetheless.  Timeslots and audio links are below, for your listening
enjoyment.

tune, feel free to hit us up at bookme@dirtboxradio.com.  We're slow to
respond, but don't worry - we'll get back to you eventually.

See y'all tonight.

X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: Don't waste your vote! (NRR)

It is sort of a conundrum isn't it.

Here's an analysis based on a recent attempt to take the GMAT(MBA entrance)
exam.

Read a short paragraph and answer the question that follows it:
You have 5 choices: a,b,c,d,e.

Here are 3 different possible ways to solve this problem:
1. If you have read the Peterson's guide you would skim over the paragraph,
use the "Process of Elimination" , cross down the usual suspects, and pick
one.
2. If you haven't read any such guide, you will spend a lot of time reading
the paragraph and pick a calculated choice, you will probably take a longer
time, miss the questions in the end and get a low overall score.
3. You find the question to be tough and you want to skip the question
completely. Such people might have at time made the best choice due to
negative scoring.
4. Randomly picks one. Treats it like a Las Vegas slot machine.

This is exactly what happens in an election.

People forget that its not an exam, its not a score, its believing in
something, someone.
Which is why some of them choose to follow what their friends & family are
doing. Because they believe their friends know best.

Ever met a Democratic family, I'm sure you have. They are all tied together
because one person made the decision, long time ago, for the rest of the
family. These people are so stoned they would even have the nerve to speak
up in a stern voice and claim, "WE ARE DEMOCRATS".

It's sad. It's true.

What we can and should do is educate people to step out of their box and
really read the paragraph, not be dismissal of any accusations they read in
the news and at the same time not be too influenced by such sensational
news.

Our leaders should do a better job of branching out and reaching the people.

Can you imagine Arnold - supporting the Mexicans and their cause. No. If he
doesn't do it, the mexicans are gonna keep hoping for a mexican leader. It's
not something you and I can change, we can only hope.

BTW : "Support the little guys" -- still sounds corny :)
And, it is always important to vote, and vote for the candidate that you
believe in.

Here's a game plan of what we can do: You, me and everyone else who wants
the system to work:
a.> Expand your circle of influence. Have more such open discussions in your
circle.
b.> Act as a data-center to provide non-biased and accurate political news.
c.> Act as a neutral party with the aim of providing honest, true, accurate
news.
d.> Perhaps we can somehow influence our leaders to do a better job too.

Anil

> After reading this message, I'm confused. Is it "smart" to vote for a
> politician of Mexican ancestry like Bustamante just because you happen

> course it's also hypocritical if one says such things matter in the
> case of Arnold Schwarzenegger but not Bill Clinton -- or vice versa.
>
> In any case, I wasn't trying to make a broad generalization that people
> are stupid. With a few notable exceptions (!), most of us are smart
> about some things and dumb about others. I'm just saying an honest look
> at election numbers proves that it's dumb to think that you're wasting
> your vote if you don't go for an establishment choice. This irrational
> "wasted vote syndrome" is the #1 factor keeping Libertarians and other
> alternative parties successfully marginalized.
>
> It's the same phenomenon that causes Las Vegas slot machines and the
> California Lottery to be so profitable: Too many people haven't stopped
> to do the math, which makes them easy targets for manipulation.
> "Support the little guys" may sound corny, but doesn't it make more
> sense in a system run by an entrenched power elite than "Vote for a
> winner" or "It doesn't matter who you vote for, as long as you vote?"
>

> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Starchild" <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
> > To: "georgeC" <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
> > Cc: "Douglas Fraser" <realityhacker@shaw.ca>; "Zephyr Stormrider"
> > <zephyr@steelwolverine.com>; <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
> > Sent: Saturday, November 08, 2003 9:42 PM
> > Subject: [sfraves] Don't waste your vote! (was Re: Nationalism and how
> > to
> > successfully oppose it)
> >
> >
> >> One big reason there are few true libertarians who are mainstream and
> >> supported enough to win national office in the U.S. is that most
> >> Americans vote based on how they think *other people* are voting. For
> >> democracy to work properly, people have to vote for the candidate or
> >> party that most closely reflects their views. Otherwise you get
> >> leaders
> >> who don't stand for what the people really want, which is where we are
> >> now.
> >>
> >> Too many people vote without integrity. Instead of asking, "Who has
> >> the
> >> best ideas?" voters ask, "Who can win?" They make mental calculations
> >> like "I can't stand Candidate A, but according to the news only
> >> Candidate B has a chance of beating him, so I better vote for
> >> Candidate
> >> B even though he's scary too."
> >>
> >> People may feel clever for voting this way, but in fact it is dumb
> >> even
> >> if they don't give a shit about democracy. Why? Because one vote won't
> >> change the outcome of any state or national election. Even in local
> >> elections it's HIGHLY unusual. Case in point: When I ran for
> >> Supervisor
> >> last year, one of my opponents was always bringing up in debates how
> >> she previously lost the seat by "only" 712 votes. And nobody called
> >> her
> >> on it, because we all knew that even in a district representing less
> >> than 10% of San Francisco,  712 votes IS considered a close margin.
> >> And that's just a local election!
> >>
> >> Now think about the odds that your single vote will change the outcome
> >> of a state or national election! Even in the 2000 presidential race
> >> you
> >> would have had to convince several hundred people living in the right
> >> counties in Florida to switch their votes (just try getting 10 friends
> >> to vote the way you want!) in order to elect Gore over Bush. And that
> >> was a freak, once-in-a-lifetime election.
> >>
> >> So is voting a waste of time? Not at all! When you vote, you add to
> >> someone's total. Voting for a candidate or party with a lower total
> >> makes your vote go proportionally farther. Kind of like how your local
> >> DJ/producer will notice it more if you buy one of his albums than
> >> Britney Spears will notice if you buy one of hers.
> >>
> >> When it comes to elections, voting for the winner doesn't get you any
> >> brownie points. It's a secret ballot. And even if you know the guy
> >> you're voting for won't win in a million years, that's OK. Because
> >> it's
> >> not just about winning. It's about sending a message. And it's about
> >> beating expectations. If a candidate expected to get 1% gets 5%, that
> >> is news. The media and the public will have to take the candidate, and
> >> her party, more seriously.
> >>
> >> Next time you vote, take a good look at the names on your ballot.
> >> Chances are good that the one you've never heard of before belongs to
> >> the person who would make the best officeholder. You didn't hear about
> >> them because they got little media coverage due to running with an
> >> alternative party, they weren't an incumbent, and/or they didn't have
> >> a
> >> truckload of money to spend getting the message out.
> >>
> >> Forget what the media says about who will win or who the "serious"
> >> contenders are. It's a bunch of self-fulfilling bullshit designed to
> >> marginalize alternative voices. Find out who ALL the candidates are
> >> and
> >> vote with a clear conscience for the one you think is best.
> >>
> >> Support the little guys. Vote Libertarian, or vote for another
> >> alternative party. Don't waste your vote on a Big Government
> >> Establishment politician!  Would you go to an overpriced massive put
> >> on
> >> by promoters with a bad rep just because you saw a lot of big fliers
> >> for the party and got six emails about it? Would you buy an insipid,
> >> flavor-of-the-week mainstream single just because there's a big
> >> display
> >> at Virgin Records and you saw the video on MTV? No? Then why on earth
> >> would you turn off your cultural radar when it comes to politics and
> >> vote for a mainstream Democrat or Republican?
> >>
> >> Groove on,
> >> <<< Starchild >>>
> >>
> >> (((((((((((((((( Partnership for a Free America - http://www.lp.org -
> >> (800) ELECT-US ))))))))))))))))
> >>
> >>
> >> On Friday, November 7, 2003, at 09:21  AM, georgeC wrote:
> >>
> >>> The problem is, it seems that even when we elect people that come in
> >>> under the auspices of "no more big government!", they don't mean "no
> >>> more oppression" or "less nonviolent criminals in prison" - they
> >>> mean,
> >>> "no regulation of businesses", "lowered capital gains taxes", "no
> >>> more
> >>> checks and balances on capitalism", etc.
> >>>
> >>> All well and good for the corporate interests- but not at all
> >>> liberty-minded.  The right says they are for shrinking government,
> >>> but
> >>> it seems they simply want to bleed social programs and award
> >>> contracts
> >>> to their CEO friends, take away civil rights yet relax standards for
> >>> worker's quality of life, etc.  They want to bulldoze through
> >>> countries
> >>> and simultaneously lower the wages of the brave people manning the
> >>> "bulldozers".
> >>>
> >>> I may sound like a commie, but in this I'm more of a humanitarian.  I
> >>> want to see people taken care of, whether that means boosting
> >>> education
> >>> so people can take care of themselves or keeping social programs
> >>> accessable to those who we've failed as a country to develop the
> >>> potential of.
> >>>
> >>> So, to me, if I'm going to have to choose between somebody who wants
> >>> the government out of business's way under the guise of "liberty",
> >>> and
> >>> somebody who'll keep schools, welfare and medicare funded, but who
> >>> may
> >>> be more wasteful with money, I'll choose the latter.  Better to waste
> >>> in the process of providing care than to retain revenue and watch the
> >>> country fall (further) apart.  There is enough of an emphasis on
> >>> money
> >>> in this country without the government, too, prioritizing it higher
> >>> than the right for its citizens to live with dignity and comfort.
> >>>
> >>> There are few true libertarians that are well-supported and
> >>> mainstream
> >>> enough to achieve high office- the American public fears change,
> >>> which
> >>> means we're back to the old GOP-Dems crux time and time again.
> >>> Overspending vs. Abandonment.
> >>>
> >>> two cents in the swear jar,

> > to
> > successfully oppose it)
> >
> >
> >> One big reason there are few true libertarians who are 
> mainstream and
> >> supported enough to win national office in the U.S. is that most
> >> Americans vote based on how they think *other people* are 
> voting. For
> >> democracy to work properly, people have to vote for the 
> candidate or
> >> party that most closely reflects their views. Otherwise you get 
> >> leaders
> >> who don't stand for what the people really want, which is where 
> we are
> >> now.
> >>
> >> Too many people vote without integrity. Instead of asking, "Who 
> has 
> >> the
> >> best ideas?" voters ask, "Who can win?" They make mental 
> calculations>> like "I can't stand Candidate A, but according to 
> the news only
> >> Candidate B has a chance of beating him, so I better vote for 
> >> Candidate
> >> B even though he's scary too."
> >>
> >> People may feel clever for voting this way, but in fact it is 
> dumb 
> >> even
> >> if they don't give a shit about democracy. Why? Because one 
> vote won't
> >> change the outcome of any state or national election. Even in local
> >> elections it's HIGHLY unusual. Case in point: When I ran for 
> >> Supervisor
> >> last year, one of my opponents was always bringing up in 
> debates how
> >> she previously lost the seat by "only" 712 votes. And nobody 
> called 
> >> her
> >> on it, because we all knew that even in a district representing 
> less>> than 10% of San Francisco,  712 votes IS considered a close 
> margin.>> And that's just a local election!
> >>
> >> Now think about the odds that your single vote will change the 
> outcome>> of a state or national election! Even in the 2000 
> presidential race 
> >> you
> >> would have had to convince several hundred people living in the 
> right>> counties in Florida to switch their votes (just try 
> getting 10 friends
> >> to vote the way you want!) in order to elect Gore over Bush. 
> And that
> >> was a freak, once-in-a-lifetime election.
> >>
> >> So is voting a waste of time? Not at all! When you vote, you 
> add to
> >> someone's total. Voting for a candidate or party with a lower total
> >> makes your vote go proportionally farther. Kind of like how 
> your local
> >> DJ/producer will notice it more if you buy one of his albums than
> >> Britney Spears will notice if you buy one of hers.
> >>
> >> When it comes to elections, voting for the winner doesn't get 
> you any
> >> brownie points. It's a secret ballot. And even if you know the guy
> >> you're voting for won't win in a million years, that's OK. 
> Because 
> >> it's
> >> not just about winning. It's about sending a message. And it's 
> about>> beating expectations. If a candidate expected to get 1% 
> gets 5%, that
> >> is news. The media and the public will have to take the 
> candidate, and
> >> her party, more seriously.
> >>
> >> Next time you vote, take a good look at the names on your ballot.
> >> Chances are good that the one you've never heard of before 
> belongs to
> >> the person who would make the best officeholder. You didn't 
> hear about
> >> them because they got little media coverage due to running with an
> >> alternative party, they weren't an incumbent, and/or they 
> didn't have 
> >> a
> >> truckload of money to spend getting the message out.
> >>
> >> Forget what the media says about who will win or who the "serious"
> >> contenders are. It's a bunch of self-fulfilling bullshit 
> designed to
> >> marginalize alternative voices. Find out who ALL the candidates 
> are 
> >> and
> >> vote with a clear conscience for the one you think is best.
> >>
> >> Support the little guys. Vote Libertarian, or vote for another
> >> alternative party. Don't waste your vote on a Big Government
> >> Establishment politician!  Would you go to an overpriced 
> massive put 
> >> on
> >> by promoters with a bad rep just because you saw a lot of big 
> fliers>> for the party and got six emails about it? Would you buy 
> an insipid,
> >> flavor-of-the-week mainstream single just because there's a big 
> >> display
> >> at Virgin Records and you saw the video on MTV? No? Then why on 
> earth>> would you turn off your cultural radar when it comes to 
> politics and
> >> vote for a mainstream Democrat or Republican?
> >>
> >> Groove on,
> >> <<< Starchild >>>
> >>
> >> (((((((((((((((( Partnership for a Free America - 
> http://www.lp.org -
> >> (800) ELECT-US ))))))))))))))))
> >>
> >>
> >> On Friday, November 7, 2003, at 09:21  AM, georgeC wrote:
> >>
> >>> The problem is, it seems that even when we elect people that 
> come in
> >>> under the auspices of "no more big government!", they don't 
> mean "no
> >>> more oppression" or "less nonviolent criminals in prison" - 
> they 
> >>> mean,
> >>> "no regulation of businesses", "lowered capital gains taxes", 
> "no 
> >>> more
> >>> checks and balances on capitalism", etc.
> >>>
> >>> All well and good for the corporate interests- but not at all
> >>> liberty-minded.  The right says they are for shrinking 
> government, 
> >>> but
> >>> it seems they simply want to bleed social programs and award 
> >>> contracts
> >>> to their CEO friends, take away civil rights yet relax 
> standards for
> >>> worker's quality of life, etc.  They want to bulldoze through 
> >>> countries
> >>> and simultaneously lower the wages of the brave people manning the
> >>> "bulldozers".
> >>>
> >>> I may sound like a commie, but in this I'm more of a 
> humanitarian.  I
> >>> want to see people taken care of, whether that means boosting 
> >>> education
> >>> so people can take care of themselves or keeping social programs
> >>> accessable to those who we've failed as a country to develop the
> >>> potential of.
> >>>
> >>> So, to me, if I'm going to have to choose between somebody who 
> wants>>> the government out of business's way under the guise of 
> "liberty", 
> >>> and
> >>> somebody who'll keep schools, welfare and medicare funded, but 
> who 
> >>> may
> >>> be more wasteful with money, I'll choose the latter.  Better 
> to waste
> >>> in the process of providing care than to retain revenue and 
> watch the
> >>> country fall (further) apart.  There is enough of an emphasis 
> on 
> >>> money
> >>> in this country without the government, too, prioritizing it 
> higher>>> than the right for its citizens to live with dignity and 
> comfort.>>>
> >>> There are few true libertarians that are well-supported and 
> >>> mainstream
> >>> enough to achieve high office- the American public fears 
> change, 
> >>> which
> >>> means we're back to the old GOP-Dems crux time and time again.
> >>> Overspending vs. Abandonment.
> >>>
> >>> two cents in the swear jar,
> >>> George C.
> >>

Andrew Russell Baumrucker
11/8/03
D-oh!nut.

I a woke one morning to find a doughnut at my dinning table next to a "supe=
r
sized regular" glass of bovine utter secretion.
It looked to good to be true, was the thought which grazed my mind as I sat
down in my chair.

I picked up this perfect doughnut in my hand and raised it to my mouth
slowly, watching the morning sun shine through the window behind me, past m=
e
and slather across my doughnut with a golden light so bright that it forced
the on looking Gods to shield their eyes from the magnificent glory which
was the perfect doughnut which rested upon my nimble pathetic projectile
leprosy greeted hands.

Each sprinkle reflected the suns raises in it's own way.  I saw all of the
colors of the rainbow plus colors that I didn't even know existed until thi=
s
glories morning shone upon my royally humble life.

I stated with squinted eyes upon the doughnut bathed in so many colors and =
I
was in awe of how tranquil this glories master piece was which came forth
from a society that elected people based on popularity and created drones
who traded in their flags of hope to hind behind flags of fear.

I brought the doughnut up to my glossy drool covered lips and I thought to
myself "perhaps, just perhaps if a society can create a such a beautiful
creation than maybe there still is a chance for the future.

I bite into the doughnut...Clank!  I bite into it again and again each time
with the same Clank! Clank! Clank!  I turned the doughnut over in my glorie=
s
hand and read: =A9 2000 Accoutrements. 

--MS_Mac_OE_3151265073_123420_MIME_Part--

Subject: [sfraves] Housemusic - ya heard? {bispy}

Once again, it comes time around the 2nd Monday of the month for our little 
housemusic joint. Thanks to all that came out last month for DJ SHUBERT from 
Household, we had a blast, thanks to everyone that made it out! Special 
congratulations to the Michael Liu family on their new addition to their 
family.

Secret Society -- Monday November 10
A Reunion of People, A Revival of Culture

with residents:
JUSTIN HALE     (9-10:30)
GABRIEL BLACK   (12-close)

and this month's special guest dj:

DJ ADNAN www.djadnan.com     (10:30-12)
Survival Sounds / Care Recordings / Tarantic - San Francisco

Full Powered Mackie Sound By Sierra
Full Visual Control By Viberation

POWER HOUR -- $1 draft beers for from 10pm to 11pm

9pm to close
21+ please
$1 cover

Secret Society -- The South Bay's Greatest Monday Night Bash
The Legendary Club Savoy
3546 Flora Vista Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95051
408.244.6909
Secret Society continues in loving memory of Chris "Laffy" Taflanidis. We 
miss you brother. ESCT

DJ ADNAN BIO >>>
A Palestinian, Brazilian-born, Adnan Sharifs
introduction to music began with the magical
Rhythm of Samba, and soulful rhythms and
grooves have defined his music ever since.
In 1985 Adnan immigrated to the USA and
found a new home in the city of San Francisco.
DJ Adnan is one of the rising stars of the
San Francisco House Music Scene
with releases on major labels.
Hes musical styles include all genre's
of house music with smooth percursion.

Label Affiliations:
PR2 Recordings - Tarantic Records
Leaf Recordings - Sunburn Recordings
Survival Sounds - Care Recordings

He's Dj musical influences come from SF legends such as:
Jeno, Garth, Markie, Tony, Buck, DJ Josh, Hardkiss, Solar, Galen, John 
Howard and Dubtribe

He had shared the turntables with DJs:
Jay TripWire, Terry Francis, Grant Dell, Jeno, Garth, Buck, Mark Farina
Jazzanova, Onionz, Dubtribe, Gavin Hardkiss, Gene Faris, Tony,
Solar, Galen, Preston, Luis Nieva, Miguel Silver, Fabricio Pecanha.

He has played at internationally renowned parties such as:
. ACA World Sound Festival (ACA - 2000) . Club Ka2 (Buenos Aires) .
. World Social Forum (Brazil) . Lizard Lounge (Brazil) .
. Fulltronic Rave (Brazil) . Red Noise (Venezuela) . Flash Power (Brazil) .
. Dubtribe Maui 2000 . Sound Textures @ WMC 2002 .
. Omni Am (Chicago) . ComeUnity . Sunset . Release . Spundae .
. Bulletproof Boat Party . Imperial Dub Dance . Freedom . Melon .
. The Gathering . Conscious Session . Yoga Tai Chi Collective .
. Power To The Peaceful Festival ( San Francisco - 2002/2003 ) .

In late 2000 Adnan began his journey into music production.
His first project, named "Pacificodelic", was co-produced with Gavin 
Hardkiss
and released on Hawk's "Heatstroke" compilation on Six Degrees Records 
<http://www.sixdegreesrecords.com>.

In 2000 Adnan also began working in the studio with Tarantic Records' 
<http://www.tarantic.com> founder Amit Shoham.
Their first collaboration, "Visualize", was released in May 2001 on Tarantic 
Records.
The duo has continued producing tracks together ever since.
Their track "Searching" will be released in late 2002 on Primal Records 
<http://www.primalrecords.com>' new offshoot label,
PR2 Recordings <http://www.primalrecords.com/pr2/index.html>, with remixes 
of Canadian DJ/Producer Jay Tripwire <http://www.jaytripwire.com>.
and their track "Birimbau De San Francisco" will be released in mid 2003 on 
Sunburn Recordings.

Adnan is also part of a production trio along with Jah Love Recordings 
<http://www.jah-love.com> artists Ivan-I and Starchyld.
The trio produced two tracks for Leaf Recordings 
<http://www.leafrecordings.com>, "Roots Rhythm" and "Memories"
that will be released in the fall of 2003.

Subject: [sfraves] [NRR][Gear talk] The Roland SH-32

------=_NextPart_000_0005_01C3A778.A7243D30
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I just bought one haven't gotten to play on it yet. Just wondering if
anyone owns one what advice you have. I have heard enough audio samples
to know this unit will fit perfect into my setup. I have heard mixed
reviews so fill me in. 

 

Here are the Specs-

 


Overview
The SH-32 Synthesizer is a nod to Roland's past with a look toward the
future. This 4-part multitimbral synth uses new Wave Acceleration
Synthesis to deliver up to 32 voices of fat synth waves and entirely new
waveforms. There's also a full complement of knobs and sliders-plus
analog-style drums, DSP effects and a killer arpeggiator-giving
musicians desktop access to a range of stunning synth sounds at an
unbelievable low price. 

 


Features 

*	Powerful desktop synthesizer with massive real-time control 
*	New Wave Acceleration Synthesis creates a variety of synth
waves-67 total 
*	Includes standard synth waves plus new waveforms like Spectrum
and Noise 
*	Up to 32-note/4-part multitimbral operation 
*	2 main oscillators and 2 suboscillators with ultra-thick
Subsonic mode 
*	Pulse width modulation and oscillator "hard" sync capability 
*	insert and loop effects processors with 10 types of reverb/delay
and 35 multi-effects 
*	Programmable arpeggiator for creating synth lines or drum
patterns 
*	Patches using oscillator sync will be monophonic 


Details

Introducing Wave Acceleration Synthesis
The SH-32 uses new Wave Acceleration Synthesis to overcome the limited
polyphony and sounds of modeling-based synths. You get up to 32 voices,
plus 67 waveform variations from traditional analog waves to entirely
new waveforms like Spectrum and variable Noise. And when combined with
the new Subsonic mode found in the suboscillator section, you can create
everything from thick bass sounds to entirely new sounds not possible on
traditional synthesizers. There's even drum maps with samples taken from
the TR-808/909 Rhythm Composers. 

Easy Knob and Slider Control
If you prefer creating sounds to using factory presets, you'll love the
SH-32. Like Roland's instruments of the past, this tabletop synth is
covered with all the knobs, sliders and buttons you need for direct
parameter access. And because there are no hidden menus, the SH-32's
display consists of a simple, 3-digit LED. 

Programmable Arpeggiator
The SH-32's arpeggiator offers a variety of Preset templates, but can
also be fully programmed. When used in combination with the Chord Memory
function, you can produce complex arpeggios just like the ones heard in
modern techno styles including trance. And with so many front-panel
controls, programming is still ultra-intuitive. 

Effects Processing
Once you've created a sound, you can process it though the SH-32's two
independent effects processors. The Loop processor gives you 10
varieties of reverb/delay effects, while the Insert processor offers 35
multi-effects algorithms. These include everything from distortion,
compressor and pitch shifter to proprietary Groove effects like Slicer,
Lo-Fi and Isolator. 

An All-Purpose Performer
With its affordable price and compact size, the SH-32 is a great way to
add fat synth sounds to your music. Use it with your favorite sequencing
software or keyboard workstation, giving you bold new sounds. And when
paired up with a GrooveboxR, you've got a powerful desktop synth with
cool, retro-style sequencing. So whether for live use or in the studio,
the SH-32 will deliver the goods. 

 

 

Jason Philips

Compos-Mentis

Problematic Beats

 


------=_NextPart_000_0005_01C3A778.A7243D30--

the spiral staircase in the front?  People ... whatever place that is, it's a 
deathtrap. Can you imagine there being a fire, and everybody is stuck on the

concerns as "the little wooden stairways don't have proper railings" (true story 
from Home Base) or "having to use porta potties presents a public health issue" 
(true story from 2nd & Jackson). So, driving parties underground into basement 
firetraps is some sort of safety improvement???  It's just too ironic to me. 
If I find out I've bought a ticket for a party at that basement place with 
the spiral staircase, i want my money back.

> jobs.
> ez
> dave

Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII

Subject: Re: [sfraves] tenderloft busted by the pigs


If our government didn't make dancing -- or, for that matter, rave culture
as a whole -- illegal, we wouldn't be forced underground. If you want a
nice pretty perfect venue go to a massive. Undergrounds are always going
to be plagued by these kinds of problems because -- by being undergrounds
-- they seperate themselves from the big business profits of massives, and
must resort to less convenient, less 'perfect' venues.

And I think you're thinking of a different venue. :) The IK space is
pretty safe -- and pretty fucking cool, for that matter.

On a related note, I really think the foofoo party in IK really shouldn't
have happened. The kids I know that went to it, used to high-polish trance
parties, didn't appreciate the oldskoo feel of the space; had quite a few
points to bitch about, all of which seemed pretty inconsequential to me.
I've been to a lot of *dope* parties at that venue -- quite a few D&B, one
very notable one Psytrance -- and it's always been one of my favorites.
The layout, for whatever reason, gives me a proper warehouse vibe. It
almost makes me want to use the 'R' word. :b

There was a lot of hatin' goin around after that party got shut down, too,
IIRC. The people upstairs blamed the people downstairs, the people
downstairs blamed the people upstairs.. The 'inside scoop' among the
trance kids was some vague conspiracy theory that someone in the TL was
buying liqour for minors. I dunno.

Like I said... I don't think that party should have happened. The reason
the space is successful in the area it's in is b/c of the usually low key
crowd. Hopefully peeps will remember this incident next time someone tries
to throw a high-profile party downstairs. :b

S

On Mon, 10 Nov 2003 JonnyR@aol.com wrote:

> just wondering ... is the downstairs space -- Infinite Kaos -- the one with
> the spiral staircase in the front?  People ... whatever place that is, it's a
> deathtrap. Can you imagine there being a fire, and everybody is stuck on the

> firetraps is some sort of safety improvement???  It's just too ironic to me.

> the spiral staircase, i want my money back.

> DJ ADNAN BIO >>>
> A Palestinian, Brazilian-born, Adnan Sharif=92s
> introduction to music began with the magical
> Rhythm of Samba, and soulful rhythms and
> grooves have defined his music ever since.
> In 1985 Adnan immigrated to the USA and
> found a new home in the city of San Francisco.
> DJ Adnan is one of the rising stars of the
> San Francisco House Music Scene
> with releases on major labels.
> He=92s musical styles include all genre's
> of house music with smooth percursion.
>
> Label Affiliations:
> PR2 Recordings - Tarantic Records
> Leaf Recordings - Sunburn Recordings
> Survival Sounds - Care Recordings
>
> He's Dj musical influences come from SF legends such as:
> Jeno, Garth, Markie, Tony, Buck, DJ Josh, Hardkiss, Solar, Galen, John
> Howard and Dubtribe
>
> He had shared the turntables with DJs:
> Jay TripWire, Terry Francis, Grant Dell, Jeno, Garth, Buck, Mark Farina
> Jazzanova, Onionz, Dubtribe, Gavin Hardkiss, Gene Faris, Tony,
> Solar, Galen, Preston, Luis Nieva, Miguel Silver, Fabricio Pecanha.
>
> He has played at internationally renowned parties such as:
> . ACA World Sound Festival (ACA - 2000) . Club Ka2 (Buenos Aires) .
> . World Social Forum (Brazil) . Lizard Lounge (Brazil) .
> . Fulltronic Rave (Brazil) . Red Noise (Venezuela) . Flash Power (Brazil)=
 .
> . Dubtribe Maui 2000 . Sound Textures @ WMC 2002 .
> . Omni Am (Chicago) . ComeUnity . Sunset . Release . Spundae .
> . Bulletproof Boat Party . Imperial Dub Dance . Freedom . Melon .
> . The Gathering . Conscious Session . Yoga Tai Chi Collective .
> . Power To The Peaceful Festival ( San Francisco - 2002/2003 ) .
>
> In late 2000 Adnan began his journey into music production.
> His first project, named "Pacificodelic", was co-produced with Gavin
> Hardkiss
> and released on Hawk's "Heatstroke" compilation on Six Degrees Records
> <http://www.sixdegreesrecords.com>.
>
> In 2000 Adnan also began working in the studio with Tarantic Records'
> <http://www.tarantic.com> founder Amit Shoham.
> Their first collaboration, "Visualize", was released in May 2001 on Taran=
tic
> Records.
> The duo has continued producing tracks together ever since.
> Their track "Searching" will be released in late 2002 on Primal Records
> <http://www.primalrecords.com>' new offshoot label,
> PR2 Recordings <http://www.primalrecords.com/pr2/index.html>, with remixe=
s
> of Canadian DJ/Producer Jay Tripwire <http://www.jaytripwire.com>.
> and their track "Birimbau De San Francisco" will be released in mid 2003 =
on
> Sunburn Recordings.
>
> Adnan is also part of a production trio along with Jah Love Recordings
> <http://www.jah-love.com> artists Ivan-I and Starchyld.
> The trio produced two tracks for Leaf Recordings
> <http://www.leafrecordings.com>, "Roots Rhythm" and "Memories"
> that will be released in the fall of 2003.
