        abhishek_sheetal@yahoo.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 108
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Vegetarian Perspective

"Humans are funny birds.  We get so wrapped up in habits, comfort zones, and 
traditions that sometimes it takes a lot of strength and courage to step back 
and question who we are and what we do.

Thanksgiving is one such instance, sadly exemplified by the alternative name 
for the day: "Turkey Day."  Thanksgiving is meant to be a day when we 
celebrate the bounty of the harvest, pause in gratitude for the abundance most of us 
experience, and share what we have with others.  Most people don't stop to 
think about the near 300 million birds that are killed each year in the U.S., just 
to satisfy our appetites.  Of this number, 45 million are killed for 
Thanksgiving alone.

As someone who no animal flesh or secretions and teaches vegetarian cooking 
classes and vegetarian nutrition workshops, I have seen many people switch to 
plant-based eating and enjoy an abundance of delicious, nutritious food.  I 
also know that it takes a real shift in perception to shed the comfort zones of 
the past and create new ones.  Some people have a real fear that they will no 
longer have satisfying, filling meals -- especially on Thanksgiving.  I can say 
with confidence that they can put their fears to rest.

Our Thanksgiving feast every year is full of comfort foods galore: mashed 
potatoes with gravy, stuffing, mashed rutabagas, cranberry relish with pecans, 
stuffed squash, corn bread, Brussels sprouts, corn, peas, pumpkin pie with 
non-dairy whipped cream, and apple pie.  This was our meny last year, and I'm sure 
I've left something out.  Indeed, there is no dearth of food on our table.  
And for those who need that dose of familiarity, "tofu turkey" is always another 
option.

For those who have never met them, turkeys are magnificent animals, full of 
spunk and spark and affection.  I was amazed the first time I visited rescued 
turkeys at Farm Sanctuary, birds who had been abused, who had been de-toed and 
debeaked but who still displayed immense affection for humans.  One turkey 
climbed into my lap and cooed as she fell asleep in my arms, while I stroked her 
soft chest and beautiful feathers.

Sart a new tradition this year:  Try a turkey-free Thanksgiving.  It will be 
a Happy Turkey day indeed."

This was written by Colleen Patrick Goudreau of Oakland and was Published in 
Vegetarian News by the San Francisco Vegetarian Society, celebrating their 
35th anniversary all year long.
You can recieve their newsletter via e-mail.  Please send your full name, as 
well as your permanent e-mail address (is there really such a thing) to 
membership@sfvs.org

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Most laws dictate that if someone is on the sidewalk in front of your
house that is still property that is tied to you even though you cannot
block it off. If someone is in your front yard fighting no matter if you
are trying to get rid of them or not the police can be called. And if
there is enough evidence a party is going on that contains minors our
past curfew, dinking, or any of those sorts of things, then an officer
can consider the party a disturbance to the peace and contributing to
the delinquency of a minors which means shut down. It can happen in my
living room or yours no matter what the size. It is just a fact of life.
Police are scared of dance events and the culture that surrounds them.
They see groups of youth following elders who have a power to educate
and overthrow a corrupt government. The sad part is the dance community
for the most part has no political statement. Just some opinions. Peace

-------------------------------1068502285
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

ok, talking about underground venues, by nature, has to be on the downlow and 
free of street-address description, so now i know that the 
Tenderloft/Infinite Kaos spot is NOT the one with the spiral staircase as the only way to get to 
the basement party area. I'm talking about the one that was used for 
Cybersexx, the post-Cyberfest after party. That place, I shoulda known when they said 
at Cyberfest, "After party, five bucks!" and then it was $7 at the door, and 
then seeing the narrow spiral staircase ... no way! 

anyhow i'm just trying to reinforce these point: 
* making formerly-legal party venues illegal/unable to get permits (e.g. 2nd 
& Jackson, HomeBase, Maritime Hall among others), in some misguided effort to 
increase the safety of partiers, is absurd because underground (esp. LITERALLY 
underground venues like this one, lol) parties may be held in locations that 
are much more unsafe. (Another example I gave last week, of breaking into 
condemned buildings and dancing amid clouds of asbestos(?))
*nobody should book a party at the place with the spiral staircase as the 
ONLY way to get in and out! Damn. Last I heard, drinking lots of water does not 
offer protection against incineration. Make sure you know how to get out if 
something happens. 

I know another underground spot in SF that DOES seem a lot safer, because 
there's a garage door that could be opened as another way out. 

Thank you.  End of safety lecture!  (Hey, can't help it, I've done a lot of 
emergency planning at work.)   I don't want to see a headline, "200 die in 
underground party disaster."
JonnyR

-------------------------------1068502285--

11/8/03
D-oh!nut.

I awoke one morning to find a doughnut at my dinning table next to a "super
sized regular" glass of bovine utter secretion.
It looked too good to be true, was the thought which grazed my mind as I sa=
t
down in my chair.

I picked up this perfect doughnut in my hand and raised it to my mouth
slowly, watching the morning sun shine through the window behind me, past m=
e
and slather across my doughnut with a golden light so bright that it forced
the on looking Gods to shield their eyes from the magnificent glory which
was the perfect doughnut which rested upon my nimble pathetic projectile
leprosy greeted hands.

Each sprinkle reflected the suns rays in it's own way.  I saw all of the
colors of the rainbow plus colors that I didn't even know existed until thi=
s
glorious morning shone upon my royally humble life.

I stared with squinted eyes upon the doughnut bathed in so many colors and =
I
was in awe of how tranquil this glorious master piece was which came forth
from a society that elected people based on popularity and created drones
who traded in their flags of hope to hind behind flags of fear.

I brought the doughnut up to my glossy drool covered lips and I thought to
myself "perhaps, just perhaps, if a society can create such a beautiful
creation, than maybe there still is a chance for the future.

I bit into the doughnut...Clank!  I bit into it again and again each time
with the same Clank! Clank! Clank!  I turned the doughnut over in my
glorious hand and read: =A9 2000 Accoutrements.

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [NRR][Gear talk] The Roland SH-32


Groovebox crud.  Spend your money elsewhere, preferably Reaktor (which can
do all this and WAY more), or some real analog gear (which despite major
advances in modeling technology still sounds different).

andyw

On Mon, 10 Nov 2003, Jason wrote:
-&e->I just bought one haven't gotten to play on it yet. Just wondering if
-&e->anyone owns one what advice you have. I have heard enough audio samples
-&e->to know this unit will fit perfect into my setup. I have heard mixed
-&e->reviews so fill me in.
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->Here are the Specs-
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->Overview
-&e->The SH-32 Synthesizer is a nod to Roland's past with a look toward the
-&e->future. This 4-part multitimbral synth uses new Wave Acceleration
-&e->Synthesis to deliver up to 32 voices of fat synth waves and entirely new
-&e->waveforms. There's also a full complement of knobs and sliders-plus
-&e->analog-style drums, DSP effects and a killer arpeggiator-giving
-&e->musicians desktop access to a range of stunning synth sounds at an
-&e->unbelievable low price.
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->Features
-&e->
-&e->*	Powerful desktop synthesizer with massive real-time control
-&e->*	New Wave Acceleration Synthesis creates a variety of synth
-&e->waves-67 total
-&e->*	Includes standard synth waves plus new waveforms like Spectrum
-&e->and Noise
-&e->*	Up to 32-note/4-part multitimbral operation
-&e->*	2 main oscillators and 2 suboscillators with ultra-thick
-&e->Subsonic mode
-&e->*	Pulse width modulation and oscillator "hard" sync capability
-&e->*	insert and loop effects processors with 10 types of reverb/delay
-&e->and 35 multi-effects
-&e->*	Programmable arpeggiator for creating synth lines or drum
-&e->patterns
-&e->*	Patches using oscillator sync will be monophonic
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->Details
-&e->
-&e->Introducing Wave Acceleration Synthesis
-&e->The SH-32 uses new Wave Acceleration Synthesis to overcome the limited
-&e->polyphony and sounds of modeling-based synths. You get up to 32 voices,
-&e->plus 67 waveform variations from traditional analog waves to entirely
-&e->new waveforms like Spectrum and variable Noise. And when combined with
-&e->the new Subsonic mode found in the suboscillator section, you can create
-&e->everything from thick bass sounds to entirely new sounds not possible on
-&e->traditional synthesizers. There's even drum maps with samples taken from
-&e->the TR-808/909 Rhythm Composers.
-&e->
-&e->Easy Knob and Slider Control
-&e->If you prefer creating sounds to using factory presets, you'll love the
-&e->SH-32. Like Roland's instruments of the past, this tabletop synth is
-&e->covered with all the knobs, sliders and buttons you need for direct
-&e->parameter access. And because there are no hidden menus, the SH-32's
-&e->display consists of a simple, 3-digit LED.
-&e->
-&e->Programmable Arpeggiator
-&e->The SH-32's arpeggiator offers a variety of Preset templates, but can
-&e->also be fully programmed. When used in combination with the Chord Memory
-&e->function, you can produce complex arpeggios just like the ones heard in
-&e->modern techno styles including trance. And with so many front-panel
-&e->controls, programming is still ultra-intuitive.
-&e->
-&e->Effects Processing
-&e->Once you've created a sound, you can process it though the SH-32's two
-&e->independent effects processors. The Loop processor gives you 10
-&e->varieties of reverb/delay effects, while the Insert processor offers 35
-&e->multi-effects algorithms. These include everything from distortion,
-&e->compressor and pitch shifter to proprietary Groove effects like Slicer,
-&e->Lo-Fi and Isolator.
-&e->
-&e->An All-Purpose Performer
-&e->With its affordable price and compact size, the SH-32 is a great way to
-&e->add fat synth sounds to your music. Use it with your favorite sequencing
-&e->software or keyboard workstation, giving you bold new sounds. And when
-&e->paired up with a GrooveboxR, you've got a powerful desktop synth with
-&e->cool, retro-style sequencing. So whether for live use or in the studio,
-&e->the SH-32 will deliver the goods.
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->Jason Philips
-&e->
-&e->Compos-Mentis
-&e->
-&e->Problematic Beats
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->
-&e->

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [NRR][Gear talk] The Roland SH-32

I am not looking for software and of course older analog gear can do the
same but I am not looking for analog I appreciate the feedback though.
This is not so much a Groovebox as an entry level synth. The reviews on
http://www.harmony-central.com have all led me to believe this is worth
the $200 I spent on it. I am not looking for a chunk of the past but
something different. Thank you for your advice it is noted and please I
hope you do not feel I am super defensive. I have taken time to research
what I have bought and am comfortable with it. I have been around
electronic music for 12 years and I felt the sounds I heard on the audio
samples would be right for glitchy random noise type tracks.

Jason Philips
Compos-Mentis
Problematic Beats

I wouldn't mind tracking down a space echo some day. I have already
picked up the Quasimidi 309 as well so now this will be my second piece
to work with. I did not buy it for drum patterns at all as I love the
309's. I am looking to use it to add stabs of weird little crazy sounds.
With the metallic sounding notes it puts out I thought it would be good.
I have heard the pads are decent but the oscillator is so so. I am soon
going to pick up a decent Akai rackmount synth to add to the collection
it is amazing how quick my studio has materialized out of just a PC. LOL
Thanks man no hard feelings at all I know a lot of people do not love
Roland. Peace

Jason Philips
Compos-Mentis
Problematic Beats

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GOS - WAS --> rave docu circa 93?

Best part of the night:

When I walked through the door, my pants started vibrating, and the bass
didn't let up anywhere in the venue.  Majesty Recordings booked a ridiculous
sound system for the party.

Huge spot, the South Chicago Expo, next to Photon (does anyone remember
Photon?  Coolest laser tag ever growing up).  After Photon shut down
nationwide, they started having parties at the two connected to each other.
I had no understanding of the talent I was experiencing at the time, but it
was definitely a jacking party!

-Andrew

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

     In defense to the story, I think the point of the sun being visible 
ABOVE THE POLLUTED COMPUTER CITY when neo & trinity shortly fly up & over, is 
that: #1 according to the first movie and the animatrix, the humans were the ones 
who shut off the machines source to the sun because the machines were becoming 
out of control.   #2 The machines then fought and won a war against the 
humans and probaly used all the dead carcuses for the power they did not get from 
the sun. #3 The machines then continued to recyle human embryos to maintain 
power and created a "matrix" to keep their brain busy. all except for those who 
escaped into Zion. #4 In the meantime whatever device the humans used to shut 
off access to the sun was never figured out by the computers... (who do not 
think in rational intuitive thought patterns mind you #5 In the end when neo 
reaches a peace agreement/proposition with the computer mainframe (who has now 
devolped it's own personality) the war ends, which would then allow the humans to 
fix their device on the sun in which in return the machines will refrain from 
killing them. Since Neo saves the computer world from the out of control 
virus Smith by sacrificing himself... he teaches the computers the meaning of life 
in which they return the favor by ending the war on humans. There is a scene 
where the sentinals suddenly stop attacking and wave & tilt their head at the 
humans, Morpheus then runs up to pet one of them. #6 As the movie blatently 
ponits out from time to time, the entire occourance was meant to be the way it 
was, an no other way, which means if at any time, something seemed highly 
improbably... it was meerly a coincidence. 
     In conclution I see the Matrix as an action movie platform to make 
spiritual and philisophical parallels with. So to say it has plot holes is like 
saying Mario Brothers has plot holes... like why does mario have a predermined 
amount of lives? and what exactly   is a "continue"? where does mario go when he 
falls down a hole? & why do you have to play the game over again every time 
you beat it? Matrix trilogy is a pioneer in it's genre it's not the first, just 
one of the definitive of it's kind, like Mario Brothers was to video games. 
It's very riske in some ways, boldly taking on contraversial ideas and bending 
them around vicously, and in other way the movie is too timid, in that it 
fails to communicate it's solidified meaning to most viewers who watch it. To say 
it has plot holes is like to tell Tony Hawk his landing was sloppy after he 
did a 920 degree spin in mid air off a halfpipe.  

--part1_15d.274bddda.2ce23cff_boundary--

Subject: [sfraves] Message from Godskitchen (bsp)

A message from Godskitchen U.K......

"Godskitchen is a place where expression and fantasy walk hand in hand...
Imagine the exhilaration when the music captivates your body and mind,
and your inhibitions are replaced with euphoria. Conjure up the sight of
colourful circus characters and sensational costumed performers parading
through thousands of ecstatic clubbers. Imagine striking lasers cutting
through a crowd of carnival antics and visual spectacles so stunning they
catch your breath...Imagine all this combined with the most uplifting tranc=
e
teasing you beat by beat through a rhythmic, celestial journey and you are
getting somewhere near to the power of a Godskitchen party.

The Godskitchen experience is coming the United States of America for the
inimitable "Sauza Tequila Godskitchen Get Lost Tour", and it=B9s going to be
bigger and better then anything the world has ever seen. THE UK's generatio=
n
defining club is heading for a repeat performance Stateside, and you can be
part of it. Having conquered their homeland, Ibiza and beyond the mighty
party kings are taking the spectacle across the U.S. on a non stop party
tour spreading the gospel of dance music to the masses. With a string of A
List DJs, mind blowing lightshows, eccentric performers, acrobats and
stunning visuals, this is clubbing for a new generation. It=B9s what America
has been waiting for."

If you're 18+, you can experience Godskitchen, in San Francisco, at the
Historic Avalon Ballroom, on Friday, November 21st. The Ballroom is located
at 1268 Sutter Street at Van Ness. Heralded as one of the most prestigious
venues in San Francisco, the Avalon Ballroom is an amazing place!

The line-up for the night.....

ooooOO  F E R G I E  OOoooo
Rated No. 23 in this years DJ MAG Top 100 artist poll, he's one of the best
young DJs in the world!

G I A N N I  v s.  T A J

I C O N  v s.  M Y S T R E

D E N I S E  v s.  D R A G N ' F L Y

G E R O N I M O  v s.  C H R I S T O P H E R  L O B S I N G E R

The first 300 tickets are only $15. $20 thereafter. Doors open at 7pm and
close at 2am. For event info, call 415.820.3904 or visit
http://www.mostwantedna.com/gk

Presale tickets are on sale at Bay Area locations, including:

F-8, SF (415) 221-4142
Straight Hits, Fremont (510) 739-1862
Twilight Zone, Hayward (510) 538-7945
Skills, Berkeley (510) 704-9876
Generation Rock, Concord (925) 682-9042
Solid Grooves, San Jose (408) 248-6399
Ultrasoundz, San Bruno (650) 871-4170
The Last Record Store, Santa Rosa (707) 525-1963

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GOS - WAS --> rave docu circa 93?

We had Q-Zar here. There were many parties at defunct q-zar spaces. I used
to play that thing when I was a sophmore back in 91. They had coupons to get
2 for 1 games and no limit on the coupons. That was a blast even if the
place was kinda lame. $7 for 30 minutes of running around shooting each
other to early trance. Good times...

:: r y a n ::

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Andrew Phelan" <vgsandrew@hotmail.com>

Sent: Monday, November 10, 2003 10:39 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] GOS - WAS --> rave docu circa 93?


Best part of the night:

When I walked through the door, my pants started vibrating, and the bass
didn't let up anywhere in the venue.  Majesty Recordings booked a ridiculous
sound system for the party.

Huge spot, the South Chicago Expo, next to Photon (does anyone remember
Photon?  Coolest laser tag ever growing up).  After Photon shut down
nationwide, they started having parties at the two connected to each other.
I had no understanding of the talent I was experiencing at the time, but it
was definitely a jacking party!

-Andrew

>aloha all,

>hope all are well.  in case you hadn't heard who is headlining (((thump))) 
>on saturday at the dna, it is the one and only DIMITRI.  as most of you 
>know we generally book live acts for thump, as there are very few 
>international trance artists that can truly stand on their own as just DJs. 
>  while dimitri is an accomplished producer with the good, the bad and the 
>ugly (which is dimitri, dado/deedrah, and serge of total eclipse/antidote - 
>which is a *ridiculous* line-up that we're working on for a future party), 
>he is ostensibly the best trance DJ in the world, IMHO.
>
>part of what makes him one of the, if not the, best trance djs in the world 
>is his experience with the international scene since its inception.  he 
>gets it and he knows how to convey it.  that plus his personal 
>relationships with the best producers in the world for 15 years that give 
>him all new tracks to light it up with.  that plus his innate sense of 
>programming - building the perfect journey.  that plus he's been beat 
>matching in the trance scene for many years when others were still crashing 
>DATs together at 155bpm.  ;)
>
>at any rate, DIMITRI has never disappointed me with one of his sets.  he is 
>a gentle person and is truly one of the gems of the scene - but don't let 
>that fool ya, he's a ripping hard DJ with wicked, wicked-good, 
>wicked-whacked music that won't be coming out for months or years.
>
>also we've got the head of maia records, arturo, up from mexico city (our 
>first mexican DJ/act ever - very excited to support our brothers of the 
>north american scene!), plus dutch and the thick progressive beats of kepi 
>and the beautiful voice of kat to start the evening.  
>drum'n'bass-breakz'nfunk upstairs with felix, cosmic selector (live), and 
>android.
>
>i missed wizzy so i'm looking forward to a damn good time this saturday.  
>won't you come out and play?
>

Witch hunt indeed-
Let me state 2 facts for you:
1) nature herself has determined that people sexually
mature at about the age of 13- why do you think that
might be?
2) the 18yo age-of-consent thing was IIRC brought in
to place by rich white land-owners upset about their
daughters' ways with "people of color"

I can understand you seeing a 35yo being with a 14yo
as "sick", just like I would see an 18yo being with a
60yo as "sick"- but IMO that's just a personal
preference thing.
The age disparity is more "strange" to me (versus the
absolute ages)
The *only* worthy angle here is that the average
13-14yo could likely be easily taken advantage of by
an older person, so I agree that it's probably best
for society to generally prohibit such things-
But the "14yo" in that first Yahoo IM transcript
clearly was not being taken advantage of in any sense.
She was driving the entire conversation towards the
meeting up for sex, coming back after his "you're too
young" objections multiple times.
Someone like that is *not* being taken advantage of or
manipulated by an older, more-emotionally-mature
person.
(Which, as I've already argued, is the only valid
cause for the age-of-consent stuff to begin with)

preference thing.

absolute ages)

From sfraves-return-108129-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Nov 11 23:56:48 2003

Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 298 invoked by uid 1103); 11 Nov 2003 23:56:47 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 275 invoked from network); 11 Nov 2003 23:56:47 -0000
Date: Tue, 11 Nov 2003 15:56:16 -0800
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org,
 sacraves@hyperreal.org
To: atawmicsfr@technolounge.org
From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <1068562613.3fb0f8b51ad3e@mail.technolounge.org>
Message-Id: <A384A396-14A2-11D8-BEA4-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: NRR - Police Auctions for Cars

	I'd encourage everyone not to participate in police auctions, just for 
moral reasons. Buying cars from the police rewards them for stealing 
peoples' property. The police regularly steal vehicles from people who 
did nothing wrong. In Oakland, they'll take the cars of people merely 
suspected of soliciting prostitution, or who are the victim of a sting 
operation. They can also seize your car for mere possession of a small 
amount of drugs. It's not unknown for them to plant stuff on someone in 
order to arrest or rob the person. Police and even judges often get a 
cut of the proceeds from what is siezed, so the system acts as a direct 
incentive to corruption and to ruling against people getting their 
property back. If you don't believe it, do a web search on "civil asset 
forfeiture." Buying a car at one of these auctions is like buying 
jewelry from that shifty guy whispering to you on the street.

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>

Date: Tue, 11 Nov 2003 16:07:02 -0800
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed

 sacraves@hyperreal.org
To: "Jason Philips" <djjasonphilips@hotmail.com>
From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <Law9-F124sNQptgFrYI0003757a@hotmail.com>
Message-Id: <244BBFE2-14A4-11D8-BEA4-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: [NRR] Go pick another wagon to jump on

	I know as a father you feel all kinds of protective urges now. All 
that biological territoriality and nurturing instinct kicks in. But you 
should realize that a lot of people get railroaded by the system, and 
then are stuck with the stigma of being "sex offenders." That person 
you call up to lash out at with your hatred could be one of them.

	A good friend of mine was. After over 100 consensual encounters with a 
poorly-chosen partner who was "underage" and had serious issues about 
his sexual identity, this individual suddenly decided to tell his 
parents that he'd been coerced and manipulated by my friend all along. 
Who do you think they believed? Not that it probably would have 
mattered much -- according to the law, just by being who he is, a 
person who happens to be attracted to younger guys, my friend is seen 
as a monster to be punished and reviled by society. This would be true 
if he'd never done anything more than looked at photos -- and of course 
having "child pornography" was one of the things they charged him with 
-- my friend is some kind of monster for being attracted to people 
younger than himself. He is a very sensitive person who would never 
hurt or coerce anybody, and now he is serving ten years with all kinds 
of low-life homophobes and gang-banging thug types. And that's just the 
people on the other side of the bars.

	I don't know exactly what concept is in your head when you say 
"pedophile," but the idea that until a person has their 18th birthday 
they are a child and anybody older who might engage in sexual relations 
with them is some kind of monster, and then on that day they undergo 
some magical transformation and become an adult and everything's cool, 
is one of the most illogical, fucked-up pieces of 
government-money-stolen-from-the-people-reinforced bullshit ever.

	Looking back now, I wish *I* had been consensually "molested" when I 
was a teenager. Having an older person there for me would have made 
those years a little more bearable. So don't you tell me that a teen 
can never make that decision. I know better.

Fight the power!
						<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: [sfraves] RE: [NRR] Go pick another wagon to jump on

You know I must say thank you for asking the question that no one has
yet. My belief in what a sexual predator is. My belief is that a
predator is just that someone who preys upon our youth. I do not agree
with some 30 year old man trying to convince a 14 year old to meet them
some where for an encounter. That to me just says something is wrong. I
have known plenty of men and women between the ages of 16 and 18 that
have dated people in their 20's. If you are old enough to be someone's
father or mother you should not be thinking of a person sexually but
helping educate them on life lessons. A child will one day pass laws and
regulations which will dictate my life and I would prefer they have a
stable mind in doing so. That is just my opinion. I know it probably
contradicts all the shit earlier today but who said I wasn't just
fucking with the people who did not know how to discuss a topic in a
normal manner. Peace and thank you for writing a well thought out
response

Jason Philips

This was kinda interesting - and fun !



> >
> >PERSONALITY TEST
> >
> >The Dalai Lama said read it to see if it works
>for you.
> >
> >Very interesting. Just 4 questions and the
>answers will surprise you. Do not
> >cheat by looking up the answers. The mind is
>like a parachute, it works best
> >when it is opened. This is fun to do, but you
>have to follow the
> >instructions very closely. Do not cheat.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >MAKE A WISH BEFORE BEGINNING THE TEST!!
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >A Warning! Answer the questions as you go along.
>
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >There are only four questions and if you see
>them all before finishing, you
> >will not have honest results. Go down slowly and
>do each exercise as you
> >scroll down. Don't look ahead. Get pencil and
>paper to write your answers as
> >you go along. You will need it at the end. This
>is an honest questionnaire
> >which will tell you a lot about your true self.
>Give an answer for each
> >item.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Put the following 5 animals in the order of your
>preference. Cow Tiger Sheep
> >Horse Pig
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Write one word that describes each one of the
>following:
> >
> >Dog
> >
> >Cat
> >
> >Rat
> >
> >Coffee
> >
> >Sea
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Think of someone (who also knows you and is
>important to you) and that you
> >can relate to the following colors (do not
>repeat your answer twice. Name
> >just one person for each color.) Yellow Orange
>Red White Green
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Finally, write down your favorite number and
>your favorite day of the week.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >

> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Finished? Please be sure that your answers are
>what you REALLY WANT.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Look at the interpretations below: (but first
>before continuing, repeat your
> >wish.)
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >This will define your priorities in your life.
> >
> >Cow Signifies CAREER
> >
> >Tiger Signifies PRIDE
> >
> >Sheep Signifies LOVE
> >
> >Horse! Signifies FAMILY
> >
> >Pig Signifies MONEY
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Your description of dog implies your own
>personality. Your description of
> >cat implies the personality of your partner..
>Your description of rat
> >implies the personality of your enemies. Your
>description of coffee is how
> >you interpret sex. Your description of the sea
>implies your own life.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Yellow: Someone you will never forget
> >
> >Orange: Someone you consider your true friend
> >
> >Red: Someone that you really love
> >
> >White: Your twin soul
> >
> >Green: Someone that you will remember for the
>rest of your life
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >You have to send this message to as many persons
>as your favorite number and
> >your wish will come true on the day that you
>put.. This is what the Dalai
> >Lama has said about the Millennium-just take a
>few seconds to read it and
> >think. Do not put away this message, the mantra
>will come out from your
> >hands in the next 96 hours. You will have a very
>pleasant surprise. This is
> >true, even if you are not superstitious.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Please do this. It is fascinating.
> >
> >SEND THIS E-MAIL MANTRA TO AT LEAST FIVE PERSONS
>AND YOUR LIFE WILL IMPROVE
> >
> >0-4 persons: Your life will improve slightly
> >
> >
> >5-9 persons: Your life will improve to your
>liking
> >
> >9-14 persons: You will have at least 5 surprises
>in the next three weeks
> >
> >15 or more persons: Your life will improve
>drastically and all that you have
> >always dreamed will take shape.

that name's taken, i can't find anything listed in sf
with that moniker.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: NRR - Police Auctions for Cars

Boycotting police auctions isn't helping the problem, you're only 
eliminating another of your possible choices.  Not all police seizures are 
unjust, surprise, there really are people out there doing bad things, and 
they get caught.  FURTHERMORE, the question was about buying a used POLICE 
CAR, which would not have been seized to begin with.

You don't need to pay anyone for info about auctions.  use google.  it's free.


sarilion

At 03:56 PM 11/11/2003, Starchild wrote:
>Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
>
>         I'd encourage everyone not to participate in police auctions, 
> just for moral reasons. Buying cars from the police rewards them for 
> stealing peoples' property. The police regularly steal vehicles from 
> people who did nothing wrong. In Oakland, they'll take the cars of people 
> merely suspected of soliciting prostitution, or who are the victim of a 
> sting operation. They can also seize your car for mere possession of a 
> small amount of drugs. It's not unknown for them to plant stuff on 
> someone in order to arrest or rob the person. Police and even judges 
> often get a cut of the proceeds from what is siezed, so the system acts 
> as a direct incentive to corruption and to ruling against people getting 
> their property back. If you don't believe it, do a web search on "civil 
> asset forfeiture." Buying a car at one of these auctions is like buying 
> jewelry from that shifty guy whispering to you on the street.
>
>Groove on,
>                                                         <<< Starchild >>>
>
>

X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: NRR - Police Auctions for Cars

	I don't believe the questioner stated that the purpose was to buy a 
POLICE CAR. I'm not even sure if such vehicles are sold to the public. 
But to address your point, yes, I'm sure there are some cars being sold 
at police auctions on the up-and-up. Abandoned vehicles, old undercover 
cars, that kind of thing.

	Problem is, the cops aren't going to tell you which cars they 
legitimately own and which ones they just stole from people. So if you 
buy a vehicle at a police auction, there's a good chance you're helping 
them make a nice profit on stolen goods and giving them more incentive 
to keep stealing.

	Think how you'd feel if it was someone else buying your car that was 
jacked from you on the cheap.

							<<< Starchild >>>


On Tuesday, November 11, 2003, at 06:19  PM, Sarilion wrote:

> Boycotting police auctions isn't helping the problem, you're only 
> eliminating another of your possible choices.  Not all police seizures 
> are unjust, surprise, there really are people out there doing bad 
> things, and they get caught.  FURTHERMORE, the question was about 
> buying a used POLICE CAR, which would not have been seized to begin 
> with.
>
> You don't need to pay anyone for info about auctions.  use google.  
> it's free.
>
>
> sarilion
>
> At 03:56 PM 11/11/2003, Starchild wrote:
>> Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
>>
>>         I'd encourage everyone not to participate in police auctions, 
>> just for moral reasons. Buying cars from the police rewards them for 
>> stealing peoples' property. The police regularly steal vehicles from 
>> people who did nothing wrong. In Oakland, they'll take the cars of 
>> people merely suspected of soliciting prostitution, or who are the 
>> victim of a sting operation. They can also seize your car for mere 
>> possession of a small amount of drugs. It's not unknown for them to 
>> plant stuff on someone in order to arrest or rob the person. Police 
>> and even judges often get a cut of the proceeds from what is siezed, 
>> so the system acts as a direct incentive to corruption and to ruling 
>> against people getting their property back. If you don't believe it, 
>> do a web search on "civil asset forfeiture." Buying a car at one of 
>> these auctions is like buying jewelry from that shifty guy whispering 
>> to you on the street.
>>
>> Groove on,
>>                                                         <<< Starchild 
>> >>>
>>
>>
>> On Tuesday, November 11, 2003, at 06:56  AM, 
>> atawmicsfr@technolounge.org wrote:

>>> Hola!
>>>
>>> I'm curious if anyone has ever purchased a car at a police auction, 
>>> or knows
>>> anything about it?  I've searched on police websites and not found 
>>> anything
>>> about them, but have heard good things.  I have also found some 
>>> websites that
>>> say pay us 40 bucks and we'll give you access to all the local 
>>> auctions and
>>> whatnot.
>>>
>>> Anyone have any input on this?
>>>
>>> Much appreciated.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

Pioneer has a digital output on its DJM3000, Im sure it makes for a great
recording tool. But Ive seen two other mixers with not only a few digital
outs, but a few digital inputs as well:

Tascam X9:
http://www.tascam.com/product_info.php?pid=334&nav=computer_recording

Denon DN-X800:
http://www.usa.denon.com/catalog/photo.asp?s=pro&p=DN%2DX800&f=DNX800%2Ejpg&
c=31

My main concern remains on quality tho, Im currently leaning towards the
Allen and Heath or Rane direction...the Rane MP-44 looks esp tasty.

-Smith

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?


Depends what you are looking for...!? Does that include best sound? or
easiest to mix on?

I think the djm-600 is the EASIEST to mix on, but it sounds like crap and
too many people red line it when they play on it.
The Rane Rotary SOUNDS the best.
The Allen and Heath Xone series is a mixture of both.

Not sure about the digital in/outs.  anyone?
My 2 cents,.

Chris Fenton

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

My advice - do NOT get a Tascam x9.  Talk about a piece of &*#$!!!!

The noise on that is so bad that by just hitting the power button, you
get EMF so loud that you can actually run effects on them!  That's BAD!

And the plastic faders are just TOO cheap!

I bought one and kept if for a whole week before trading it in...for a
Rane Empath.  That too falls very short of the "perfect" mixer - but at
least it sounds great. 

I wanted the Tascam to work out though - it had lots of stuff to play
with - but it just wasn't a good mixer by any means...

~d

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

  In my opinion the best quality mixer in sound and
build is between three different mixers and all of
them are outstanding so it would be hard to choose
between them but here goes:

 1. Rane MP 44  4 Chanel with 3 band eq  (my personal
favorite and also what I own)

 2. Allen & Heath Xone 62 4 channel with 4 band eq

 3. Rane MP 2016 Rotary mixer with XP 2016 processor
(I want one so bad! They totally rock.)

 All three of these mixers are awsome and you couldn't
go wrong with any one of them.

 What ever you do stay away from the Pioneer mixers if
sound quality is your main focus. The Rane and Allen &
Haeths blow Pioneer out of the water in sound.

 Kevin James

>On Tue, 11 Nov 2003, Starchild wrote:
>-&e->   I don't believe the questioner stated that the purpose was to buy a
>-&e->POLICE CAR. I'm not even sure if such vehicles are sold to the public.
>-&e->But to address your point, yes, I'm sure there are some cars being sold
>-&e->at police auctions on the up-and-up. Abandoned vehicles, old undercover
>-&e->cars, that kind of thing.
>-&e->
>-&e->   Problem is, the cops aren't going to tell you which cars they
>-&e->legitimately own and which ones they just stole from people. So if you
>-&e->buy a vehicle at a police auction, there's a good chance you're helping
>-&e->them make a nice profit on stolen goods and giving them more incentive
>-&e->to keep stealing.
>-&e->
>-&e->   Think how you'd feel if it was someone else buying your car that was
>-&e->jacked from you on the cheap.

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."

rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

From: "Starchild" <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>

Subject: [sfraves] Re: NRR - Police Auctions for Cars


> I'd encourage everyone not to participate in police auctions, just for 
> moral reasons. Buying cars from the police rewards them for stealing 
> peoples' property. The police regularly steal vehicles from people who 
> did nothing wrong. In Oakland, they'll take the cars of people merely 
> suspected of soliciting prostitution, or who are the victim of a sting 
> operation. They can also seize your car for mere possession of a small 
> amount of drugs. It's not unknown for them to plant stuff on someone in 
> order to arrest or rob the person. Police and even judges often get a 
> cut of the proceeds from what is siezed, so the system acts as a direct 
> incentive to corruption and to ruling against people getting their 
> property back. If you don't believe it, do a web search on "civil asset 
> forfeiture." Buying a car at one of these auctions is like buying 
> jewelry from that shifty guy whispering to you on the street.
> 
> Groove on,
> <<< Starchild >>>
> 
>

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

I was wondering, do DJs usually upgrade mixers like shoes, or do you find 
what you like and stick with it?  Is there really an all around BEST mixer 
like technics?  Right now I have the Vextax PMC 05 limited model, I think DJ 
qbert had his hands involved in the design.  I am happy with the mixer for 
now, I kind of wish there was a mid knob, but I'm such a noob, I am having a 
blast with my tables any damn way.

Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer you choose?

thanks all

fable....

In-Reply-To: <Law11-F41m1qCFtw2E700065a2d@hotmail.com>
X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report
X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - occp3.ocservers.net
X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - hyperreal.org
X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [47 12]
X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - djdragnfly.com
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?


.
>
>Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer you choose?
>

Oh nelly, yes! Or perhaps it's more accurate to say that a djs mixing
style has something to do with the mixer they choose.

Rane 2016 and Allen & Heath are some of the best sounding mixers I've
ever heard, but they're geared to djs that lean to a long, smooth mixing
style.   I'd love to own one of those for the sound alone, but they're
just not fit for my various style of mixing.  I mean for the smooth,
more proggy mixes, their great, but when I dip into the harder stuff
that begs to be chopped up and sampled to hell, then my stle of mixing
gets aggressive and these mixers can't handle aggressive mixer handling.
It's just too clumsy to do a quick volume raise with the 2016 knob lines
and the Allen & Heaths always have a sort of delay when you quickly cut
with the crossfader. It sounds shitty.

Scratch DJs I know go for Vestax and some of the newer Ranes.

Proggy heads love Allen & Heath.

The masses seem to go for Pioneer, but I won't comment on them except to
say they have a layout that I'm confortable with, but I break a lot of
'em.

That's my .16 cents...


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm

Received: (qmail 36260 invoked from network); 12 Nov 2003 19:36:32 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [67.119.87.60]
X-Originating-Email: [electrofunk138@hotmail.com]
From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2003 11:36:30 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <BAY8-F27UNa0yYZdqQG0007d9d5@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 12 Nov 2003 19:36:30.0422 (UTC) FILETIME=[45761760:01C3A954]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

My favorite mixer that's got an "all around" feel to it has got to be the 
Vestax PMC250. It's a Vestax, so it's a smidge more geared towards scratch 
dj's, but it's got these HUGE rotary eq's that give it the feel of a house 
dj's mixer. It's got kill faders for each EQ, so you can either slowly 
eliminate that channel of EQ, or totally kill it all at once. Plus it's got 
responsive up/cross faders for cutting. I spin house, breaks, prog., techno 
& D&B, so a mixer like this kind of serves all my general needs (for long 
mixes or quick cuts). Now if I could only save the $$ to get one (not like 
they're expensive at $350 brand new), I'll be set. Sucks being a poor 
mofo...anyone have one they wanna sell me cheap???? LOL!

Marc(O)

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

I had my last mixer and loved it - a basic Vestax 15Mk2 (guess its now
the pmc150 or something).  The only gribe I had about the mixer was 1)
crossfaders were a BITCH to find (they may have settled that issue by
now) and 2) it was used at Teknique when it was around and having RCA
line ins only and a weak headphone output made it not an ideal mixer to
use out of the studio. But for in the studio, I don't mind Vestax.  



 


>-----Original Message-----
>From: Van Mundegaarde [mailto:electrofunk138@hotmail.com] 
>Sent: Wednesday, November 12, 2003 11:37 AM
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?
>
>
>My favorite mixer that's got an "all around" feel to it has 
>got to be the 
>Vestax PMC250. It's a Vestax, so it's a smidge more geared 
>towards scratch 
>dj's, but it's got these HUGE rotary eq's that give it the 
>feel of a house 
>dj's mixer. It's got kill faders for each EQ, so you can either slowly 
>eliminate that channel of EQ, or totally kill it all at once. 
>Plus it's got 
>responsive up/cross faders for cutting. I spin house, breaks, 
>prog., techno 
>& D&B, so a mixer like this kind of serves all my general 
>needs (for long 
>mixes or quick cuts). Now if I could only save the $$ to get 
>one (not like 
>they're expensive at $350 brand new), I'll be set. Sucks being a poor 
>mofo...anyone have one they wanna sell me cheap???? LOL!
>
>Marc(O)

>

>> >Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer 
>you choose?
>> >
>>
>>Oh nelly, yes! Or perhaps it's more accurate to say that a djs mixing
>>style has something to do with the mixer they choose.
>>
>>Rane 2016 and Allen & Heath are some of the best sounding mixers I've
>>ever heard, but they're geared to djs that lean to a long, 
>smooth mixing
>>style.   I'd love to own one of those for the sound alone, but they're
>>just not fit for my various style of mixing.  I mean for the smooth,
>>more proggy mixes, their great, but when I dip into the harder stuff
>>that begs to be chopped up and sampled to hell, then my stle of mixing
>>gets aggressive and these mixers can't handle aggressive 
>mixer handling.
>>It's just too clumsy to do a quick volume raise with the 2016 
>knob lines
>>and the Allen & Heaths always have a sort of delay when you 
>quickly cut
>>with the crossfader. It sounds shitty.
>>
>>Scratch DJs I know go for Vestax and some of the newer Ranes.
>>
>>Proggy heads love Allen & Heath.
>>
>>The masses seem to go for Pioneer, but I won't comment on 
>them except to
>>say they have a layout that I'm confortable with, but I break a lot of
>>'em.
>>
>>That's my .16 cents...

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: the matrix:revolutions WARNING PLOT HOLES! (duh)


Hi Jblaze.

I can see what you're getting at, in that everything has a different
meaning, based on perception and perspective.  But, a plot, is more fact
than interpretation.  It is the fundamental basis of the story.  Yes, you
can interpret things based on the plot, but contradictions within it only
lessen how believable the story is.

To use your example, it would be like Tony Hawk doing a 900 off a ramp,
then someone finding out that he didn't have any wheels on his skateboard.
This makes his trick not only unbelievable, but impossible.  So how did he
do it?  The same reasoning applies here.

Now, I do admit that some of my hostility is simply due to an overall
dissatisfaction with the second two movies.  The animatrix shorts were
great though, largely due to simple, cohesive mini-plots.

On Tue, 11 Nov 2003 JBlaze112@aol.com wrote:

> #1 according to the first movie and the animatrix, the humans were the ones
> who shut off the machines source to the sun because the machines were becoming
> out of control.

Right.  So now the world is covered with black clouds at what 10,000 feet?
Great.  We assume satellites are still operational, yes?  Why would the
ai/machines not just move off planet?

> #2 The machines then fought and won a war against the
> humans and probaly used all the dead carcuses for the power they did not get from
> the sun.

So, you're saying the inprisonment and subsequent farming of the humans
was more of a punishment than effective way to generate energy?

> #3 The machines then continued to recyle human embryos to maintain
> power and created a "matrix" to keep their brain busy. all except for those who
> escaped into Zion.

Still...  human bodies do not produce more energy than they consume.
In accordance with the second law of thermodynamics.  Overall, this entire
effort is wasted energy.

> #4 In the meantime whatever device the humans used to shut
> off access to the sun was never figured out by the computers... (who do not
> think in rational intuitive thought patterns mind you

Right, nor did they figure out that they could fly above the clouds, or
exist in space, or find a new planet to live on, all of which would have
taken less energy overall than building this flawed system of energy
farming.

Obviously these "AI" aren't very intelligent.

> #5 In the end when neo
> reaches a peace agreement/proposition with the computer mainframe (who has now
> devolped it's own personality) the war ends, which would then allow the humans to
> fix their device on the sun in which in return the machines will refrain from
> killing them.

Fix the device?  I'm not positive on this, but wasn't it made clear that
this was a long term if not permanent solution?  Didn't morpheus explain
to neo that the human race suffered from this choice just as much if not
more than the machines?

> #6 As the movie blatently
> ponits out from time to time, the entire occourance was meant to be the way it
> was, an no other way, which means if at any time, something seemed highly
> improbably... it was meerly a coincidence.

Just because it was meant to be, does not mean it makes logical sense.

I mean, they could have gotten around all of this by going for more of a
naked lunch style confusion-plot, which I think would have pleased the
fans more, and done justice to the story much more than the
ultra-hollywood quasi religious love story.

Of course this is all just my opinion, which matters very little if at
all.

-e-

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: A story (updated)

--MS_Mac_OE_3151487303_79324_MIME_Part
Content-type: text/plain; charset="ISO-8859-1"
Content-transfer-encoding: quoted-printable

Andrew Russell Baumrucker
11/8/03
D-oh!nut.

I awoke one morning to find a doughnut at my dinning table next to a "super
sized regular" glass of bovine udder secretion.
It looked too good to be true, was the thought which grazed my mind as I sa=
t
down in my chair.

I picked up this perfect doughnut in my hand and raised it to my mouth
slowly, watching the morning sunshine through the window behind me, past me
and slather across my doughnut with a golden light, so bright that it force=
d
the onlooking Gods to shield their eyes from the magnificent glory which wa=
s
the perfect doughnut that rested upon my nimble pathetic projectile leprosy
greeted hands.

Each sprinkle reflected the suns rays in it's own way.  I saw all of the
colors of the rainbow plus colors.  I didn't even know existed until this
glorious morning shone upon my royally humble life.

I stared with squinted eyes upon the doughnut bathed in so many colors and =
I
was in awe of how tranquil this glorious master piece was which came forth
from a society that elected people based on popularity and created drones
who traded in their flags of hope to hide behind flags of fear.

I brought the doughnut up to my glossy drool covered lips.  I thought to
myself "perhaps, just perhaps, if a society can create such a beautiful
creation, than maybe there still is a chance for the future.

I bit into the doughnut...Clank!  I bit into it again and again each time
with the same Clank! Clank! Clank!  I turned the doughnut over in my
glorious hand and read: =A9 2000 Accoutrements. 

--MS_Mac_OE_3151487303_79324_MIME_Part--

>> >dj's, but it's got these HUGE rotary eq's that give it the
>> >feel of a house
>> >dj's mixer. It's got kill faders for each EQ, so you can either slowly
>> >eliminate that channel of EQ, or totally kill it all at once.
>> >Plus it's got
>> >responsive up/cross faders for cutting. I spin house, breaks,
>> >prog., techno
>> >& D&B, so a mixer like this kind of serves all my general
>> >needs (for long
>> >mixes or quick cuts). Now if I could only save the $$ to get
>> >one (not like
>> >they're expensive at $350 brand new), I'll be set. Sucks being a poor
>> >mofo...anyone have one they wanna sell me cheap???? LOL!
>> >
>> >Marc(O)
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >>From: "Dragn'fly" <dragnfly@djdragnfly.com>
>> >>To: "'_ fable _'" <fable4our@hotmail.com>,<sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>> >>Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?
>> >>Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2003 11:10:46 -0800
>> >>
>> >>
>> >>.
>> >> >
>> >> >Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer
>> >you choose?
>> >> >
>> >>
>> >>Oh nelly, yes! Or perhaps it's more accurate to say that a djs mixing
>> >>style has something to do with the mixer they choose.
>> >>
>> >>Rane 2016 and Allen & Heath are some of the best sounding mixers I've
>> >>ever heard, but they're geared to djs that lean to a long,
>> >smooth mixing
>> >>style.   I'd love to own one of those for the sound alone, but they're
>> >>just not fit for my various style of mixing.  I mean for the smooth,
>> >>more proggy mixes, their great, but when I dip into the harder stuff
>> >>that begs to be chopped up and sampled to hell, then my stle of mixing
>> >>gets aggressive and these mixers can't handle aggressive
>> >mixer handling.
>> >>It's just too clumsy to do a quick volume raise with the 2016
>> >knob lines
>> >>and the Allen & Heaths always have a sort of delay when you
>> >quickly cut
>> >>with the crossfader. It sounds shitty.
>> >>
>> >>Scratch DJs I know go for Vestax and some of the newer Ranes.
>> >>
>> >>Proggy heads love Allen & Heath.
>> >>
>> >>The masses seem to go for Pioneer, but I won't comment on
>> >them except to
>> >>say they have a layout that I'm confortable with, but I break a lot of
>> >>'em.
>> >>
>> >>That's my .16 cents...
>> >>

Subject: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Archives


Dear SFR Community,

I'm building an archive of all SFR calendars, from 1992 on. If anyone here
has an archive of emailed SFR calendars from 1992-1998, please forward me
the copy of the Calendar in Email (with headers if possible). I thank you
so kindly for your support and any help you may offer in helping me build
this archive.

As part of this ongoing process, I'm reviewing the SFR archives for any
calendar information that might be present for extraction and addition to
the SFR calendar archive.

Currently there *is* a calendar archive for years 1998-2003 @
http://www.sfraves.org/archives/sfrcal/

If you find anything missing and have a copy of it, please forward it to
me as well - my address is karina@hyperreal.org

Thank  you!

Much love,

Karina

>From: "Dragn'fly" <dragnfly@djdragnfly.com>
>To: "'_ fable _'" <fable4our@hotmail.com>,<sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?
>Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2003 11:10:46 -0800
>
>
>.
> >
> >Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer you choose?
> >
>
>Oh nelly, yes! Or perhaps it's more accurate to say that a djs mixing
>style has something to do with the mixer they choose.
>
>Rane 2016 and Allen & Heath are some of the best sounding mixers I've
>ever heard, but they're geared to djs that lean to a long, smooth mixing
>style.   I'd love to own one of those for the sound alone, but they're
>just not fit for my various style of mixing.  I mean for the smooth,
>more proggy mixes, their great, but when I dip into the harder stuff
>that begs to be chopped up and sampled to hell, then my stle of mixing
>gets aggressive and these mixers can't handle aggressive mixer handling.
>It's just too clumsy to do a quick volume raise with the 2016 knob lines
>and the Allen & Heaths always have a sort of delay when you quickly cut
>with the crossfader. It sounds shitty.
>
>Scratch DJs I know go for Vestax and some of the newer Ranes.
>
>Proggy heads love Allen & Heath.
>
>The masses seem to go for Pioneer, but I won't comment on them except to
>say they have a layout that I'm confortable with, but I break a lot of
>'em.
>
>That's my .16 cents...
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: [sfraves] Contact Numbers for Event Promotions

Going through the archives, I found a list of phone numbers from Thursday,
August 13, 1992 sent out by Derek Chung, of events in the Bay area. If
anyone is interested in submitting a phone number for their event /
promotions group, please feel free to add them to the SFR Calendar @

If you would like to submit your infoline to a similar list I'm generating
for the sake of convenience to our community, please email me @
karina@hyperreal.org

Thanks :)

>>>I had my last mixer and loved it - a basic Vestax 15Mk2 (guess its now
>>>the pmc150 or something).  The only gribe I had about the mixer was 1)
>>>crossfaders were a BITCH to find (they may have settled that issue by
>>>now) and 2) it was used at Teknique when it was around and having RCA
>>>line ins only and a weak headphone output made it not an ideal mixer to
>>>use out of the studio. But for in the studio, I don't mind Vestax.
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> >-----Original Message-----
>>> >From: Van Mundegaarde [mailto:electrofunk138@hotmail.com]
>>> >Sent: Wednesday, November 12, 2003 11:37 AM
>>> >To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>> >Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?
>>> >
>>> >
>>> >My favorite mixer that's got an "all around" feel to it has
>>> >got to be the
>>> >Vestax PMC250. It's a Vestax, so it's a smidge more geared
>>> >towards scratch
>>> >dj's, but it's got these HUGE rotary eq's that give it the
>>> >feel of a house
>>> >dj's mixer. It's got kill faders for each EQ, so you can either slowly
>>> >eliminate that channel of EQ, or totally kill it all at once.
>>> >Plus it's got
>>> >responsive up/cross faders for cutting. I spin house, breaks,
>>> >prog., techno
>>> >& D&B, so a mixer like this kind of serves all my general
>>> >needs (for long
>>> >mixes or quick cuts). Now if I could only save the $$ to get
>>> >one (not like
>>> >they're expensive at $350 brand new), I'll be set. Sucks being a poor
>>> >mofo...anyone have one they wanna sell me cheap???? LOL!
>>> >
>>> >Marc(O)

>>> >

>>> >>From: "Dragn'fly" <dragnfly@djdragnfly.com>
>>> >>To: "'_ fable _'" <fable4our@hotmail.com>,<sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>>> >>Subject: RE: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?
>>> >>Date: Wed, 12 Nov 2003 11:10:46 -0800
>>> >>
>>> >>
>>> >>.
>>> >> >
>>> >> >Also, do genres really have something to do with what mixer
>>> >you choose?
>>> >> >
>>> >>
>>> >>Oh nelly, yes! Or perhaps it's more accurate to say that a djs mixing
>>> >>style has something to do with the mixer they choose.
>>> >>
>>> >>Rane 2016 and Allen & Heath are some of the best sounding mixers I've
>>> >>ever heard, but they're geared to djs that lean to a long,
>>> >smooth mixing
>>> >>style.   I'd love to own one of those for the sound alone, but they're
>>> >>just not fit for my various style of mixing.  I mean for the smooth,
>>> >>more proggy mixes, their great, but when I dip into the harder stuff
>>> >>that begs to be chopped up and sampled to hell, then my stle of mixing
>>> >>gets aggressive and these mixers can't handle aggressive
>>> >mixer handling.
>>> >>It's just too clumsy to do a quick volume raise with the 2016
>>> >knob lines
>>> >>and the Allen & Heaths always have a sort of delay when you
>>> >quickly cut
>>> >>with the crossfader. It sounds shitty.
>>> >>
>>> >>Scratch DJs I know go for Vestax and some of the newer Ranes.
>>> >>
>>> >>Proggy heads love Allen & Heath.
>>> >>
>>> >>The masses seem to go for Pioneer, but I won't comment on
>>> >them except to
>>> >>say they have a layout that I'm confortable with, but I break a lot of
>>> >>'em.
>>> >>
>>> >>That's my .16 cents...

> >>> >towards scratch
> >>> >dj's, but it's got these HUGE rotary eq's that give it the
> >>> >feel of a house
> >>> >dj's mixer. It's got kill faders for each EQ, so you can either slowly
> >>> >eliminate that channel of EQ, or totally kill it all at once.

> >>> >responsive up/cross faders for cutting. I spin house, breaks,

X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
Message-ID: <Law14-OE37mOlbcrYP000000312@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 13 Nov 2003 01:31:53.0679 (UTC) FILETIME=[EB1CE5F0:01C3A985]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR] [Gear Talk] Best DJ Mixer?

If you want the mid nob, upgrade to the 07Pro, same basic design as the 05
with some additional mixing DJ friendly features.  My favorite mixer by far
to play on, unfortunately not very well set up for club use.  Mixer
preference comes down to the style that you mix in, which can be influenced
by the genres you play, but is not an absolute.  I've yet to find a mixer
that fully combines all the features I like.  My ultimate mixer would be a
mix of the top of the line Allen + Heath, Vestax, and Pioneer models, taking
all the good stuff from each and weeding out the flaws, and in my mind each
mixer has at least one fatal flaw.

-Andrew

minimal techno to hard techno here...   listen for EGR01 giveaway...

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR]Don't use hydrocortisone cream, was Headphone rashes


<< 3) if you get the rash again, use hydrocortisone to get rid of
 it. >>
People, don't ever use hydrocortisone for a rash that may be a fungal 
infection (ie. moist neck or athlete's foot), it will only cover up the inflamation 
while the infection gets worse. Better to use Benadryl (diphenhydramine) cream 
for an itchy rash, and check with a dermatologist.  Of course elimanating 
contact with the offending substance is always a must when dealing with an allergy 
or inflamation.  Try sewing or gluing another piece of fabric over/around the 
desired area.  If ever in doubt contact your doctor or dermatologist.  People 
remember, if you ever have a chronic or acute problem (recurring or sustained 
or intense) you don't want to deal with it for the rest of your life so 
please consult a professional problem solver in that area of expertise.
Truly,
Peter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: the matrix:revolutions WARNING PLOT HOLES! (duh)


Hi...

Now I realize that we are getting to the point of overanalysis on
something that is supposed to be mythical, with christian overtones...
But...  These things just bother me, and since it is the premise of the
entire story, it makes the entire thing seem absurd.

On Thu, 13 Nov 2003 JBlaze112@aol.com wrote:

> what about that scene in the first matrix where morpheous says "the human
> body generates over 1000 btu's of blah blah blah energy,

The human body does not create this energy out of nothing.  If the body
was 100% efficient (which is near impossible) there would be 0 energy
(heat) escaping.

Here are the laws of thermodynamics.
From: http://www.emc.maricopa.edu/faculty/farabee/BIOBK/BioBookEner1.html

--

First Law of Thermodynamics: Energy can be changed from one form to
another, but it cannot be created or destroyed. The total amount of energy
and matter in the Universe remains constant, merely changing from one form
to another. The First Law of Thermodynamics (Conservation) states that
energy is always conserved, it cannot be created or destroyed. In essence,
energy can be converted from one form into another.

The Second Law of Thermodynamics states that "in all energy exchanges, if
no energy enters or leaves the system, the potential energy of the state
will always be less than that of the initial state." This is also commonly
referred to as entropy. A watchspring-driven watch will run until the
potential energy in the spring is converted, and not again until energy is
reapplied to the spring to rewind it. A car that has run out of gas will
not run again until you walk 10 miles to a gas station and refuel the car.
Once the potential energy locked in carbohydrates is converted into
kinetic energy (energy in use or motion), the organism will get no more
until energy is input again. In the process of energy transfer, some
energy will dissipate as heat. Entropy is a measure of disorder: cells are
NOT disordered and so have low entropy. The flow of energy maintains order
and life. Entropy wins when organisms cease to take in energy and die.

--

So, even if these "human batteries" were doing nothing more than making
heat (which is not the case) they still would not be 'generating'
anything.  Overall, even with a loop of feeding dead humans to living
ones, you would never reach a point where the energy created was more
than what was used.

And again...  They /could/ have gotten around this by making a more
intricate and confusing plot...  layers upon layers of matrixes where the
rules are different, and laws (like thermodynamics) could be broken,
because it is not actually reality.

-e-

-- 
Green Graphics   :::   Print and Web Design   :::   510.923.0000

Subject: [sfraves] RES003: Get UP! EP by DJ Tronic - NOW AVAILABLE!  .bsp.

Resistance Recordings USA is proud to announce our latest release:


RES-003: GET UP EP! by DJ Tronic


Click here to purchase: http://www.resistancerecordings.com/store.html


This is our third release on Resistance Recordings and is our biggest yet! 
The GET UP! EP features an eagerly awaited track by DJ Tronic with vocalist 
Valerie Sparks. Already having been featured on 2 compilations here in the 
USA, the original DJ Tronic mix is a rush of hard beats and energetic synths 
to make you wanna GET UP! That's not all though, as this EP is fully loaded 
with remixes by some of the most talented American Hard House and Hardcore 
Producers in the world!

Remixers include: Mark V. & Poogie Bear, Bassdrum Project, Circle K, Bang 
FM, and a killer Hardstyle mix by Carlos Alfonzo!

This record is being played by some of the world's top rated Hard DJs, and 
hit the shops in the USA November 11th and throughout the world towards the 
end of November. If you haven't got a chance to hear the EP just yet, here 
are the audio links:


SIDE A:

A1. DJ Tronic Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getup2003.ram
A2: Mark V. & Poogie Bear Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getupmarkandpoogieremix.ram
A3: Bassdrum Project Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getupbassdrumprojectmix.ram


SIDE B:

B1: Circle K Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/get_up_circlekremix.ram
B2: Bang FM Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getupbangfmremix.ram
B3: Carlos Alfonzo Mix: 
http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getuphardstyle.ram


We fully expect this EP to sell very quickly, so get your's very soon! You 
can get it online at:


http://www.resistancerecordings.com/store.html


or through your local record outlets! If they don't have it, ask for it! :) 
We appreciate your support, and keep bangin' the hard sh#t!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [SRR]Don't use hydrocortisone cream, was Headphone rashes

i doubt that the headphone rash is fungal, but if you suspect
that it is, go see a doctor.

m

--- Oneguyinsanfran@aol.com wrote:
> 
> << 3) if you get the rash again, use hydrocortisone to get
> rid of
>  it. >>
> People, don't ever use hydrocortisone for a rash that may be
> a fungal 
> infection (ie. moist neck or athlete's foot), it will only
> cover up the inflamation 
> while the infection gets worse. Better to use Benadryl
> (diphenhydramine) cream 
> for an itchy rash, and check with a dermatologist.  Of course
> elimanating 
> contact with the offending substance is always a must when
> dealing with an allergy 
> or inflamation.  Try sewing or gluing another piece of fabric
> over/around the 
> desired area.  If ever in doubt contact your doctor or
> dermatologist.  People 
> remember, if you ever have a chronic or acute problem
> (recurring or sustained 
> or intense) you don't want to deal with it for the rest of
> your life so 
> please consult a professional problem solver in that area of
> expertise.
> Truly,
> Peter
> 
>

Subject: [sfraves] Brazil: "Electronic Music For All" Draws 127,000

--=====================_11373734==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Sao Paolo, Brazil: "Electronic Music For All" Draws 127,000

The Association of Friends of Electronic Music (AME) held "City Parade - 
Electronic Music for All" on October 26, 2003, drawing 127,000 people to 
the streets of Sao Paulo.  AME was established to bring public 
awareness  to electronic music culture, and to demonstrate the values of 
the scene. In addition to the street parade, AME will work to improve the 
electronic music industry, promote harm reduction to confront drug use, and 
organize people in the scene to work with community charities.  They also 
plan to lobby Brazil's government as part of the National Campaign Against 
Excessive Taxation of Imported Vinyl.

Their website is in Portuguese, however, an English version of their 
manifesto is available:

       http://www.amigosme.org/index.php?act=manifesto-en

Love,

Apollo


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

>Resistance Recordings USA is proud to announce our latest release:
>
>
>RES-003: GET UP EP! by DJ Tronic
>
>
>Click here to purchase: http://www.resistancerecordings.com/store.html
>
>
>This is our third release on Resistance Recordings and is our biggest yet! 
>The GET UP! EP features an eagerly awaited track by DJ Tronic with vocalist 
>Valerie Sparks. Already having been featured on 2 compilations here in the 
>USA, the original DJ Tronic mix is a rush of hard beats and energetic 
>synths to make you wanna GET UP! That's not all though, as this EP is fully 
>loaded with remixes by some of the most talented American Hard House and 
>Hardcore Producers in the world!
>
>Remixers include: Mark V. & Poogie Bear, Bassdrum Project, Circle K, Bang 
>FM, and a killer Hardstyle mix by Carlos Alfonzo!
>
>This record is being played by some of the world's top rated Hard DJs, and 
>hit the shops in the USA November 11th and throughout the world towards the 
>end of November. If you haven't got a chance to hear the EP just yet, here 
>are the audio links:
>
>

>
>A1. DJ Tronic Mix: 
>http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getup2003.ram

>A3: Bassdrum Project Mix: 
>http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getupbassdrumprojectmix.ram

>http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getupbangfmremix.ram
>B3: Carlos Alfonzo Mix: 
>http://www.resistancerecordings.com/audio/res003/ram/getuphardstyle.ram

>
>
>http://www.resistancerecordings.com/store.html
>

>>>Resistance Recordings USA is proud to announce our latest release:
>>>
>>>
>>>RES-003: GET UP EP! by DJ Tronic
>>>
>>>
>>>Click here to purchase: http://www.resistancerecordings.com/store.html
>>>
>>>
>>>This is our third release on Resistance Recordings and is our biggest 
>>>yet! The GET UP! EP features an eagerly awaited track by DJ Tronic with 
>>>vocalist Valerie Sparks. Already having been featured on 2 compilations 
>>>here in the USA, the original DJ Tronic mix is a rush of hard beats and 
>>>energetic synths to make you wanna GET UP! That's not all though, as this 
>>>EP is fully loaded with remixes by some of the most talented American 
>>>Hard House and Hardcore Producers in the world!
>>>
>>>Remixers include: Mark V. & Poogie Bear, Bassdrum Project, Circle K, Bang 
>>>FM, and a killer Hardstyle mix by Carlos Alfonzo!
>>>
>>>This record is being played by some of the world's top rated Hard DJs, 
>>>and hit the shops in the USA November 11th and throughout the world 
>>>towards the end of November. If you haven't got a chance to hear the EP 
>>>just yet, here are the audio links:

****************PLEASE DO NOT POST TO OTHER LISTS*****************



SATURDAY, November 15th

10PM to 6AM

MOKSHA TRIBE
brings you

**HARVEST**


Dancing is prominent in all harvest festivities, to bless the seed, assure 
fertility,
  and provide the life force for the next season.

Moksha Tribe invites you to join us in this gathering of the underground 
tribes to celebrate our harvest:
the power of music and dance that unites our bodies and spirits.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Ferona Room:
Techno
(in order of appearance)

nomadicDJ  (Moksha Tribe, SF)
Reclipse  (BayRaves, Deciblast)
Special 2X4 set with Chris Jackson and Andy W:
Chris Jackson (Resourcerecords.com, Refined Music, Jump Recordings, SJ)
Andy W (Resourcerecords, Refined Music, Viberation)
Catharsis (EGR Records / www.egregious.net / Redwood City)
(This is the official record release party for Cartharsis's new Xenos 
EP:  EGR-01)
Shawn Allen (Moksha Tribe, SF)


The Kornwolf Room:
Drum 'n' Bass, Breaks, Ambient

Phaedrus (Moksha Tribe, SF,  HIP)
hak (Easeuprecords, Killlasubz)
Jauncy (Moksha Tribe, SF)
Calamity Jane (Moksha Tribe, SF, Ambreaks)
V0lljude (Dub Beautiful Collective)


Visuals by Viberation Graphics
Special 5 Screen Video Installation
Lighting Support by Radiant Atmospheres
Sound by SWAT

As always, you will be treated with love and respect and offered:

Free Water
Free Fruit
Free Refreshments
Free Toys
Free Coffee

Massages by Ravin Riz to benefit Larkin Street

Convenient East Bay location

ALL PROFITS FROM THIS EVENT WILL BE DONATED TO LARKIN STREET YOUTH SERVICES
http://www.larkinstreetyouth.org/

Tickets will be available at the door Saturday night for $12.00, with
$2.00 of that amount going directly to Larkin Street.

Call the Moksha info line the night of for directions:

415-564-4768

Limited presale tickets are still available and may be
purchased for $10.00 directly from these Moksha Tribe members:

Gene    831-325-3578  Santa Cruz
Terry  408-398-0593  South Bay  (terry@viberation.com)
Audra  510-663-7050  East Bay
Carl   650-704-1814   (nomadic@nomadicdj.com)
Apollo 415-596-6817 SF (apollo@speakeasy.org)
Tom    415-312-5100  SF (sheztek@yahoo.com)

and from Moksha folks at selected parties.

Paypal tickets purchased after November 10th will be held at will call 
(Paypal receipt and ID required).

For further updates, go to the Moksha Tribe website:

http://www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/


Love,

Moksha Tribe

(Liberation through music and dance)



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
