Subject: Compression shit...... Qbert . Z-Trip . Disco D . and More

Got a couple serious show comming up for ya'll. First chk out Qbert commin next
Saturday to the DNA, ticket are sellin fast so don't SLEEP FOOLS! Also we got
NYE2004 on the way and for this one time only we are offering $50 tickets there
are very few limited to the public so get them now!

******************************************************************

Saturday, November 22nd
Compression & Flavor Group Join Forces to present dj...

DJ QBERT (Thud Rumble, www.djqbert.com)
If your from the Bay you know about Qbert, founding member of the seminal
turntable group the Invisibl Skratch Piklz and considered by many to be the
most skilled dj around, period. The Picaso of turntablism, Q put to final rest
the critics who refused to accept the turntable as a musical instrument. He won
so many DMC battles, he was banned from compitition, and was instrumental in
the development of the ITF. Alongside Dug 1, Syd Garon and Eric Henry, Qbert
composed the first , and only, full lenth animated film based entirly around a
scratch music album. Join us for this rare appearance.

VIN ROC LIVE(Tripple Threat, ITF World Champion)Vinroc willbe making a special
live performance featuring turntables, production equipment, and a live
guitarist.

N.A.W. (N.A.W.TM, East Baton Rouge, LI.)
The dirty south rudeboys are back. Read about them at http://
www.clubcompression.com

ALSO PERFORMANCES BY: MICHAEL TELLO, SUNDER, RASTA Q-TIP, & NAMADEEQ
*HIP HOP DANCEFEST OFFICIAL AFTERPARTY w/ Suprise Dance Performances TBA
Advanced Tickets: http://www.clubcompression.com

DNA LOUNGE
375 11th @ Harrison
San Francisco
9pm-Afterhours

Hi, first of all I want to say I'm planning to go to the Moksha Tribe party, 
Harvest, on Saturday. I've heard so many good things about their party and 
have yet to go to one, so it's about time. Also, the Shaolin crew are good people 
and they're putting on Power Puff Girls in Sacramento, which should be a fun 
party. 

I was surprised to find that Ferry Corsten and DJ Rap will also be in town, 
for a national tour sponsored by Sony Playstation 2. I don't know what a 
Playstation gig is like compared to another kind of performance. You know that Rap 
will be coming around again, and Ferry will too (eventually), but anyhow if you 
want to check them out, info is at 
http://www.us.playstation.com/Events.aspx?id=28  

Everyone have a good weekend!
Jonnyr

Subject: Compression shit...... Qbert . Z-Trip . Disco D . and More

Got a couple serious show comming up for ya'll. First chk out Qbert commin next
Saturday to the DNA, ticket are sellin fast so don't SLEEP FOOLS! Also we got
NYE2004 on the way and for this one time only we are offering $50 tickets there
are very few limited to the public so get them now!

******************************************************************

Saturday, November 22nd
Compression & Flavor Group Join Forces to present dj...

DJ QBERT (Thud Rumble, www.djqbert.com)
If your from the Bay you know about Qbert, founding member of the seminal
turntable group the Invisibl Skratch Piklz and considered by many to be the
most skilled dj around, period. The Picaso of turntablism, Q put to final rest
the critics who refused to accept the turntable as a musical instrument. He won
so many DMC battles, he was banned from compitition, and was instrumental in
the development of the ITF. Alongside Dug 1, Syd Garon and Eric Henry, Qbert
composed the first , and only, full lenth animated film based entirly around a
scratch music album. Join us for this rare appearance.

VIN ROC LIVE(Tripple Threat, ITF World Champion)Vinroc willbe making a special
live performance featuring turntables, production equipment, and a live
guitarist.

N.A.W. (N.A.W.TM, East Baton Rouge, LI.)
The dirty south rudeboys are back. Read about them at http://
www.clubcompression.com

ALSO PERFORMANCES BY: MICHAEL TELLO, SUNDER, RASTA Q-TIP, & NAMADEEQ
*HIP HOP DANCEFEST OFFICIAL AFTERPARTY w/ Suprise Dance Performances TBA
Advanced Tickets: http://www.clubcompression.com

DNA LOUNGE
375 11th @ Harrison
San Francisco
9pm-Afterhours

Subject: [sfraves] Reminder : Last day to reserve your copy of Cobalt's first release is nov 15th

-------------------------------1068865530
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Folks I invite you to check us out at: Cobalt Recordings - Cobalt "The New 
Power" (Cobalt 001) , or http://www.cobaltrecordings.tk/  

Cobalt Recordings is a new label founded by DJ Pisces and Tony Russo in 
Chicago.  Cobalt will primarily release, tech-house, and other forms of IDM 
(Intelligent Dance Music.)  This compilation showcases the talent of the 
artists on 
Cobalt; new talent committed to bringing a breath of fresh air to 
electronica. 
We have international artists from Belgium, Netherlands, England, Austria, 
Russia, Germany, and Italy just to name a few.  

We have audio samples for you to listen from our upcoming release due out in 
stores in December. 

If you would like to purchase a copy before the CD hits stores you may visit 
Spins.US :: View topic - Cobalt Recordings Cd Compilation : The New Power !!!! 
The deadline to order the CD is November 15th. Those who attend any events in 
charlotte can avoid shipping and pick up their copy directly from me. If you 
need it mailed to you shipping will be added. $4.50 plus $5.00 for shipping 
will reserve your copy.  Those who take advantage of this 
offer before November 15th will also get their CD autographed. That's right 
autographed as a small token of appreciation and a way of us at cobalt saying 
thank you for the love and support.

The response from our first release is absolutely amazing see what people are 
all ready saying:

 "Just gave the samples a listen. I dig the deeper grooves in the second half
- real spacey & hypnotic."      
         Tyler Stadius 


To order your copy of the release before anyone else does please e-mail: 
monk7923@aol.com with CD order in the subject line.



Tony da Tiger Russo 
Cobalt Recordings

fertility,

Moksha Tribe invites you to join us in this gathering of the underground 
tribes to celebrate our harvest:
the power of music and dance that unites our bodies and spirits.

----- Original Message -----
From: <JBlaze112@aol.com>

In a message dated 11/13/03 10:20:26 AM,
ed-dated-1069179576.db5629@greengraphics.net writes:
> Now I realize that we are getting to the point of overanalysis on
> something that is supposed to be mythical, with christian overtones...
> But... These things just bother me, and since it is the premise of the
> entire story, it makes the entire thing seem absurd.
>

It's only absurd because of it's brave and original attempt at relating it's
story to real life and real time, it makes us think about reality, science,
religion, myth and technology and politics, thus allowing us to anylize it
by
real life rules and science enevitibly to prove it wrong one way or another.
The
point is that it makes this attempt, and does it boldly, it makes you think
about how things work.
You cannot say the same for highly acclaimed movies like Lord of the Rings
or
Star Wars because they are complete fantasy and you can't hold them to real
life rules and science.

----Sure I can.  If you think Matrix does as you say and the above two do
not,
then you are not properly watching these two movies.  Matrix hits closer to
home
in terms of the vehicle the story is told in (modern life, computers, etc.),
but that
doesn't mean it hits closer to the mark.    You really should take a look at
Joseph Campbells "The Power of Myth", just for a small eye opener.  Lucas
would
tell you himself that Star Wars is based quite heavily on Campbell's work
"The Hero
With a Thousand Faces.", a work that is exactly about stories (myths) that
speak
to us on a very human and universal level, no matter the point in time that
you live in.

They only have subtle hints of comparason to our real
life today and usually it's just the struggle of good & evil, love and blah
blah blah, to me I think fantasy writers hide behind safety nets to get
their
subtle, less arguable, less contraversial messeges across. Where as Matrix
boldly
and blatently communicates messages that pertain to all of our daily life.


-----I could just as easily say Matrix is a simple story about love (Neo and
Trinity) and
good (humanity) and evil (machines / technology) and blah blah blah, but I
wont.  You're
correct that Matrix does try and be more than a simple story, but the
previously mentioned
are also more than you imply.  There is  a dirge (as always) of fantasy
writters that do
put out fluff, but there are great ones as well; most of which you'll have
to read their books
though.

Once my family and I were watching Beauty and the Beast.  You know the part where Belle runs out of the castle and almost gets killed my wolves and then she blames it on the Beast for being angry of her going to the west wing?  Well, we stopped the movie and started analyzing it and argued over who's fault it was.  Then we realized, it was a Disney movie and we were just being stupid over trying to make sense of it.
 
Just my two cents.
 
-Warren

JBlaze112@aol.com wrote:
In a message dated 11/13/03 10:20:26 AM, 
ed-dated-1069179576.db5629@greengraphics.net writes:
> Now I realize that we are getting to the point of overanalysis on
> something that is supposed to be mythical, with christian overtones...
> But...  These things just bother me, and since it is the premise of the
> entire story, it makes the entire thing seem absurd.
> 

It's only absurd because of it's brave and original attempt at relating it's 
story to real life and real time, it makes us think about reality, science, 
religion, myth and technology and politics, thus allowing us to anylize it by 
real life rules and science enevitibly to prove it wrong one way or another. The 
point is that it makes this attempt, and does it boldly, it makes you think 
about how things work. 
You cannot say the same for highly acclaimed movies like Lord of the Rings or 
Star Wars because they are complete fantasy and you can't hold them to real 
life rules and science. They only have subtle hints of comparason to our real 
life today and usually it's just the struggle of good & evil, love and blah 
blah blah, to me I think fantasy writers hide behind safety nets to get their 
subtle, less arguable, less contraversial messeges across. Where as Matrix boldly 
and blatently communicates messages that pertain to all of our daily life.

Subject: [sfraves] Reminder : Last day to reserve your copy of Cobalt's first release is nov 15th

-------------------------------1068934881
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Folks I invite you to check us out at: Cobalt Recordings - Cobalt "The New 
Power" (Cobalt 001) , or http://www.cobaltrecordings.tk/  

Cobalt Recordings is a new label founded by DJ Pisces and Tony Russo in 
Chicago.  Cobalt will primarily release, tech-house, and other forms of IDM 
(Intelligent Dance Music.)  This compilation showcases the talent of the 
artists on 
Cobalt; new talent committed to bringing a breath of fresh air to 
electronica. 
We have international artists from Belgium, Netherlands, England, Austria, 
Russia, Germany, and Italy just to name a few.  

We have audio samples for you to listen from our upcoming release due out in 
stores in December. 

If you would like to purchase a copy before the CD hits stores you may visit 
Spins.US :: View topic - Cobalt Recordings Cd Compilation : The New Power !!!! 
The deadline to order the CD is November 15th. Those who attend any events in 
charlotte can avoid shipping and pick up their copy directly from me. If you 
need it mailed to you shipping will be added. $4.50 plus $5.00 for shipping 
will reserve your copy.  Those who take advantage of this 
offer before November 15th will also get their CD autographed. That's right 
autographed as a small token of appreciation and a way of us at cobalt saying 
thank you for the love and support.

The response from our first release is absolutely amazing see what people are 
all ready saying:

 "Just gave the samples a listen. I dig the deeper grooves in the second half
- real spacey & hypnotic."      
         Tyler Stadius 


To order your copy of the release before anyone else does please e-mail: 
monk7923@aol.com with CD order in the subject line.


Tony da Tiger Russo

  In a message dated 11/15/03 11:11:15 AM, micromu@sbcglobal.net writes:



    -----I could just as easily say Matrix is a simple story about love =
(Neo and
    Trinity) and
    good (humanity) and evil (machines / technology) and blah blah blah, =
but I
    wont.  You're
    correct that Matrix does try and be more than a simple story, but =
the
    previously mentioned
    are also more than you imply.  There is  a dirge (as always) of =
fantasy
    writters that do
    put out fluff, but there are great ones as well; most of which =
you'll have
    to read their books
    though.



  What i'm trying to say is that although yes star wars and lord of the =
rings do have admittingly profound mythological implications, they have =
their contraversy saftey neted by the fantasy and non relation to the =
"world right now" Any high school drop out can watch the Matrix and see =
that the agents represnt the secret government, that the world is lying =
to us, Zion is a tribal community, the zion counsil looks likea bunch of =
teched-out hippies, neo represents a reluctant christ and that agent =
smith emerges as the anti-christ.

  ----That is true.  And 50 y ears ago could this have been known by any =
high school drop out?  In 50  years hence will the technology of the =
Matrix world seem amazing, or passe and trite?  All good myths are =
cloaked in the machinery of the times they're told in, usually.  Dare I =
say that Star Wars and Lord of the Rings were more imaginative in that =
they created worlds not easily recognized, yet worked 100% within their =
context.  That, to me, is an amazing achievement.  Is Frodo not the =
reluctant hero?  Is not Gandalf with his pipe the hippie and repository =
of wisedom?  Are not the Ring Wraiths the government? Etc.  Just because =
it's easier to believe the world of the Matrix doesn't make the tale =
told in the Matrix more true. =20

   Lord of the Rings - to the average dumb american, mind you, is just a =
fantasy movie people don't make the correlations from it to real life =
unless they are really into philosophy & myth. I'm not saying this makes =
the matrix a better movie, what i'm saying is that we should give it =
props for being bold and contraversial instead of holding it to higher =
scientifical standards and putting it down for it's attempts at =
communicating extreamly difficult real life messages. in other words the =
Matrix has lots of messages that a lot of people don't like to talk =
about, where as u can talk star wars and lord of the rigns with people =
all day long without offending anyone because of the fantasy saftey =
nets.

  ----I'm not convinced of that, though I see what you're driving at.  =
Still, the deliniation of good and evil in the Matrix is pretty clear =
cut.  For anyone with a moral center and compass the deliniation always =
is clear cut.  The offensive discussion comes in the details, not the =
overall story and the role of the protagonist.  I can't tell  you how =
many people have come out of Matrix movies yakking with friends about =
"omg did you see that amazing, wow that was incredible!'  Perhaps all =
well told mythic stories entertain first, and entertain most, and are =
deep only depending on the viewers ability to grasp deeper meaning?

   arguably the safety nets, u could say, make the myth more elegant and =
less narrowminded and open for interpretation. but i happen to think =
it's cool that the matrix narrowed things down to a more narrow message, =
even tho it seems to piss a lot of people off.

  ---I take it you've never read the disertation on the Empire being the =
good guys and the Rebels being the bad guys?  Think about it...while =
there's some events that make this impossible, there is a way of viewing =
Star Wars in this way. =20

  Personally I'd like to see (or make) a movie that doesn't use "agents" =
and "computer worlds" or metaphors at all and communicates it's message =
in a straight forward present day, lets fuckin do something about this =
bullshit world kind of way. but untill then i still say matrix hits home =
politically more so than any other hollywood blockbusters that i know =
of.=20

  ----Here's the twist though, we humans are what made the machines of =
the Matrix what they are.  We humans are what make those in control what =
they are, and then allow (by re-electing the familiar name) them to =
continue controlling us while we scream for change and weakly watch =
things like the Matrix and thinking it's different there, but we're far =
too controlled.  We can't pull it off.  If only we could be like that.  =
Escapism is escapism, as cool as it is.

  Guilty too,
  pod

Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio 11/16 : Hotbox Radio (Ragga Night) :.


Tonight on Dirtbox Radio we've got some ill shizzle as usual, with a bit
of reggae-influenced flavor.  Some of the area's top Ragga djs will be in
attendance, so don't sleep on the broadcast.  Below are timeslots, links,
and some other good shit for you to chew on.

Timeslots:
07pm EST - ADHD
08pm EST - Locks (of Intellect)
09pm EST - Kaotix
10pm EST - Jungle Jessi

After 11 we'll bust out some tagging action, with the possibility of
visits from Arsonist, Phirewall, and our boy Blaze One.

Links:

64k - http://jungletrian.net/64kbps.pls
24k - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls
webcam - http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html
chat - http://jungletrain.net/chat.htm

all links - http://dirtboxradio.com/listen.html

Here's a glimpse at our upcoming lineups:
nov 23 - Kauz, Mugzy
nov 24 - Dirtbox Kru & Evancipation take over Renegade Bass
nov 30 - ODJ's Burfday Speshul
dec 07 - illEffect
dec 14 - Relapse, Lycan (Kenobi)
dec 21 - Sabin
dec 28 - New Yearz Speshul

Just stop by the site for updated lineups. ( http://www.dirtboxradio.com)

If you're tryin to play Dirtbox sometime, or have your CD aired, just hit
us up ( bookme@dirtboxradio.com ).  We strive to bring to you the hottest
talent in our area, be it newcomers or the well-entrenched DJ.  Send us a
link to a mix, or mail us a CD, Tape, MD, or parchment scroll, and we'll
check that shizzle out.

Alright, we'll see you tonight for the show.  Be safe ya crazy junglists.

Jackson (ODJ)

From sfraves-return-108254-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon Nov 17 17:26:23 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-108254-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 58120 invoked by uid 1103); 17 Nov 2003 17:26:22 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 58106 invoked from network); 17 Nov 2003 17:26:22 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [209.81.57.242]
X-Originating-Email: [fable4our@hotmail.com]
From: "_ fable _" <fable4our@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2003 09:26:20 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <Law11-F109zYgPugu3W0001342e@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Nov 2003 17:26:20.0962 (UTC) FILETIME=[EAB9D020:01C3AD2F]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves]Harvest Review!  

Well, my saturday started around 5pm when I woke up, so I was especially 
rested for the evening.  I ate a good meal, smoked some good smoke, slammed 
a redbull, picked up my homeboy and we was off to the map point for harvest. 
  It was interesting, cuz I had been to that map point before, except it led 
me to some party that was in this massive house behind grand lake theatre, 
but thats another story.

So we arrive to the spot and it was conviniently located a block away from a 
liquior store, so I picked up some hennessy and coke.  Walking up to the 
venue, it looked huge!  I was worried the door security would have a problem 
with my hennessy, but it was all good!  We walked down this looooong hallway 
until we heard the thumping subs, arriving at the front desk I saw OSBY!  
OMG HELLO 2DAY!!  He showed me his new piercing and his battle scars from 
surgery and introduced me to everyone else that was up front, I don't 
remember everyone's names except for Delia, she is tha bomb!  Everytime I 
saw her she had a fat grin on her face.  Osby was tellin everyone that I was 
a tight dancer, which made me blush and kinda worry, cuz I am by no means 
off tha hook...  I would like to say I have good rhythm and am able to get 
down for hours on end, but if you see me, I'll let yall be the judge!

So, I gave the Ferona Room a quick once over, the layout was awesome!  but I 
am more of a DnB/Breaks cat, so my review will be soley about the Kornwolf 
room.  We walked into the Kornwolf room and the first thing we saw werre 
like 16 subs stacked on top of eachother, I was lke...YEAH!!  The walls were 
lined with comfy couches and there was a huge spread of fruit and other 
delectable goodies.  Next to the Ferona room was the smoking area, that was 
a great idea, I never realized how smoky it got when peope just spark up 
everywhere, and the smoking room was close enough that it wasnt a pain to 
smoke when you needed to.  So when we arrived Phaedrus was nearing towards 
the end of his set, I was totally feelin his music though, especially the 
fact that he dropped this Kemal & Rob Data cut!  I have never heard them 
through subs that rowdy before, so it was AWESOME!  I definitley had to get 
down and dance a bit, but I started to slow down right when HAK got on, cuz 
I had to sip on my hennessy and get my buzz on, feel me?

So Hak was spinnin a propa set, I sat right next to the subs so  I could 
feel the fullest affection.  I had to get up a couple times to dance just 
cuz I was feelin the dnb down to my bones...yummy.  So, we had killed the 
hennessy and that just happened to be when Jauncy started his set.  I was 
totally feelin his breaks!  Damn..I wanna get some of the shit he was 
spinnin on wax!  It was the type of music that just made you wanna shake 
your ass or hold on tight to someone sexy!  GREAT SET!  I loved it!  Jauncy 
was totally gettn the room heated to, so good job!

I pretty much was a couch potato for Calamity Jane's set, but I did get my 
groove on a couple times.  And I remember dancing next to this female that 
was totally feelin the music, our hands bumped into eachother, and I regret 
now not dancing with her more, cuz I liked her rhythm, but sadly, a pint of 
hennessy isnt enough to get me riled up.  If there was more alcohol in me, I 
would have been dancin a whole lot more, but I loved them breaks, this party 
really made me want to go out and purchase some wax!

I also got to FINALLY meet Apollo!  He was really busy, trying to handle 
shit which is totally understandable, and I dont think he heard me thank him 
for throwing Harvest, so Apollo!  Thank you so much, it was great to finally 
meet you!!!

Anywayz, I totally forgot to meet up with Osby and have him show me the 
other SFraves cats...I was looking for Greg, but I didnt see him...(?)  
Anyway, this party was awesome, and I did learn one lesson: "Bring lots of 
alcohol to Apollo's parties!!!"

I could tell this party was amazing, I just didnt want to leave!  Many 
thanks to Apollo and the Moksha tribe for throwing an off tha hook party!!!

fable....

Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_9505838==.ALT"

Subject: [sfraves] Harvest:  Moksha Tribe Thanks You!!!

--=====================_9505838==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

On behalf of the Moksha Tribe collective, I offer our love, deepest respect 
and thanks to all of you who came out to share the dance floor with us on 
Saturday night at Harvest.

Major props to the Moksha crew, Viberation, and SWAT sound for putting so 
much DYI time, energy and muscle power into this production.  We all have 
very sore muscles today and I'm sure everyone could use one of those Ravin 
Riz massages right now:)

There is no party, however,  without our extended family -- you, our 
guests.  Those who came to this party were exemplars of those raver values 
of peace, love, unity and respect.  You all gave great vibe that night and 
made Harvest the success that it was.  Your generosity at Moksha parties 
must also be acknowledged here.  Today I cut a check for $600.00 to Larkin 
Street Youth Services, and we will be sending more donations when the 
accounts from Harvest are settled.

I experience much joy in throwing these parties as do the other Moksha 
Tribe members.  We all went into this a couple of years ago with the clear 
intention of bringing the best qualities of the rave underground into the 
present.  At each of our parties we ask our guests to write comments into a 
book so that we can understand if we are doing the right things.  Let me, 
therefore, share some moving thoughts from one of the Harvest dancers, 
called "Testimony of an ex-jaded Raver":

"Dear Moksha Tribe,

Let me say that after only ninety minutes at Harvest this experience was, 
without a doubt, the best event I have had the honor of experiencing in 
over 4 years of our culture.  The vibe of your, nay, our people was 
celestial.  I have never felt so proud of our culture in my life.  I do 
feel a sense of shame at the fact that I have neglected our importance for 
so long.  At first, I knew not the essence of our culture -- only a small 
albeit perverse taste --after all, such was the vibe of Oakland of years 
ago (Homebase, etc.).  After Harvest, however, I feel our culture has been 
justified.  The potential which each human being has was permuted into 
Heaven.  Moksha, my eternal thanks.  I look forward to the day when I can 
walk with you on the path to transcendence."

There are many other comments like this in our Guest Book.  Years ago it 
used to be the rule rather than the exception that folks would have 
life-transforming experiences at raves.  This was what the community was 
all about.  This is what Moksha is all about.  My own life was changed for 
the better when I came into raving.  It is our hope at Moksha that these 
parties bring magic, light and hope, through the ecstatic dynamic of music 
and dance, the union of sweat and spirit, body and soul, into the lives of 
our extraordinary community.

Amber, one of our house photographers, has posted some pics of both the set 
up and party 
here: 
<http://timeformetofly.com/photos/harvest111503/>http://timeformetofly.com/photos/harvest111503/

We also recorded all of the sets on digital video and we will try to share 
these in future.

Moksha is now planning our second anniversary party which is scheduled for 
early next year.

Again, our heartfelt thanks to those of you gave each other and the Moksha 
collective such a memorable evening!!!!

Much love and respect,

Apollo for Moksha Tribe


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"


U  
--=====================_9505838==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] Personal "Harvest" Thank-you to Moksha crew

To the dear members of the Moksha Tribe crew (all of you): I didn't sign the guest book at Harvest, so I just wanted to post a public message.

Thanks so much for the great time Saturday night. I know that you guys worked really hard to plan this party. It was a seamless effort from the guests perspective. 

I danced so hard that I had cramps the next day. Thats what I get for drinking and dancing! But I did appreciate the crew members who were distributing water to dehydrated dancers on the floor. Thats a true sign of caring.

The evening went by so fast that everything is a blur. I met so many people and saw familiar faces, too. Got a few CDs to boot, from Phaedrus and ShezTek! Thanks guys.

Ummm, about the music for the night: I think it was just sexy. Thats all I can say. I got the vibe in more ways than one. Give me some more! 

If you have any doubts about all of your hard work, shake them off, because I want to give all of you a shout-out for taking time out of your busy lives to make a community, for one night or for eternity.

Sincerely,
Greg VP

Subject: [sfraves] Clear & Present Danger (was Re: NRR: the matrix:revolutions)

	One film I can strongly recommend is "Clear And Present Danger." It's 
based on a Tom Clancy book and stars Harrison Ford. This is nothing as 
deep, imaginative, or ground-breaking as "The Matrix" -- it's not 
calling the masses to action or addressing deeper problems facing 
society, merely telling a story about how an honest, well-placed 
insider with good survival skills might prevail over cold, ruthless 
corruption reaching to the highest levels of the U.S. government. 
What's at stake is nothing as grand as the existence of the human race 
or civilization as we know it. But for an action thriller about power 
out of control (which is essentially what "The Matrix" is), CPD 
presents a chillingly plausible scenario with relatively little 
exaggeration.

							<<< Starchild >>>

MIME-Version: 1.0
Message-ID: <18DAEEB4.4ADB37C5.2B209970@aol.com>
X-Mailer: Atlas Mailer 2.0
X-AOL-IP: 67.127.184.9
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Film Premier this Friday! URGENT! Action needs to be taken! (nrr)

If you give a damn about this world or know someone who does, please read and come this Friday. Forests provide habitats for more than 80% of our country's wildlife species, and only 4% of the world's forests are left. 90% of these forests are parks. Upwards of 50,000 species are estimated to be driven to extinction each year due to this forest destruction. At this rate with other combined factors, humans are fueling the fastest mass extinction is history (up to 100-1000x more accelerated) that isn't too far off in the horizon. SCARY. In addition, we are at the mercy of corporations now more than ever and at a critical point in what will be history. Action needs to be taken now before it is too late.

Please come to help spread awareness of this growing epidemic and learn what you can do about it. If anything, this is an incredibly beautiful and well done film about something very close to home, and it gives you something NRR to do on a Friday night (but still time to do so if you choose!) . Details are below.

On Friday, November 21st, I will be hosting a world wide video premier of the re-edited documentary Tree Sit: The Art of Resistance in Olney Hall at the College of Marin Kentfield Campus (835 College Ave, Kentfield), in Marin County. The co-producer will be providing an introduction as well as Q&A session at the conclusion of the film, and other guest speakers are currently in the works. The event will start at 7:00PM and conclude at an estimated time of 10:00PM, with a ticket charge of a suggested $10.00. Any additional donations are gladly accepted! 
    
Please forward this letter to anyone you know who is conscious minded, an earth-lover, a tree-hugger, a concerned human being, a closet ecologist/biologist, an open-minded conservative, A CITIZEN OF THE PLANET EARTH etc., etc. This film should be introduced to people of all back-rounds to spread awareness of this growing epidemic, as action needs to be taken NOW before it is too late. A description of the film is below. 
    
If you would like to become a volunteer for the event, guest speaker, sponsor or contributor, please e-mail me at Alida@viberation.com or LittleEtoile@aol.com. All proceeds from this event will be donated to HAVC & Earth Films to aid in the continuation of their work and movement toward increased awareness and education. 
    

    This film is an epic saga of the destruction of North America's oldest temperate rainforests, told through the eyes of dedicated and courageous forest defenders who share their insights from their perches high in the trees. While on the ground, local residents, Native Americans, biologists, loggers, and government officials make their opinions known. These intimate and heartrending tales from the edge of the disappearing wilderness bear witness to a vast battle which rages over our entire planet!

Beautiful nature footage mixed with a powerful hypnotic soundtrack tie together
both the history of this modern struggle and the immediacy of one of today's
most pressing unresolved problems.

The now famous Julia Butterfly who lived for 2 years non-stop in an enormous
redwood, and numerous other tree-sitters, (less famous but equally courageous),
describe a new found spiritual and ecological wisdom that correspond with
indigenous beliefs that hold the Mother Earth as sacred. Wall St., corporations
and Government see it differently, as a commodity to be utilized through
exploitation.

Beyond the stereotypes of hippie tree-huggers vs. redneck loggers, this film
explores the dire ecological and real economic issues intertwined with the
ancient forests, from global warming to clean water to the WTO protests in
Seattle and the emerging anti-globalization movement.

TREE-SIT is comprised of short segments that include the assassination attempt
on Earth First! organizer Judi Bari, the campaign to save Headwaters Forest, the
United Steelworkers Union joining forces with environmentalists to challenge Big
Business, the near extinction of wild salmon, and the government corruption and
growing police state that undermines real democracy.  A scathing indictment of
"free market" economics that connects such diverse issues as political prisoners
in America (Leonard Peltier) with rural residents suffering from loss of
drinking water due to deforestation, flooding and herbicide spraying.  Features Woody Harrelson, Bonnie Raitt, Joan Baez and Mickey Hart of the Grateful Dead.

TREE-SIT reaches into times past and future, showing the historical continuity
of this very up-to-the-minute movement. A whirlwind ride, not to be missed!

For more info go to www.treesit.org


 "Truly inspiring"  -  Howard Zinn

" A rich history lesson ... stunning in it's cinematic effects"
                  - Kim Beaver, The Independent

*Winner of Earthvisions Film Festival award, "Best Forest Documentary". 

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  brandon @ breakhouse @ chi chi on thurs

ah, joyous thursdays!  it's almost the weekend, but then again not quite.  
but that's no excuse not to leave the comforts of home and get funky and 
drunky.

i'm spinning this thursday at the chi chi lounge! come check it out. no 
cover, nice venue, good sound system. come have a drink with me (or two, or 
three!) and get down to some tasty breaks and house.

your plan:  warm up at the thirsty bear with sticky and good beer.  then 
head due north until you see the bright lights and strip clubs and duck into 
the Chi Chi.  pay nothing at the door, use the money you just saved on 
drinks, shake your groove thing on the dancefloor!  afterwards, sober up at 
a nearby strip joint and then eat cheap, greasy chinese food at sun hong 
kong.  sound good?

Breakhouse Thursdays @
Chi-Chi Club
440 Broadway St.
(between Montgomery & Kearney)
Thursday, 11/20

9-9:45 Carolyn Holmes

9:45-10:30 Colin Duwe

10:30-11:15 Pete Calaway

11:15-12:00 DJ Bam (that's me!)

12:00-12:45 Bryan Bence

see you on the dancefloor!

http://www.invibe.com/bam

Download the new mix online!

Mime-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

no, it doesn't depend on how you view the word "slut"

words are arbitrary vocal symbols, but if we don't agree on the common 
meaning, there's no point; communication fails.  there is, in fact, no 
positive definition for slut, despite what Dossie Easton and Catherine 
Liszt seem to think.  It takes more than a couple feminists to change the 
language.


sarilion

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

You would have to follow that by 'nooch' or 'buuuung.'

I find this a lil interesting.

 Webster's 1913 Dictionary    Definition:
\Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
1. An untidy woman; a slattern.

         Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
                                               --Old Proverb.

2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]

         Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
         pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
         others.                               --Pepys.

3. A female dog; a bitch.

So basically this can take on a few things.  Bitch has become rathercommon
and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal intonations.Also,
a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself tidyand/or
guys treated her better than a servant.  So in essence, its guysthat make a
woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da
formatting)

Subject: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

Nathan,

	Same way you use any descriptive word in a non-derogatory way -- make 
it clear from your tone and the context that you mean it as a 
compliment or at least aren't implying anything negative.

	You can even go a step further by letting others know that a positive 
meaning is the only one you recognize. For instance, if somebody says 
"that guy is such a slut!" and it's obviously meant as a put-down, you 
can respond enthusiastically with something like, "Yeah, he's the 
bomb!"  8)

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

--0-1371549266-1069270852=:40887
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively flinching in an overly PC kinda way.  I agree with the statement that it all has to do with context.  For one, to me, the term doesn't really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but *psychologically*.  
 
I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society comes from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward sex- numbers don't mean anything.  

Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats what a slut is!  perhaps?

RaynDrahps <acydrayn@hotmail.com> wrote:
You would have to follow that by 'nooch' or 'buuuung.'

I find this a lil interesting.

Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:
\Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
1. An untidy woman; a slattern.

Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
--Old Proverb.

2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]

Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
others. --Pepys.

3. A female dog; a bitch.

So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become rathercommon
and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal intonations.Also,
a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself tidyand/or
guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat make a
woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da
formatting)

Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut


I dunno. I'll step out on a limb here and say a slut is still a slut.

There's nothing wrong with sex. It's quite possibly one of the most
beautiful acts human beings can engage in. Sex is a big defining factor of
what makes us human. That said, it can also be one of the most debased and
fucked up acts we can engage in. There's a difference between good sex,
where you feel excellent afterwards, and sex where you just feel like shit
afterwards.

I would consider a slut someone who doesn't know the difference. Probably
due to some kind of lack or internal rockiness, they get it whenever and
wherever they can, as often as they can. Bad sex just means you gotta have
more to fix the bad feeling. I'd liken it to a really pathological drug
addiction.

That said, people probably shouldn't talk shit about sluts, as it isn't
really their fault. We don't talk shit about people with other psychiatric
disorders.

S


On Wed, 19 Nov 2003, robby g wrote:

> interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively flinching in an overly PC kinda way.  I agree with the statement that it all has to do with context.  For one, to me, the term doesn't really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but *psychologically*.
>
> I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society comes from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward sex- numbers don't mean anything.
>
> Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats what a slut is!  perhaps?
>
> RaynDrahps <acydrayn@hotmail.com> wrote:
> You would have to follow that by 'nooch' or 'buuuung.'
>
> I find this a lil interesting.
>
> Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:
> \Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
> sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
> 1. An untidy woman; a slattern.
>
> Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
> --Old Proverb.
>
> 2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]
>
> Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
> pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
> others. --Pepys.
>
> 3. A female dog; a bitch.
>
> So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become rathercommon
> and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal intonations.Also,
> a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself tidyand/or
> guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat make a
> woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da
> formatting)

I use the term "slut" in a positive context personally. If I was thinking in 
terms of "a person who fucks random people with no discretion or care for 
one's self, safety, or respect", I would use the term "whore" (not to be 
confused with "prostitute", which is someone who earns money through sex).

Of course I'm weird. *shrug*

Those masterful images because complete
Grew in pure mind, but out of what began?
A mound of refuse or the sweepings of a street,
Old kettles, old bottles, and a broken can,
Old iron, old bones, old rages, that raving slut
Who keeps the till. Now that my ladder is gone,
I must lie down where all the ladders start,
In the foul rag-and-bone shop of the heart.

WB Yeats

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

guess maybe I wasn't that clear then... with the exception of "a slut is a slut" you reword the same basic thing I was saying, or trying to say!
 
the point we agree on is(I think)- its all about your state of mind and self respect. 

Sean Griffith <srg@pdx.edu> wrote:

I dunno. I'll step out on a limb here and say a slut is still a slut.

There's nothing wrong with sex. It's quite possibly one of the most
beautiful acts human beings can engage in. Sex is a big defining factor of
what makes us human. That said, it can also be one of the most debased and
fucked up acts we can engage in. There's a difference between good sex,
where you feel excellent afterwards, and sex where you just feel like shit
afterwards.

I would consider a slut someone who doesn't know the difference. Probably
due to some kind of lack or internal rockiness, they get it whenever and
wherever they can, as often as they can. Bad sex just means you gotta have
more to fix the bad feeling. I'd liken it to a really pathological drug
addiction.

That said, people probably shouldn't talk shit about sluts, as it isn't
really their fault. We don't talk shit about people with other psychiatric
disorders.

S


On Wed, 19 Nov 2003, robby g wrote:

> interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively flinching in an overly PC kinda way. I agree with the statement that it all has to do with context. For one, to me, the term doesn't really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but *psychologically*.
>
> I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society comes from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward sex- numbers don't mean anything.
>
> Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats what a slut is! perhaps?
>
> RaynDrahps wrote:
> You would have to follow that by 'nooch' or 'buuuung.'
>
> I find this a lil interesting.
>
> Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:
> \Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
> sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
> 1. An untidy woman; a slattern.
>
> Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
> --Old Proverb.
>
> 2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]
>
> Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
> pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
> others. --Pepys.
>
> 3. A female dog; a bitch.
>
> So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become rathercommon
> and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal intonations.Also,
> a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself tidyand/or
> guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat make a
> woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da
> formatting)

On Wed, 19 Nov 2003, robby g wrote:

> interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively flinching in an overly PC kinda way.  I agree with the statement that it all has to do with context.  For one, to me, the term doesn't really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but *psychologically*.
>
> I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society comes from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward sex- numbers don't mean anything.
>
> Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats what a slut is!  perhaps?
>
> RaynDrahps <acydrayn@hotmail.com> wrote:
> You would have to follow that by 'nooch' or 'buuuung.'
>
> I find this a lil interesting.
>
> Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:
> \Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
> sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
> 1. An untidy woman; a slattern.
>
> Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
> --Old Proverb.
>
> 2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]
>
> Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
> pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
> others. --Pepys.
>
> 3. A female dog; a bitch.
>
> So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become rathercommon
> and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal intonations.Also,
> a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself tidyand/or
> guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat make a
> woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da

*** Act NOW to protect medical marijuana patients, preserve the
     right of judges to show compassion for deserving defendants, and
     save taxpayer money

Now, just before Congress goes out of session, one of the country's 
harshest drug war extremists, Rep. Mark Souder (R-IN), is about to 
introduce some of the scariest legislation we've seen this year.

Rep. Souder's bill increases penalties for many drug offenses and takes 
away the right of judges to show mercy when it's appropriate. The bill also 
enacts new draconian penalties that could sentence compassionate Americans 
that grow and provide medical marijuana to decades in federal prison.

Although it's titled the 'Drug Sentencing Reform Act,' this dangerous bill 
is all sentencing and no reform. It will destroy the lives of thousands 
more non-violent Americans.

We know that Rep. Souder wants to introduce his bill within the next couple 
of weeks and is asking for co-sponsorship from other Representatives. Make 
sure your Representative doesn't support this bill. Call NOW and tell your 
Representative not to co-sponsor Rep. Souder's Drug Sentencing Reform Act 
because it contains no reform and ties the hands of judges.

Actions to Take:

1) CALL YOUR REPRESENTATIVE NOW!
To reach your representative by phone, call the US Capitol Switchboard at 
1-800-839-5276 or call your representative's office directly by looking up 
the phone number on http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=9389 .

Tell your Representative: "I'm a constituent and I'm calling to urge Rep. 
[Name] not to co-sponsor Rep. Souder's Drug Sentencing Reform Act, which he 
is about to introduce. The Drug Sentencing Reform Act contains no reform 
and ties the hands of judges. It will punish nonviolent Americans and 
compassionate citizens that provide patients with medical marijuana. I 
would like Rep. [Name] to tell me where s/he stands on this bill. S/he can 
send a letter to me at [Address] or an e-mail to [Address]. Thank you for 
your time."

2) Forward this alert to your friends, family, and co-workers.

More Information:

The so-called Drug Sentencing Reform Act has yet to be introduced, but it 
will do the following:

** Tie the hands of judges by making it harder for them to reduce sentences 
for non-violent drug offenders. (It does this by expanding the so-called 
'Feeney Amendment' to apply to drug offenses). This will mean longer 
sentences for non-violent offenses, with taxpayers like you picking up the 
cost!

** Mandates that most people on parole, probation or supervised release be 
subjected to random drug testing, even if their original offense had 
nothing to do with drugs. (If enacted, thousands of non-violent Americans 
could be sent to prison for years for smoking marijuana in the privacy of 
their own home and then failing a drug test.)

** Directs the U.S. Sentencing Commission to no longer allow lower 
sentences for non-violent drug offenders that have certain mitigating 
circumstances (such as being addicted to drugs) or for non-violent drug 
offenders that made a mistake and are otherwise good citizens.

** Enacts new draconian penalties for growing, distributing, and providing 
'high-potency' marijuana to others, including medical marijuana - which 
often has a higher potency to better relieve the suffering of AIDS, Cancer, 
and other patients. If enacted, this provision will allow the federal 
government to send more medical marijuana patients and their caregivers to 
federal prison for years, in some cases decades.

** Read Rep. Souder's explanation of his bill here: 
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=488&l=9390. Our analysis is 
based on Souder's explanation and our discussions with congressional staffers.




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net/harvest/

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"It is not the same to talk of the bulls as to be in the bullring."
-Spanish Proverb

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

	Hmm... As far as I'm aware, the term "whore" always refers to selling 
oneself, not one's degree of promiscuousness. I'll note that as someone 
in that line of work myself [we prefer to be called "escorts"; I'm 
personally fond of "courtesan" 8) ], I've observed that people in this 
profession tend to be *more* careful than other folks about issues of 
safety, respect, and personal boundaries when it comes to sex, not less.

	I don't think I've ever met *anyone*, male or female, who fucks people 
at *random*, any more than I've ever met anyone who eats food at 
random. Some people make choices about sex partners, quickly, easily, 
and frequently; this does not mean that the sex is necessarily bad, or 
that they are reckless, or that they lack self-respect. These negative 
stereotypes are generally perpetuated by those who are uncomfortable 
with sluts.

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>


On Wednesday, November 19, 2003, at 12:06  PM, Van Mundegaarde wrote:

> I use the term "slut" in a positive context personally. If I was 
> thinking in terms of "a person who fucks random people with no 
> discretion or care for one's self, safety, or respect", I would use 
> the term "whore" (not to be confused with "prostitute", which is 
> someone who earns money through sex).
>
> Of course I'm weird. *shrug*

>> interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively 
>> flinching in an overly PC kinda way.  I agree with the statement that 
>> it all has to do with context.  For one, to me, the term doesn't 
>> really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) 
>> has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but 
>> *psychologically*.
>>
>> I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society comes 
>> from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to 
>> those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that 
>> word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward 
>> sex- numbers don't mean anything.
>>
>> Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but 
>> if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate 
>> guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats 
>> what a slut is!  perhaps?

>> RaynDrahps <acydrayn@hotmail.com> wrote:

>>
>> I find this a lil interesting.
>>
>> Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:
>> \Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.
>> sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]
>> 1. An untidy woman; a slattern.
>>
>> Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.
>> --Old Proverb.
>>
>> 2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]
>>
>> Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and
>> pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the
>> others. --Pepys.
>>
>> 3. A female dog; a bitch.
>>
>> So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become 
>> rathercommon
>> and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal 
>> intonations.Also,
>> a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself 
>> tidyand/or
>> guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat 
>> make a
>> woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da
>> formatting)

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: "Slut topic" is NRR and is getting very, very old 

-------------------------------1069292315
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I agree that having a forum like SFR to talk about things back and forth is 
fun. However, people on SF Raves knock Bayraves a lot for being 
stupid/childish/whatever, so I spent some time reading the postings on Bayraves in order to 
compare. Yes, there is a lot of fluff and silly drama, and useless posts which 
say nothing but "Werd!". The difference? They actually talk about raves!  They 
talk about the past weekend's parties. They talk about how one person's 
hedonistic behavior can ruin a party, or even cause a venue to get shut down. 
Technical reasons make it easier to navigate through Bayraves. A lot of 
postings are frivolous, but you can scroll through them quickly, rather than having 
to open up each piece of mail as on SFR. 
Osby gives us great party reviews, and some of you others do, too. A lot  of 
the SFR postings are very much DJ-oriented, not raver-oriented, and that's 
fine. And I love the non-rave-related topics as long as they say NRR on them. 
Almost any topic can be interesting if it's not done to death. 

The "slut" topic has been done to death. Enough, already! Thank you. 
I was noticing that BayRaves has a long thread about which DJs are hot, but 
note ... many of the comments may be sily and immature, but at least they're 
talking about DJs and not some completely unrelated subject. 
Hugs to all of you, I just wish some of these NRR topics would die off a 
little quicker than they do.

-------------------------------1069292315--

Slut is a derogatory descriptive word.. so if I say "he's such a slut", and 
you retort "He's the bomb!" the meaning would be that you're glad he's a 
slut, or at least happy with it.  That doesn't make being a slut a good thing.


sarilion

>Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
>
>Nathan,
>
>         Same way you use any descriptive word in a non-derogatory way -- 
> make it clear from your tone and the context that you mean it as a 
> compliment or at least aren't implying anything negative.
>
>         You can even go a step further by letting others know that a 
> positive meaning is the only one you recognize. For instance, if somebody 
> says "that guy is such a slut!" and it's obviously meant as a put-down, 
> you can respond enthusiastically with something like, "Yeah, he's the 
> bomb!"  8)

> people at *random*, any more than I've ever met anyone who eats food at 
> random. Some people make choices about sex partners, quickly, easily, and

> they are reckless, or that they lack self-respect. These negative 
> stereotypes are generally perpetuated by those who are uncomfortable with 
> sluts.

There's some people I can introduce you to..  I've met people that both 
fuck randomly and eat randomly.  sorry you've missed out.  I agree that 
frequency doesn't directly relate to recklessness, lack of self--respect, 
or bad sex.. but that doesn't mean there aren't numerous other factors that 
do.  OF COURSE a sex worker is going to be careful - if you get sick, you 
can't work...

Subject: [sfraves] BSP - Cool, cheap infolines!


hello =] my name is kim.. some of you might know me, i'm a hyperreal
volunteer and have been subscribed to all the hyperreal lists at one point
or another because i like to travel. i'm a longtime music writer/website
admin/bedroom dj/gathering facilitator/dancesafe volunteer/music law
activist etc. blah blah blah.

i'm now working at a telcom, so i figured i'd torment all of you by
spamming you about infolines. i did put blatant self promotion in the
subject line in case that's still a filter.. i know it is on the northwest
raves list. anyway, here's the spam: the company i work for has really
cheap voicemail numbers that are great for infolines. they also take
faxes, which makes them cool for promoters because booking agents can fax
you over dj contracts, etc. there are local numbers in most area codes and
also toll free numbers. you can get custom numbers too, like
1-800-LUV-TKNO.
you can listen to the voicemail/view the faxes online and it can notify
you when you get one to an email address, cellphone text messaging
address, or pager. it also keeps a list of everyone who's ever called. if
you want more info on the specifics of this.. email me! :)

if you want to hear what it sounds like, i run a number called the seattle
techno infoline.. it lists all upcoming electronic music events here. it's
not specific to any one promoter or club, but it'd give you an idea
anyway.. 206.686.3151. :D

</ spam>. sorry. *spanks self* i know you hate me now. but you are free at
last! no more from me! it's over! it makes everything else seem much
better in comparison!

for anyone who made it this far, i also wanted to add two non-spam related
things:

1) if any of you use soulseek for file sharing and are into microhouse,
detroit techno, deep/tech house, idm, indie rock, hiphop, etc.. add
'groovinkim' to your list and trade with me!
2) if there's a damn good large-scale event coming up, i want to know
about it. in the past few years i've travelled to atlanta, chicago,
detroit,
barcelona, vancouver, berlin, amsterdam, paris, san francisco, etc. for
events and want an excuse to do so again. this year i may skip demf for
mutek but will definitely return to sonar.. (http://www.sonar.es - you
should go to this or die trying.) add somewhere else to my list! heh.

like you really care who this person is that's spamming you with this
massive email, but if you are curious, here are some of my sites:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/nw
http://www.nwtekno.org
http://www.seattletechno.com

i'm not always evil, just on wednesdays. ;)

kimberley d.

and his room is packed. Oh well. :)

Go Join SCR Jonny -- that list has some of the most interesting 
discussions I've ever seen. Even after moving to San Francisco I've 
kept reading my So-Cal Raves mail. But... they don't really seem to 
talk about raves much either -- then again -- I don't really care. Its 
not like I'm being forced to read about topics I'm not interested in. 
Jonny get rid of your AOL -- get a real ISP, run a real mail browser 
and stop complaining about people engaging in conversations that for 
whatever reason don't seem to interest you in particular.

Josh

On Wednesday, November 19, 2003, at 05:38 PM, JonnyR@aol.com wrote:

> I agree that having a forum like SFR to talk about things back and 
> forth is
> fun. However, people on SF Raves knock Bayraves a lot for being
> stupid/childish/whatever, so I spent some time reading the postings on 
> Bayraves in order to
> compare. Yes, there is a lot of fluff and silly drama, and useless 
> posts which
> say nothing but "Werd!". The difference? They actually talk about 
> raves!  They
> talk about the past weekend's parties. They talk about how one person's
> hedonistic behavior can ruin a party, or even cause a venue to get 
> shut down.
> Technical reasons make it easier to navigate through Bayraves. A lot of
> postings are frivolous, but you can scroll through them quickly, 
> rather than having
> to open up each piece of mail as on SFR.
> Osby gives us great party reviews, and some of you others do, too. A 
> lot  of
> the SFR postings are very much DJ-oriented, not raver-oriented, and 
> that's
> fine. And I love the non-rave-related topics as long as they say NRR 
> on them.
> Almost any topic can be interesting if it's not done to death.
>
> The "slut" topic has been done to death. Enough, already! Thank you.
> I was noticing that BayRaves has a long thread about which DJs are 
> hot, but
> note ... many of the comments may be sily and immature, but at least 
> they're
> talking about DJs and not some completely unrelated subject.
> Hugs to all of you, I just wish some of these NRR topics would die off 
> a
> little quicker than they do.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR Re: Re: On being a slut NRR

--0-1336722843-1069352445=:26164
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii


I think the popular common definition that comes to mind quickest is a girl who has sex a lot, with a lot of different people.  An easy lay.

 

A rather sexist term.  I have had a lot of sex with a lot of different people, but I am a guy, so I am a stud rather than a slut.  Its an old, tired, view of the world, but one which many people still have, if only in the back of their mind.  After all, its one that is driven into your subconscious by mass media all your life.

 

Taking a more thoughtful approach to the word, I would have to agree that the term tends to define the attitude that goes with the sex, not just the amount.  Slut implies one who has a low threshold or means of determining who they have sex with, not necessarily just quantity, but quality.

 

Personally, I dont think bad of sluts or sex or fucking the brains out of everyone you meet.  If you want to do that, cool.  

 

I DO think telling me what I can or cant do, and trying to limit my personal choices by using words conceived and used in a way to control me, well, is bullshit.  So go fuck yourself.  I will fuck who and what and how often I want.  And no one has the right to brand me anything.

 

Someone give me a letter S to wear.

 

 

** Original Message **

Date: Wed, 19 Nov 2003 17:06:09 -0800 

CC: robby_g@rocketmail.com, sfraves@hyperreal.org 

To: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> 

From: "Starchild" <sfdreamer@earthlink.net> 

Subject: Re: On being a slut 

 

               Hmm... As far as I'm aware, the term "whore" always refers to selling 

oneself, not one's degree of promiscuousness. I'll note that as someone 

in that line of work myself [we prefer to be called "escorts"; I'm 

personally fond of "courtesan" 8) ], I've observed that people in this 

profession tend to be *more* careful than other folks about issues of 

safety, respect, and personal boundaries when it comes to sex, not 

less.

 

               I don't think I've ever met *anyone*, male or female, who fucks people 

at *random*, any more than I've ever met anyone who eats food at 

random. Some people make choices about sex partners, quickly, easily, 

and frequently; this does not mean that the sex is necessarily bad, or 

that they are reckless, or that they lack self-respect. These negative 

stereotypes are generally perpetuated by those who are uncomfortable 

with sluts.

 

Groove on,

                                                                                                         <<< Starchild >>>

 

 

On Wednesday, November 19, 2003, at 12:06  PM, Van Mundegaarde wrote:

 

> I use the term "slut" in a positive context personally. If I was 

> thinking in terms of "a person who fucks random people with no 

> discretion or care for one's self, safety, or respect", I would use 

> the term "whore" (not to be confused with "prostitute", which is 

> someone who earns money through sex).

>

> Of course I'm weird. *shrug*

>

> M-

>> From: robby g <robby_g@rocketmail.com>

>> interesting thread- mostly because people aren't reflexively 

>> flinching in an overly PC kinda way.  I agree with the statement 

that 

>> it all has to do with context.  For one, to me, the term doesn't 

>> really have much to do with how much sex someone (male or female) 

>> has, but rather, how they have sex - and not physically but 

>> *psychologically*.

>>

>> I think the word slut is a loaded statement because our society 

comes 

>> from this puritanitcal, sexist background and people who cling to 

>> those kind of hang ups - those people will attach meaning to that 

>> word. IMO, if you've got self respect and a healthy attitude toward 

>> sex- numbers don't mean anything.

>>

>> Another way to put it is, you can have sex with very few people, but 

>> if you are completely self debasing and indulging in inappropriate 

>> guilt, shame and all kinds of fucked up thinking, then maybe thats 

>> what a slut is!  perhaps?

>> Webster's 1913 Dictionary Definition:

>> \Slut\, n. [OE. slutte; cf. OD. slodde a slut, Icel.

>> sl["o]ttr a heavy, loglike fellow, slota to droop.]

>> 1. An untidy woman; a slattern.

>>

>> Sluts are good enough to make a sloven's porridge.

>> --Old Proverb.

>>

>> 2. A servant girl; a drudge. [Obs.]

>>

>> Our little girl Susan is a most admirable slut, and

>> pleases us mightly, doing more service than both the

>> others. --Pepys.

>>

>> 3. A female dog; a bitch.

>>

>> So basically this can take on a few things. Bitch has become 

>> rathercommon

>> and can be taken with levity or disgust depending on vocal 

>> intonations.Also,

>> a girl wouldn't be a slut in the sexual sense if she kept herself 

>> tidyand/or

>> guys treated her better than a servant. So in essence, its guysthat 

>> make a

>> woman a slut by treating her like a servant....-Rayn (sorry about da

>> formatting)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

"I don't think I've ever met *anyone*, male or female, who fucks
>people at *random*, any more than I've ever met anyone who eats food at 
>random. Some people make choices about sex partners, quickly, easily, and 
>frequently; this does not mean that the sex is necessarily bad, or that 
>they are reckless, or that they lack self-respect. These negative 
>stereotypes are generally perpetuated by those who are uncomfortable with 
>sluts."

I find that incredibly hard to believe. Apparently you never went to a 
public high school, or American college where this sort of behaviour runs 
rampant.

I don't have a problem with people being what may be considered "loose" by 
most moral definitions, but I have a problem with people who are unsafe or 
not very selective in whom they choose to scrog. For instance, people who 
have no problem sleeping with people for their looks alone...I find that 
pretty disrespectful. Not to say looks aren't a huge part of who one might 
sleep with, but I personally feel it shouldn't be the only basis. I'm of the 
mind set, that if I couldn't have a conversation with the person I'm 
fucking, then I don't wanna be with them. If I couldn't be friends with the 
person, then I wouldn't bother. Of course, I'm not saying that means "no 
casual sex", because, a "friend with benefits" can be a great thing, and 
that's definately more on the casual side of things. But fucking for the 
sake of fucking is like using a person to masturbate with, and I'd rather 
use my hand if that's what it came down to. Of course, that's ME....I don't 
expect anyone else to buy into my personal philosophies....

M-

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves]nrr: DJs! 33 and 45 rpms?

Aight, I have scoured the net, asked several forums...and still, have come 
up with nothing.  Why is the industry standard for vinyl records 331/3 rpm 
and 45 rpm?  Here is an informative link:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/features/vinyl/

The only thing I can find in the above link is, 331/3 rpms was the same 
running speed as movies back in the day.

Is it simply, that is the speed that everyone agreed on?  What about 78s?  I 
do know 78 - 33 = 45.  Hopefully this thread will bring up some interesting 
discussions.

Peace

fable....

Subject: [sfraves] Re: On being a slut

	Let's examine what it would mean to truly fuck people at random. This 
would mean, walking down the street, that the person would be as likely 
to come onto an 80-year-old guy as a 20-year-old guy. And that's just 
for starters. Next you'd have to imagine no preferences for looks, 
disability status, gender, or personal hygiene.

	Have you ever met anyone of whom you think this is true? I haven't. So 
I think we can safely forget about the idea that anyone is truly random 
in his or her choice of sexual partners.

	The feeling that looks shouldn't count for everything, and that 
friendship, or at least the potential for it, should be in there 
somewhere, is a common perspective. And I can sympathize with this 
desire for all sex to be positive on all levels. In an ideal world, it 
would be.

	I'd similarly prefer all my consumer interactions to be positive on 
all levels. When I go shopping, I'd much rather give my money to 
someone with whom I could have a conversation, or be friends, than 
somebody I don't find very likable. But unfortunately I can't have 
solely positive consumer interactions without greatly diminishing my 
quality of life. If I find a really cool pair of shoes at a really 
great price, I'm not going to pass them up just because I can't imagine 
myself being friends with the person behind the counter. If I only 
bought goods or services from people I really like, a lot of my needs 
would go unmet. I have yet to find a bank I feel very good about, but 
I'm not willing to give up having a checking account.

	I feel the same way about sex. Sure I'd prefer that all my partners be 
nice people with whom I have something in common besides physical 
attraction. But if Pam Anderson came to my door begging to be fucked do 
you think I'd turn her away? Not a chance! Lots of people believe a 
willingness to sleep with someone just on the basis of physical desire 
cheapens sex. I disagree. You can still have sex with someone who 
resonates with you on many levels and you care a lot about some other 
time, and perhaps even enjoy it more than you would have without the 
other experience. A nutritious salad tends to taste even better if all 
you've eaten all day are chocolate eclairs. I'm not on a sexual diet, 
so why shouldn't I try to enjoy both?

Proud to be a slut,
						<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves]nrr: DJs! 33 and 45 rpms?

AFAIK it's just higher fidelity.

Vinyl and tape are essentially "digital" in the dense
that they have a sampling rate and a bit depth limited
by the physical charachteristics of the media itself.
A 45rpm record fits the same amount of information in
to a larger space than a 33rpm record. :)
