Trance- One of Arizona's favorites is finally making his way to =
California and the BAY! With weekly club appearances at City Limits and =
IBT's in AZ he has gained a huge following in the desert. Lets show him =
a warm welcome as he shows the bay what he's made of get ready to =
dance!**First California Appearance! and cd release party entitled =
'Winter 2003'**=20

Subject: RE: [sfraves] nrr: Mystery Skin Disease in Daly City

Heya, 

Yeah mann, thanks for your info. . .like you know that saying uhh,
whatchamacallit, like "ignorance is bliss". ..  
Really, if most people knew even a lil about disorders like that (which
are more or less unknown and kept quiet) they would go thru every day of
their life feeling they were nuts cuz they had to "sanitize" everything
in their home, clean door handles before they open them, like what most
people would consider to be "paranoid" behaviors.  Like I had an
instructor once who used tissues to open doors, people weren't supposed
to go within 5 feet of em if they sneezed. . . that was kind of odd. .
.but he probably just knew some things we didn't know.

Shit gets pretty crazy if you actually do research on it. From like
bacteria everywhere to invisible insects that morph shape and mimic
human characteristics. . .

I first became interested in stuff like that from doing a lot of
research on gardening. . .like pest and disease control. Like with
indoor stuff, you have to be very very careful about contaminating other
gardens, or plants, or transferring bacteria here or there. . . the
stuff that gets on plants came from outside .. . yknow, like we're
outside. . . 

: )

aK
-----Original Message-----
From: s d [mailto:suchagoodkid@yahoo.com] 
Sent: Monday, November 24, 2003 12:35 PM
To: aK_; sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: Mystery Skin Disease in Daly City

there has been a similar health epidemic in san
francisco, for a year or so.  the health dept knows
about it, it has been linked to poor hygiene, weak
immune systems, drug use, malnutrition, and similar
conditions.
it's an abscess of staph infection in most cases, is
extremely painful, and can be very dangerous depending
on location of infection and time left untreated.  it
is similar to flesh eating bacteria.  they keep
sweeping it under the rug because they assume its the
poor and the drug users.  that's often not the case.
it has been through the gay community, the dance
community, drug community, low income, ....
doctors don't know what to do with it, except
prescribe a massive dose of super antibiotics, blaming
the abscesses on 'highly evolved strains of staph'. 
most often it's misdiagnosed or left untreated at
first, because doctors can't narrow down the exact
cause.  the center for disease control is monitoring
it closely, but can't pin it down. many cases were 
supposedly related to meth use, putting 'dirty' street
drugs into an already weakened system from drug use.
everyone carries staph in and on them, but it is
opportunistic to weak systems, and more mutated
strains can be passed on by shared drug paraphenalia
and/or physical contact.
thanks for posting that info, people need to be aware
of what's out there...


--- aK_ <aK@Hard-grooves.com> wrote:
> I just came across this. . .
> 
> It so sucks to be sick with something that
> absolutely no one knows about
> or believes. Thus no research, no remedies, no

> to look forward to is for somehow something happens
> that makes you
> better, even tho that was basically all on you. . .
> cuz dumbass doctors
> are so closed minded. They're pretty strong people
> to deal with all the
> various issues surrounding something like that. Like
> the way they feel
> about themselves, the way others look at them, not
> to mention the pain,
> discomfort, etc they constantly deal with.
> 
>             Hopefully the news article will bring
> some attention to it.

> 
> Take care all

> aK
> 
>  
> 
> "Mystery Skin Disease in Daly City"
>  
> 
> 
>   
> 
> Westlake residents complain of mystery disease 
> 
> By Kate Williamson
> Of The Examiner Staff
> kwilliamson@examiner.com
> Published on Monday, November 17, 2003 
> 
> DALY CITY -- Some residents of Westlake Village
> Apartments have
> complained to the county that they have a mysterious
> skin infection, but
> feel they are left on their own in coping with the
> outbreak. 
> Following the notification to the San Mateo County
> Health Services
> Agency, county officials recently ordered the
> complex to seal up holes
> that may allow rodents into the units. But it is
> unclear if that will
> combat the infection, or even if the mice and rats
> are responsible. 
> Residents of four apartments at 205 Palmcrest Drive
> interviewed for this
> article feared to be named, suspecting reprisal.
> They reported -- and in
> some cases, showed -- an ongoing skin condition. 
> Primarily non-English speakers, the residents said
> their landlord and
> officials have cast them adrift. 
> "This thing started in December of last year," said
> one father of two
> young girls, all of whom have been infected. 
> Under his armpit, he displayed a wound near a rash,
> the afterimage of a
> golf-ball-size boil that was cut open and drained of
> liquid at an
> emergency room Nov. 9. 
> The boils start out smaller, as spots that resemble
> bug bites at the
> center of a pale, discolored ring, he said. His two
> young daughters and
> his wife both had the marks Nov. 11. Those bites
> grow until they are
> filled with pus and the victim develops a fever, he
> said. He has had to
> stay home from work with the illness, making it
> difficult for him to
> work enough to afford the family's rent. 
> Cutting the boils open is the only thing that cures
> them, he said. He
> was told he developed a bacterial infection because
> he is a hairy man,
> but he does not know how his smooth-skinned girls
> could also have the
> problem, he said 
> "I passed every test. I don't have nothing," he
> said. 
> Research on several medical Web sites revealed that
> the symptoms are
> similar to furuncles, or boils, caused by bacteria
> or fungal infection
> and can be linked to diabetes. 
> Residents in two other apartments also told The
> Examiner they had
> contracted the infection. 
> The San Mateo County Health Services Agency was
> alerted to the infection
> at the complex in October, said agency
> representative Beverly Thames. 
> The nurses spoke with a doctor who treated one of
> the residents and
> determined the infection was not a "reportable"
> communicable disease. 
> "I would love it if one of the docs would evaluate
> them and, if they
> feel there's a significant problem, do a culture,"
> said county public
> health doctor Sam Stebbins. "We need that
> information from the
> practitioners." 
> Stebbins recommended that anyone afflicted with the
> boils come to the
> North County Health Center in Daly City. Emergency
> rooms tend to be
> harried, Stebbins said. He added that contagious
> bacterial infections
> are rare, relying as they do on skin-to-skin
> contact. 
> "We haven't closed the book on it," he said. 
> Some residents fear their infection is related to
> the ongoing rodent
> problem in the building, saying they did not have
> the disease before a
> particularly bad mouse infestation earlier this
> year. 
> The county environmental health division inspected
> the property Oct. 23.
> They found one dead rat mite and a live one in two
> apartments, but they
> are not likely to be connected to the illness. 
> The residents' symptoms are inconsistent with mite
> or fleabites, said
> Environmental Services Director Dean Peterson. 
> "Rarely is a bite going to cause a bacterial
> infection unless you
> scratch it and open it," he said. 
> "The only time anything was done was when the health
> department came and
> the building inspector came," said one woman. 
> A Westlake representative did not return calls by
> press time. 
> With nobody taking responsibility to coordinate
> tackling the infection,
> residents remain frustrated. 
> "We are looking for somebody to help us," said the
> man with the cut
> beneath his arm. 
> 
> bvh
> 
>

Tribal Funk: 10 Year Family Reunion

The original creators of Tribal Funk, Swell & Bigfloor invite you to join us for a very special old school family reunion. The ensemble of DJs featured for this party are sure to keep the dance floor rockin' from start to finish! 

With DJs/Guests Terry Mullan, Mark Farina, Jeno, Garth, Tony, David Coleman & Sen-Sei, DJ Pat 
Music Type: House/Techno 

This party will also feature the Bay Area club debut of the next generation in concert lighting: The Catalyst 3 Media System (thanks to Lumatech Lighting). Plus, Mezzanine's "Funktion One" sound system is truly outstanding. This promises to be a memorable evening for all - don't miss it! 

time: 9 pm - 7 am
admission: $20 cover, 21+ only 
information: www.swellhouse.com/tribalfunk

has been re-launched as one of the most progressive
and diversified spaces for art, culture and
entertainment on the West Coast. We use the walls of
our dramatically redesigned interior to introduce San
Francisco to both well established and up-and-coming
artists. We also offer an ever-evolving menu of
seasonal dishes and temptations, along with an equally
tempting selection of wine, beer, sake, and espresso
drinks."

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Kill your kittens

Reading it...

  "Infected men, suggests one new study, tend to become more aggressive,
  scruffy, antisocial and are less attractive. Women, on the other hand,
  appear to exhibit the "sex kitten" effect, becoming less trustworthy,
  more desirable, fun- loving and possibly more promiscuous. 
  
  Interestingly, for those who draw glib conclusions about national
  stereotypes, the number of people infected in France is much higher than
  in the UK."

Huh. Makes one wonder about that mind/body thing, eh?

Sean


On Fri, Nov 28, 2003 at 04:15:29PM -0800, Sean Griffith wrote:
> http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,8122-826557,00.html
> 
> Apparently cats are host to some kind of strange and terrible
> toxoplasmosis parasite that takes up residence in your brain, and affects
> your personality/inhibitions in some pretty serious ways. In rats, it
> dulls their natural aversion to cats.
> 
> Squish your kitties!=)

From: s d <suchagoodkid@yahoo.com>

Subject: RE: [sfraves] nrr: Mystery Skin Disease in Daly City

little bugs.  yep, pretty much. we all carry staph,
for example, but unless our immune systems are low,
they don't really affect us much.
most often, drug use (especially meth) lowers our
immune system on the most basic obvious level-- lack
of sleep, malnutrition, and dehydration.  the
opportunistic little buggers then attack, causing
infections.  
so remember kids, if yer gonna do drugs-  make sure
you eat and drink lots, take yer vities, and get
plenty of rest.  balance yer toxins.
oh, and read "Parasite Rex."  great book.

love,
dr. moreau

> go thru every day of
> their life feeling they were nuts cuz they had to

> in their home, clean door handles before they open

> people would consider to be "paranoid" behaviors.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: s d [mailto:suchagoodkid@yahoo.com] 
> Sent: Monday, November 24, 2003 12:35 PM
> To: aK_; sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: Mystery Skin Disease in
> Daly City
> 
> there has been a similar health epidemic in san
> francisco, for a year or so.  the health dept knows
> about it, it has been linked to poor hygiene, weak
> immune systems, drug use, malnutrition, and similar
> conditions.
> it's an abscess of staph infection in most cases, is
> extremely painful, and can be very dangerous
> depending
> on location of infection and time left untreated. 
> it
> is similar to flesh eating bacteria.  they keep
> sweeping it under the rug because they assume its
> the
> poor and the drug users.  that's often not the case.
> it has been through the gay community, the dance
> community, drug community, low income, ....
> doctors don't know what to do with it, except
> prescribe a massive dose of super antibiotics,
> blaming
> the abscesses on 'highly evolved strains of staph'. 
> most often it's misdiagnosed or left untreated at
> first, because doctors can't narrow down the exact
> cause.  the center for disease control is monitoring
> it closely, but can't pin it down. many cases were 
> supposedly related to meth use, putting 'dirty'
> street
> drugs into an already weakened system from drug use.
> everyone carries staph in and on them, but it is
> opportunistic to weak systems, and more mutated
> strains can be passed on by shared drug paraphenalia
> and/or physical contact.
> thanks for posting that info, people need to be
> aware
> of what's out there...
> 
>

> > "Mystery Skin Disease in Daly City"
> >  
> > 
> > 
> >   
> > 
> > Westlake residents complain of mystery disease 
> > 
> > By Kate Williamson
> > Of The Examiner Staff
> > kwilliamson@examiner.com
> > Published on Monday, November 17, 2003 
> > 
> > DALY CITY -- Some residents of Westlake Village
> > Apartments have
> > complained to the county that they have a
> mysterious
> > skin infection, but
> > feel they are left on their own in coping with the
> > outbreak. 
> > Following the notification to the San Mateo County
> > Health Services
> > Agency, county officials recently ordered the
> > complex to seal up holes
> > that may allow rodents into the units. But it is
> > unclear if that will
> > combat the infection, or even if the mice and rats
> > are responsible. 
> > Residents of four apartments at 205 Palmcrest
> Drive
> > interviewed for this
> > article feared to be named, suspecting reprisal.
> > They reported -- and in
> > some cases, showed -- an ongoing skin condition. 
> > Primarily non-English speakers, the residents said
> > their landlord and
> > officials have cast them adrift. 
> > "This thing started in December of last year,"
> said
> > one father of two
> > young girls, all of whom have been infected. 
> > Under his armpit, he displayed a wound near a
> rash,
> > the afterimage of a
> > golf-ball-size boil that was cut open and drained
> of
> > liquid at an
> > emergency room Nov. 9. 
> > The boils start out smaller, as spots that
> resemble
> > bug bites at the
> > center of a pale, discolored ring, he said. His
> two
> > young daughters and
> > his wife both had the marks Nov. 11. Those bites
> > grow until they are
> > filled with pus and the victim develops a fever,
> he
> > said. He has had to
> > stay home from work with the illness, making it
> > difficult for him to
> > work enough to afford the family's rent. 
> > Cutting the boils open is the only thing that
> cures
> > them, he said. He
> > was told he developed a bacterial infection
> because
> > he is a hairy man,
> > but he does not know how his smooth-skinned girls
> > could also have the
> > problem, he said 
> > "I passed every test. I don't have nothing," he
> > said. 
> > Research on several medical Web sites revealed
> that
> > the symptoms are
> > similar to furuncles, or boils, caused by bacteria
> > or fungal infection
> > and can be linked to diabetes. 
> > Residents in two other apartments also told The
> > Examiner they had
> > contracted the infection. 
> > The San Mateo County Health Services Agency was
> > alerted to the infection
> > at the complex in October, said agency
> > representative Beverly Thames. 
> > The nurses spoke with a doctor who treated one of
> > the residents and
> > determined the infection was not a "reportable"
> > communicable disease. 
> > "I would love it if one of the docs would evaluate
> > them and, if they
> > feel there's a significant problem, do a culture,"
> > said county public
> > health doctor Sam Stebbins. "We need that
> > information from the
> > practitioners." 
> > Stebbins recommended that anyone afflicted with
> the
> > boils come to the
> > North County Health Center in Daly City. Emergency
> > rooms tend to be
> > harried, Stebbins said. He added that contagious
> > bacterial infections
> > are rare, relying as they do on skin-to-skin
> > contact. 
> > "We haven't closed the book on it," he said. 
> > Some residents fear their infection is related to
> > the ongoing rodent
> > problem in the building, saying they did not have
> > the disease before a
> > particularly bad mouse infestation earlier this
> > year. 
> > The county environmental health division inspected
> > the property Oct. 23.
> > They found one dead rat mite and a live one in two
> > apartments, but they
> > are not likely to be connected to the illness. 
> > The residents' symptoms are inconsistent with mite
> > or fleabites, said
> > Environmental Services Director Dean Peterson. 
> > "Rarely is a bite going to cause a bacterial
> > infection unless you
> > scratch it and open it," he said. 
> > "The only time anything was done was when the
> health
> > department came and
> > the building inspector came," said one woman. 
> > A Westlake representative did not return calls by
> > press time. 
> > With nobody taking responsibility to coordinate
> > tackling the infection,
> > residents remain frustrated. 
> > "We are looking for somebody to help us," said the
> > man with the cut
> > beneath his arm. 
> > 
> > bvh

> > > Cutting the boils open is the only thing that
> > cures
> > > them, he said. He
> > > was told he developed a bacterial infection
> > because
> > > he is a hairy man,
> > > but he does not know how his smooth-skinned
> girls
> > > could also have the
> > > problem, he said 
> > > "I passed every test. I don't have nothing," he
> > > said. 
> > > Research on several medical Web sites revealed
> > that
> > > the symptoms are
> > > similar to furuncles, or boils, caused by
> bacteria
> > > or fungal infection
> > > and can be linked to diabetes. 
> > > Residents in two other apartments also told The
> > > Examiner they had
> > > contracted the infection. 
> > > The San Mateo County Health Services Agency was
> > > alerted to the infection
> > > at the complex in October, said agency
> > > representative Beverly Thames. 
> > > The nurses spoke with a doctor who treated one
> of
> > > the residents and
> > > determined the infection was not a "reportable"
> > > communicable disease. 
> > > "I would love it if one of the docs would
> evaluate
> > > them and, if they
> > > feel there's a significant problem, do a
> culture,"
> > > said county public
> > > health doctor Sam Stebbins. "We need that
> > > information from the
> > > practitioners." 
> > > Stebbins recommended that anyone afflicted with
> > the
> > > boils come to the
> > > North County Health Center in Daly City.
> Emergency
> > > rooms tend to be
> > > harried, Stebbins said. He added that contagious
> > > bacterial infections
> > > are rare, relying as they do on skin-to-skin
> > > contact. 
> > > "We haven't closed the book on it," he said. 
> > > Some residents fear their infection is related
> to
> > > the ongoing rodent
> > > problem in the building, saying they did not
> have
> > > the disease before a
> > > particularly bad mouse infestation earlier this
> > > year. 
> > > The county environmental health division
> inspected
> > > the property Oct. 23.
> > > They found one dead rat mite and a live one in
> two
> > > apartments, but they
> > > are not likely to be connected to the illness. 
> > > The residents' symptoms are inconsistent with
> mite
> > > or fleabites, said
> > > Environmental Services Director Dean Peterson. 
> > > "Rarely is a bite going to cause a bacterial
> > > infection unless you
> > > scratch it and open it," he said. 
> > > "The only time anything was done was when the
> > health
> > > department came and
> > > the building inspector came," said one woman. 
> > > A Westlake representative did not return calls
> by
> > > press time. 
> > > With nobody taking responsibility to coordinate
> > > tackling the infection,
> > > residents remain frustrated. 
> > > "We are looking for somebody to help us," said
> the
> > > man with the cut
> > > beneath his arm. 
> > >

Subject: [sfraves] PS2 : MANHUNT!

i just got this game today... and calling it game is a stretch. it's more of 
a murder simulation.
this is absolutely the most sickest, twisted, nc-17 game i ever played. 
think of that old ahhnold movie the running man. it's sorta like that. your 
placed in a broken down city with a bunch of thugs (sorta like the gangs in 
the 'warrior's) out to get you, but you need to get them first. however, 
there is an unknown person watching you through hidden camera's all over the 
place; taunting you, telling you what to do, either helping you out, or 
fucking with your mind, but pulling the strings.
the graphics are gorgeous, the music is brilliant. soundscape all the way. 
john carpenter would be proud of the sounds in this one.
the killings are just over the top. not bloody but waaay twisted. one of the 
first ones i did was with a plastic bag. the game is based more on stealth 
and agility rather than guns a blazin. i crept up behind a gang member a put 
the bag over his head and just twisted it sooo tight that he died from 
asphxiation.
all sorts of ways to kill people. broken bottles, glass shards, shanks, 
guns... it's really brutal! the whole atmosphere of this game is really 
fucked. it's over the top in so many ways and im sure its going to be all 
over the news here shortly.
this is not a game for kids in all honesty. i don't think a lot of people 
would even like it. it's made by rockstar, and the same team that did both 
of the 'grand theft auto'. it has that 'qualitly' and appeal that GTA has, 
save this is just over the top darkness, with a wicked plot line. being told 
what to do, watching yourself over closed circut tv, and the 'persons' voice 
taunting you....... wicked...
i would recomend renting it and seeing if you like it. it's really different 
for a game. its total murderation.
it's not fun as one would think games are fun. it's really this mind 
bending, self reflecting sort of situation of a twisted plot. very deep 
philisophical tones. it's interesting cause it really is the first time that 
i really feel like i'm actaully killing, and it does have you thinking about 
how just brutal it really is. you have to be really good to make a kill. no 
button mashing at all. stealth like metalgearsolid, huge enviroments, and 
wicked gangs straight fromt he 'warriors'. 'cooomeee out and plaaaayyaaaay'
it's 'american psycho' for the PS2....
very interesting....

hakthedj

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  The Horror has Begun....

--=====================_1228846==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Woman Knocked Unconscious While Shopping
Sat Nov 29,10:27 AM ET

ORANGE CITY, Fla. - A mob of shoppers rushing for a sale on DVD players 
trampled the first woman in line and knocked her unconscious as they 
scrambled for the shelves at a Wal-Mart Supercenter.

Patricia VanLester had her eye on a $29 DVD player, but when the siren 
blared at 6 a.m. Friday announcing the start to the post-Thanksgiving sale, 
the 41-year-old was knocked to the ground by the frenzy of shoppers behind 
her.

"She got pushed down, and they walked over her like a herd of elephants," 
said VanLester's sister, Linda Ellzey. "I told them, `Stop stepping on my 
sister! She's on the ground!'"

Ellzey said some shoppers tried to help VanLester, and one employee helped 
Ellzey reach her sister, but most people just continued their rush for deals.

"All they cared about was a stupid DVD player," she said Saturday.

Paramedics called to the store found VanLester unconscious on top of a DVD 
player, surrounded by shoppers seemingly oblivious to her, said Mark 
O'Keefe, a spokesman for EVAC Ambulance.

She was flown to Halifax Medical Center in Daytona Beach, where doctors 
told the family VanLester had a seizure after she was knocked down and 
would likely remain hospitalized through the weekend, Ellzey said. Hospital 
officials said Saturday they did not have any information on her condition.

"She's all black and blue," Ellzey said. "Patty doesn't remember anything. 
She still can't believe it all happened."

Ellzey said Wal-Mart officials called later Friday to ask about her sister, 
and the store apologized and offered to put a DVD player on hold for her.

Wal-Mart Stores spokeswoman Karen Burk said she had never heard of a such a 
melee during a sale.

"We are very disappointed this happened," Burk said. "We want her to come 
back as a shopper."



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

On the ride to critical mass last night I was OVERWHELMED by the number
of shoppers out and about.  I guess the word about Buy Nothing Day isn't
spreading very far or wide.  I wanted to yell to everyone to consider
simply spending some QUALITY time with their family and friends on
christmas rather than wasting on consumerism.  Another thought is to
spend that energy on the wares of local artists and craft people.
There's so many of them around that can use a bit of support.  (Speaking
of which, I've got a friend with some FABULOUS hat designs if anyone's
interested.  Mostly faux fur, but plenty of others.  Drop me a line and
I'll make the connection.)

On Sat, 29 Nov 2003, Apollo wrote:

> Woman Knocked Unconscious While Shopping
> Sat Nov 29,10:27 AM ET
>
> ORANGE CITY, Fla. - A mob of shoppers rushing for a sale on DVD players
> trampled the first woman in line and knocked her unconscious as they
> scrambled for the shelves at a Wal-Mart Supercenter.
>
> Patricia VanLester had her eye on a $29 DVD player, but when the siren
> blared at 6 a.m. Friday announcing the start to the post-Thanksgiving sale,
> the 41-year-old was knocked to the ground by the frenzy of shoppers behind
> her.
>
> "She got pushed down, and they walked over her like a herd of elephants,"
> said VanLester's sister, Linda Ellzey. "I told them, `Stop stepping on my
> sister! She's on the ground!'"
>
> Ellzey said some shoppers tried to help VanLester, and one employee helped
> Ellzey reach her sister, but most people just continued their rush for deals.
>
> "All they cared about was a stupid DVD player," she said Saturday.
>
> Paramedics called to the store found VanLester unconscious on top of a DVD
> player, surrounded by shoppers seemingly oblivious to her, said Mark
> O'Keefe, a spokesman for EVAC Ambulance.
>
> She was flown to Halifax Medical Center in Daytona Beach, where doctors
> told the family VanLester had a seizure after she was knocked down and
> would likely remain hospitalized through the weekend, Ellzey said. Hospital
> officials said Saturday they did not have any information on her condition.
>
> "She's all black and blue," Ellzey said. "Patty doesn't remember anything.
> She still can't believe it all happened."
>
> Ellzey said Wal-Mart officials called later Friday to ask about her sister,
> and the store apologized and offered to put a DVD player on hold for her.
>
> Wal-Mart Stores spokeswoman Karen Burk said she had never heard of a such a
> melee during a sale.
>
> "We are very disappointed this happened," Burk said. "We want her to come
> back as a shopper."
>
>

--0-1575294191-1070149067=:42047
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Whats up peoples. I just wanted to let everyone know about a brand new bi-weekly party called "Sanctuary" for the 21 plus starting on Saturday December 6th at Waves Smokehouse & Saloon @ 65 Post Street in downtown San Jose. 

"Sanctuary" is all about house music. From the funky, techy, and acidy flavors in the main room to the deeper soulfull flavors upstairs on the patio. We are focusing on local talent and will be bringing out all your favorite house head dj's as well as giving some up and comers who have the skills to pay the bills a chance to show what they can do behind the decks. 

Our goal is to bring some REAL house music back to San Jose and bring people together to share in the beautifull vibe we call house. We are looking forward to getting this party started right and seeing some of you out on the dancefloor. So please spread the word............ and know that we appreciate your support. 


Line up for Saturday December 6th: 


Special Guest Dj:      Justin Hale (Secret Society, Sticky, Moksha Tribe) 


Plus Main Room Residents:      Kevin James & John Bailey 

& 

Upstairs Patio Resident :            Greg Steichen 





Line up for Saturday December 27th: 

Special Guest Dj:               Homero "Huey" Espinoza (Yerba Buena Discos, Detour Recordings) 


Plus Main Room Residents:              Kevin James & John Bailey 

& 

Upstairs  Patio Residents:                         Greg Steichen & Isaac Haze 




Doors open at 9:30 and its free before 10:00. Absolutley no dress code...... we want you comfortable so you can dance your *ss off. 21 plus ID required. 



Kevin James 








Sanctuary Saturdays 
2nd and 4th Saturday Every Month 
Grand Opening Party Saturday December 6th 
Located @ Waves 65 Post St. San Jose

Subject: [sfraves] Subduction tonight @ Canvas - $free!

Saturday November 29, 2003 
Faultline Productions and Camuflaje present

"Subduction"

NO COVER
9pm - 2am
All ages welcome, 21+ to drink
Visit http://faultlinednb.com for mailing list

Drum 'n Bass, Broken Beat and Downtempo with DJs:

TIDAL [Cov.Ops, Advection, System Check Radio - UK]
DJ M [Faultline, Freebeats, Tenderloft]
YAP [Freebeats, Tenderloft]
FIFE [Faultline, InnerspaceResearchGroup]
NEMO [Faultline, # In Time]

The Canvas Gallery
http://www.thecanvasgallery.com
1200 9th Ave & Lincoln in the Inner Sunset
Neighborhood, San Francisco
Across the street from the Golden Gate park near
Japanese & Botanical Gardens.

Drive: Free parking in the back!
MUNI: N-Judah to 9th Ave

After the incredible stress of sitting around stuffing
your face at Thanksgiving, come and unwind with us
tonight at "Subduction"! Co-produced by Faultline and
Camuflaje this free, all-ages event is our first at
the beautiful Canvas Gallery and will feature DJs
spinning rare Drum 'n Bass, Broken Beat and Downtempo.
Don't miss the American debut of our cohort Tidal, a
rising D&B producer/DJ from England who will be
joining us on the decks.

"Nestled in the hub of the Inner-Sunset, the Canvas
has been re-launched as one of the most progressive
and diversified spaces for art, culture and
entertainment on the West Coast. We use the walls of
our dramatically redesigned interior to introduce San
Francisco to both well established and up-and-coming
artists. We also offer an ever-evolving menu of
seasonal dishes and temptations, along with an equally
tempting selection of wine, beer, sake, and espresso
drinks."  (http://www.thecanvasgallery.com)

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Please consider signing gay marriage petition

Hi all-

So I don't post too often, and never on politial issues, but I'm hoping some 
of you will consider signing the million gay marriage petition.  The rave 
scene has always historically been about accepting everyone, peace, live and 
let live... everything that the right wing conservatives, well, aren't.

The religious right is trying to amend the constitution of the United States 
to make gay marriage "or the legal incidents thereof" illegal forever...

Most people don't care so much about the word "marriage," but the "legal 
incidents thereof" part will erase civil unions, domestic partnerships - 
things like hospital visitation rights, adoption, owning property, joint 
health care... the saddest thing about about it is that all the gay and 
lesbian families and their kids will have no legal protections whatsoever, 
and even progressive states like California will be legally unable to 
provide them with any.

Also, note the difference between civil marriage (and civil unions, domestic 
partnerships, etc.) and religious marriage... no religious organizations are 
forced to perform same sex unions if they don't want to, and never would be 
- this is NOT a push for religious marriage, but rather to keep basic civil 
rights, like adopting your partners kids, visiting your partner in the 
hospital, buying a house together, etc.

http://www.hrc.org/millionformarriage/index.shtml

Thats the link, and thanks for your time-
B

https://broadband.msn.com (Prices may vary by service area.)

Subject: [sfraves] wal(satan)mart xmas shopper ignored/trampled by crowd suffered seizure

http://www.local6.com/news/2670095/detail.html

this is truly disgusting behavior. being trampled by hundreds of people 
trying to get sales on black friday, knocked down and having people step all 
over you causing head trauma/seizures.... and nobody stops to help...

this is one time i TRULY hope this family sues the bejezuz out of 
satan*wal*mart. holding sales that last from 6am till 9am with hundreds of 
eager shoppers waiting since 3am is just pure negligence on satan*wal*mart's 
part. i forget the website, but if it's still around since satanmart has the 
high paid lawyers going after any negative. basically it has all these 
stories from ex-employee's/customers about the absolute horror of an 
establishment satan*mart is.
boycott satan*mart and all it's truly evil anti-competitive practices and 
it's raping and piliging of small towns and local businesses....

here is a small article that i found that explains a bit about their evil 
corporation:

Wal-Mart's everyday high costs
01:00 AM EDT on Wednesday, October 22, 2003


AMERICA WORSHIPS at the altar of Everyday Low Prices. That's how Wal-Mart 
can get away with ravaging American wages, benefits and the jobs themselves. 
That's how Wal-Mart can go on hollowing out America's downtowns -- and with 
taxpayer subsidies, to boot.

Wal-Mart is not the only big-box discounter turning the American countryside 
into a "crudscape" and its working people into paupers. But the monster 
leads the pack in terms of size and its holy crusade to cut costs. With $245 
billion in revenues last year, Wal-Mart is the world's largest company. 
Sales at the Bentonville, Ark.-based giant are bigger than the combined 
total of Home Depot, Target, Sears and Kroger.

Business Week described the "everyday low prices" slogan as the core value 
of "a cult masquerading as a company." All those yellow smiley faces and 
front-door "greeters" are part of a bigger strategy: to get rich off 
America's workers while undercutting them at every turn. What am I talking 
about? Here are the particulars:

-- Wal-Mart likes to call its sales clerks "associates," but "serfs" would 
be more like it. The company paid its salespeople an average $8.23 an hour 
in 2001. At that wage, a full-time worker made only $13,861 a year. The 
poverty level for a family of three was $14,630. Only 38 percent of 
Wal-Mart's workers have health coverage. It should surprise no one that 
nearly half of Wal-Mart's employees quit every year. (Before the recession, 
the annual turnover rate was 70 percent.)

-- Wal-Mart is destroying factory jobs in America. Example: Levi Strauss was 
one of the last apparel makers to actually produce stuff in the United 
States. But the made-in-America label means zip to Wal-Mart, which scours 
the globe's sweatshops for the sweetest prices. Demands for the cheapest 
jeans have forced Levi Strauss to shut down about a dozen U.S. plants. A 
factory in San Antonio is about to become the latest casualty.

Wal-Mart lobbies furiously in Washington for free-trade deals that guarantee 
a flood of goods made by pennies-an-hour labor ($12 billion worth from China 
alone last year). Small wonder America's manufacturers call Wal-Mart the 
Beast from Bentonville.

-- To Wal-Mart, unions are the devil and must be destroyed. Three years ago, 
meat cutters in Jacksonville, Texas, tried to establish the first Wal-Mart 
union. Eleven days after they joined the United Food and Commercial Workers, 
Wal-Mart closed all the meat-cutting departments at its stores and started 
buying pre-cut meat.

Wal-Mart is now on a rampage to devour the nation's supermarkets, and so 
threatens workers everywhere. Its Supercenter stores, which sell groceries, 
have already sent more than 20 national supermarket chains into bankruptcy. 
Wal-Mart has plans for 1,000 new Supercenters.

Terrified of a Wal-Mart invasion, California's three biggest supermarket 
chains have tried to lower their own costs by demanding concessions from 
their unionized employees. The result is a strike by 70,000 workers at 
supermarkets in southern California.

-- Wal-Mart is paving over America and destroying our communities. Its ugly 
boxes, plopped down on the edge of town, vacuum up business from local 
shopkeepers. (So much for any notion of customer loyalty.)

A group named Sprawl-Busters was formed 10 years ago to block Wal-Mart from 
forcing itself onto Greenfield, Mass. Every day, five or six towns from 
across the country contact Sprawl-Busters for advice on stopping a Wal-Mart, 
according to the group's founder, Al Norman. "It's not even about shopping," 
Norman says. "It's about how we relate to the places we live in. These towns 
are being changed economically, physically and socially."

-- Wal-Marts hurt surrounding communities. Iowa State University economist 
Kenneth Stone has studied the impact of Wal-Mart on rural Iowa. He found 
that some business districts benefited from a Wal-Mart but other towns 
within 20 miles suffered badly, with retail sales plummeting 25 percent 
after five years. Having lost their local merchants, the people in 
surrounding areas find themselves driving long distances to the Wal-Mart.

The line of groups calling for a boycott of Wal-Mart and its Sam's Club 
subsidiary grows by the week. As a former Wal-Mart customer, your author 
appreciates the lure of a good price. But there are competing values. When 
we understand the real cost of these "everyday low prices," they don't seem 
much of a bargain at all.

Froma Harrop is a Journal editorial writer and syndicated columnist. She may 
be reached by e-mail at: fharrop@projo.com.

_________________________________________________________________

good bets!  http://shopping.msn.com

Subject: [sfraves] NRR Re: [sfraves] wal(satan)mart xmas shopper ignored/trampled by
 crowd suffered seizure


Please stop sending me subliminal messages. ;)

satan...satan...satan...satan *foams at the mouth*

I saw this elsewhere. I dunno if this is the same story, but the last one
I read was pretty sensationalistic. Nonetheless, this kind of scene
doesn't surprise me at all. Wallmart, as a corporation, is pretty foul...
but I think we're all a little too quick to shovel the blame onto them.
What about the people that were actually involved in this mad mob scene?
It says something distinctly unpleasant about our culture when we will
turn into a ravening mob over a fucking dvd player, and nearly kill a
person in our consuming frenzy.

Personally, I hope this isn't just a 'rar stupid corporations' story for
people... but a 'gee golly gosh batman, maybe we need to stop being
wild-eyed herd animals' message. That human beings would do this to one
another over a piece of consumer electronics is disgusting. We should all
be ashamed.

S

Subject: Re: [sfraves] wal(satan)mart xmas shopper ignored/trampled by crowd suffered seizure

	Yes, such disgusting behavior could only come as a result of a mad  
frenzy induced by a sale at a large store like WalMart. Of course  
something like this could NEVER occur in the music scene. Right? (sigh)

http://www.newsday.com/news/nationworld/nation/chi- 
030217stampedelist,0,6283772.story?coll=ny-nationalnews-headlines

	Imagine you go to see an artist or DJ everyone's been talking about  
who's finally come to town. You wait for hours in a big crowd of people  
to get in, realizing that if there was a sudden rush for the door,  
you'd be in big trouble. But you get in OK, and the event totally goes  
off. You leave with a smile on your face. Some people wouldn't  
understand why you would spend big $$ to go listen to ear-splitting  
music in a smoky room in a room full of sweaty people in the middle of  
the night -- any more than you understand why they'd go to WalMart in  
the middle of the night to save big $$.

	You see the promoter on your way out, and he smiles at you and gives a  
wave. You're about to smile back and tell him how much you loved the  
show, when you remember what someone posted on SFRaves. So instead you  
yell at him, "You negligent f---, are you trying to get people killed  
with this crowd? I hope someone sues the bejeezus out of you!"

	After all, everybody knows WalMart is evil and must be blamed when  
something goes wrong, and you're not the kind of person to hold a  
double standard.

Groove on,
						<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: [sfraves] NRR/SRR: Re: "Christmas" Shopping

" Another thought is to
spend that energy on the wares of local artists and

Thanks for a great opportunity for me to post about
Phantom galleries on this list. I put SRR in since I
show my work at raves and I'm selling purses that are
plastic (rave goo washes right off, I checked.) and
glow in black light (no surprise if you have seen my
work!) LOL! Plus I'm selling some non commital
"Seasonal" cards.(if you are like me, and you don't
want to advertise your religion, but want your friends
and family to know you care and/or don't object to
theirs or like me come from a mixed family, they also
work well for unitarians) 

For those of you who are not farmilliar with Phantom
galleries, they take empty Retail space in Downtown
San Jose and use it to display local artists work.
They are only taking a 30% commission ( galleries
usualy take 50%) and the 30% goes directly to the
PhantoM Galleries Project. I like the project so much
that I happily kept my work at the "wholesale" price
because I want to support the project. I know other
artists are doing the same, some selling much below
their usual gallery price ( the limit for this show is
$150.)  This is the offical announcement:
 
We invite you to attend the Second Annual 
Holiday Gallery of Gifts 
featuring: I'm supposed to put my name here, but since
there are about 50 other artists participating I think
you should know that instead of me just puting my name
here.  

Grand Opening Artists' Reception: Friday, November
28th, 7pm -9 pm 
Light buffet, refreshments, entertainment and holiday
spirit! 

A wonderful assortment of original works of art,
textiles, jewelry, clothing, cards and unique gifts
for the holiday season as presented by over 50 local
artists and non-profit organizations. 

Gallery Location and Hours: 
55 South First Street (@ Post Street), Downtown San
Jose 
Mon. - Sat., Noon - 7pm, through December 20th, 2003 

Free parking after 6 pm and weekends at many downtown
lots, visit www.sjdowntownparking.com for more
information. 


The Holiday Gallery of Gifts is produced by Two Fish
Design Group, part of POPULUS Presents, a public space
activation collective coordinated by the San Jose
Downtown Association in partnership with the San Jose
Redevelopment Agency. For more information call
408-271-5151 or visit: www.POPULUSpresents.com

any respectable promoter and/or venue will shut the doors when the space
reaches a comfortable capacity, regardless of whether it is prior to the
legal capacity. they will also ensure that there is sufficient room to
move around in all areas, including hallways and other points of crowd
congestion.

i agree that irresponsible & money-hungry behavior occurs in all
businesses, including the music scene.

i disagree with the implication that people who object to behavior like
wal-mart's would tolerate the same type of behavior elsewhere in their
lives.

yes, i would confront a promoter who packed a venue to the point of
creating a dangerous situation... and i'd do it on my way out the door,
explaining why it would be my last time attending one of their events.


people over profit,

kimberley d.


p.s. it seems more relevant to discuss people who are creating public
spaces where intimacy & community are valued. most people already know the
places which are not doing that.

From sfraves-return-108530-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon Dec 01 05:51:48 2003

list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 511 invoked from network); 1 Dec 2003 05:51:46 -0000
Date: Sun, 30 Nov 2003 21:51:38 -0800
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII; format=flowed
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
To: ilove@seattletechno.com
From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <16376.12.242.136.13.1070249873.spork@webmail.seattletechno.com>
Message-Id: <6E4FB509-23C2-11D8-8AB5-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] wal(satan)mart xmas shopper ignored/trampled by  crowd suffered seizure

	Simply following a policy of "shut the doors when the space reaches 
capacity" will not eliminate risk of injury or death, because similar 
tragedies have occurred when a venue *stopped* letting people in and a 
crowd kept pressing forward when there was nowhere to go.

	There are two fundamental choices here:

(1) Pretend that total safety is an option, jump through hoops in 
pursuit of it, and look for someone to blame when something goes wrong, 
or

(2) Accept that life automatically comes with a certain amount of risk, 
take this into consideration, and make your choices accordingly.

	That woman who got trampled at WalMart was obviously there for the 
sale herself, and presumably was among the first in line in order to 
have been trampled by all the people coming up behind her.

	Of course nobody wants to be mean and add insult to injury by saying 
she should have taken responsibility for her own health condition, 
surroundings, and personal well-being by not placing herself in front 
of that crowd. We all feel sorry for her, so it's easier to blame the 
big, "evil," "greedy" corporation, or the "greedy" customers who didn't 
risk their own safety to try to stop in the middle of the onrushing 
crowd to render assistance.

	I'm not saying it was this woman's fault she got trampled. It was 
probably no one's fault. But looking for an external culprit whenever 
an accident occurs is in itself a symptom of greed -- the greed for 
money of the trial lawyers who make a killing on these types of 
lawsuits and who've got everybody looking for culprits who can pay, and 
the greed for power of government regulators who would like to take 
control of every aspect of your life in the name of making you safe.

	Ultimately, those who take responsibility for themselves are the ones 
who are safer. Nobody else can guarantee your safety, nor should they 
be expected to. Accidents happen, even though we all wish they didn't.

Groove on,
							<<< Starchild >>>

>> show, when you remember what someone posted on SFRaves. So instead you
>> yell at him, "You negligent f---, are you trying to get people killed
>> with this crowd? I hope someone sues the bejeezus out of you!"
>>
>> 	After all, everybody knows WalMart is evil and must be blamed when
>> something goes wrong, and you're not the kind of person to hold a
>> double standard.
>>
>> Groove on,
>> 						<<< Starchild >>>
>
>
> any respectable promoter and/or venue will shut the doors when the 
> space
> reaches a comfortable capacity, regardless of whether it is prior to 
> the
> legal capacity. they will also ensure that there is sufficient room to
> move around in all areas, including hallways and other points of crowd
> congestion.
>
> i agree that irresponsible & money-hungry behavior occurs in all
> businesses, including the music scene.
>
> i disagree with the implication that people who object to behavior like
> wal-mart's would tolerate the same type of behavior elsewhere in their
> lives.
>
> yes, i would confront a promoter who packed a venue to the point of
> creating a dangerous situation... and i'd do it on my way out the door,
> explaining why it would be my last time attending one of their events.
>
>
> people over profit,
>
> kimberley d.

> p.s. it seems more relevant to discuss people who are creating public
> spaces where intimacy & community are valued. most people already know 
> the
> places which are not doing that.

if you have given money to someone, whether they be wal-mart, a rave
promoter, or joe billy-bob, you probably had expectations about what you
would receive in return. true, those expectations shouldn't usurp your own
common sense... but i can't imagine expecting nothing from the business
that you financially supported.

anyway, it's all shades of gray and placing blame is an exercise in
futility. i don't think the people who denounced wal-mart were doing so in
direct response to that article, anyway.

kimberley d.
